story:
The Hall of the Rainbow Mage is a challenging, mid-level, site-based adventure designed for four to six characters.  

While investigating the disappearance of Londar Brightrain, also known as the Rainbow Mage, the party comes stumbles across dark, twisted plans and deadly secrets.  To make things worse, the traps and creatures left behind by Londar hamper the party’s attempt to find out what actually happened. Londar had illicit dealings with the thieves’ guild, for starters. And as if that weren't enough, throw in a rogue baron, a powerful magical artifact known as Horgrim’s Pyramid, add a forgotten temple of the war god, and mix well! 

The characters will end up following a strange path as they trace down the fate of the Rainbow Mage, with deadly surprises at every turn. The book will be over 50 pages long once layout is completed, making it one of the largest books we have offered on Indiegogo to date.

 

The Project 

Necromancer Games  projects on Indiegogo are simple, focused, and short.

  • Short in duration (2-3 weeks)
  • Fast delivery of PDF once funding is completed
  • Limited to a single title
  • Have options priced between $5-$30
  • Stretch goals and project bonuses (if any) affect the principle reward only (usually both the PDF and the softcover).
  • Are the only guaranteed method to get the premium* print copy (NOTE: the softcover versions  in this printing will not be sold on our website: see FAQ for explanation).
  • Have a simple fulfillment process that does not use Backerkit

*Premium means heavyweight glossy interior pages enhancing the art and color elements. The  thick, glossy cardstock brings out the vibrant color of the cover illustration. These are the nicest softcover books we have ever sold and we only print a title this way once.

Any reprint would use print on demand service that, although nice, do not approach the quality of our INDIEGOGO funded books.

Why the Tiny Print Run?

Since 2012 our crowdfunding approach has been extravagant in every way. Ambitious with massive page counts, plus numerous add-on options and stretch goals. All supporting a primary title itself as many as 990 pages.

This has resulted in Kickstarter's with memorable pledge rewards that include top-quality hardcover books with sometimes dozens of stretch goal bonuses and add-on extras. These are awesome AND they are expensive to buy for customers like you because they are very expensive to make for publishers like us.

 

Product enhancements tied to project success 

During the funding period for Hall of the Rainbow Mage and after the funding goal is met we will  improve the delivered product based on additional sales. There are no special tiered collectors editions or add-on purchase extras. Thus, as total project funding increases, the better the final product will be for everybody.

  • Examples of improvements made to earlier products:
  • Additional commissions for interior color art specific to the adventure. 
  • The previous Indiegogo project added 2 interior art pieces and 3 extra creature illustrations for its appendix.
  • Downloadable Options designed for popular virtual table-top software (The rewards for both How Orcus Stole Christmas! and In Vino Gigantus included the new creature/NPC tokens and player maps). 
  • High-resolution files of illustrations to share with players at the table.

 

Project Delivery

PDF Perks

We will email the instructions to all eligible supporters with instructions on accessing PDF items. The PDF files are distributed using Constant Contact service and our web store. You will need to have a customer account on the Necromancer Games website to get your PDF; it's how we keep track of everything and grants unlimited access by you to your reward.

The Indiegogo perk PDF files are 'purchased' at zero cost by supporters (as they are paid for during the Indiegogo promotion) at the Necromancer Games web store using a coupon code. That code we will be sent via Constant Contact to the address provided by Indiegogo. Please contact us with any questions/requests about this.

Softcover Perks

Softcover perks will be mailed to the address provided by us via Indiegogo. 

 

Overseas Shipping

For the last several months, as those of you who follow us on Discord know, we have been grappling with the issue of high costs on shipping to locations outside the USA. We have decided that the most cost-effective way for our overseas customers to get books is by printing the books in print-on-demand format. This does not affect the USA, where we will continue ordinary printing and shipping. 

The print-on-demand books international customers will be receiving are high quality, but please be aware that they are different from the premium-quality books we are advertising for sale in the USA.

We have tremendous love and respect for our international customers, and this is the most workable way we have been able to find to keep you supplied with books with reliable delivery times at a reasonable price.

story:
The story:

For nearly a year now, I have been combining my love for drawing with another form of art that is circus. The first card was designed just for fun but quickly got the support from many wonderful people from the circus community on Instagram. 

The deck has since grown into a much bigger project than I ever expected with inspirations from so many great circus artists and aerialists. 

Here, I present to you a novelty deck of card to celebrate the arts of circus and its practitioners. Whether you are an accomplished professional artist or someone who has just started learning your first climb, the important thing is to enjoy and appreciate the beauty in every movement.

What happen after you back this project

  • If the goal is not met, all the money you paid will return to you, so you are not losing anything.
  • If the goal is reached, I will send those who wanted the postcards an email to get the necessary information. Please check the FAQ for more questions about choosing the postcards.
  • Indiegogo takes 15 days to process the campaign funding.
  • Then both the playing cards and the postcards will be made and shipped to you.
  • The printing process is expected to take seven days. Shipping time depends on the destination and varies from 5 to 20 days.
  • The postcard will be sent separately but will arrive at a similar time.
  • Most backers should receive the cards in June.
  • If you were the inspiration to a card on this deck, a free postcard is included in any perk you pick.

Risks & Challenges

This is my first ever crowdfunding project, so I'm still learning every day. However, the card printing company that I'm working with is very experienced with projects of this type. I do not doubt that once the goals are reached, the cards will be delivered. 
It is possible that the printing and shipping will be slower than expected but I've already included extra time into my estimation, so this won't be likely. 

Indiegogo does not support Paypal so if you'd like to support using Paypal, please check out the FAQ and then contact me directly!


There are countries that I cannot ship to, and unfortunately, it's not up to the card company or me to decide. The 15 countries are listed in the FAQ.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

The project won't happen unless the final goal is reached so please share this with those you think might be interested.

story:
Gamebook is a hybrid, both an interactive book and a collection of board games.

Gamebook contains eight abstract strategy board games, carefully selected from the rich gaming heritage that represents human history, our intelligence, wit, strategy and appetite for fun, play and socialising - all gathered in one uniquely designed interactive book, for you to see, to read and most importantly - to play. Unlike most board games, Gamebook does not come in a box. Our quest was to think outside the box, pushing boundaries away from both traditional board game packaging and traditional book design. We aim to create a highly unique collection of board games for an international audience using high-quality design and production standards.

 

Gamebook is a collection of ancient abstract strategy board games: Surakarta, Tablut, Pachisi, Alquerque, Mu Torere, Senet, Nine Men’s Morris and Stern-halma.

We have searched the rich history of board games for untold stories. Gamebook contains eight abstract strategy board games, carefully selected from the rich world gaming heritage. Gamebook encompasses history, theory and practice of selected board games.

 

 

Assemble four boards of the Gamebook to create a new board game specially designed and developed for this edition!

 

Who is Gamebook for?

Gamebook contains board games ranging from two to six players. The board games were chosen based on their difficulty, from basic board games to ones requiring more complex strategies. Gamebook is appropriate for many different ages, so don't worry about who you invite to game night! :)

 

Aesthetics and Design

All selected games are re-designed to a unified graphic language, built of basic geometrical forms by a limited range of colours. Each game has been refined to include only the essential elements necessary for gameplay, and each game board is treated as abstract art based on the textures of different drawing materials.

 

Magic Binding

Gamebook features two innovative designs - the box for game pieces is also the book's backbone that holds the pages together with simple and very effective magnetic binding. Every page is simply plucked out when you want to play, and put back in; you can arrange the book as you like.

 

Playing pieces and instruction leaflet

Gamebook includes everything you need to start playing any of the board games. The backbone of the book contains a concealed department for all small figures, six two-sided sticks and a dice. The booklet History & Rules is included on the back page of the book. You can pluck it out and read it separately so it won’t disturb the game flow of the game you're playing.

 

Making Gamebook prototypes

Gamebook is mostly handcrafted. We have made several prototypes to find the best materials and a suitable shape for the book. Almost the entire book is made using recycled materials. The core of the pages and box are cardboard, and we used recycled paper for the pages and for the History & Rules booklet. The figures and dice are made of wood. The rest is a secret! 

If you are interested in the story of Gamebook’s creation, especially the making of Gamebook prototypes you can follow us (Hibird Books) on Instagram or Facebook.

 

Book Specification

  • Book dimensions: 32 x 28 x 2,2 cm (12.6"x11"x0.86") 
  • Game boards dimensions: 28 x 28 cm (11"x11") 
  • Weight: 1,2 kg (2.64 Ibs)

 

Timetable

We have spent the last year researching board game history and designing and testing our Gamebook. All aspects of our designs have been thoroughly considered at each stage of the product creation process, from concept design, materials and technical aspects to numerous prototypes. It’s been a wonderful journey, and now we’re almost ready for the manufacturing stage. If you know any friends, family, colleagues or random strangers who may be interested in our project, please help us spread the word! You can expect to receive your order by December 2018.

 

 

Gamebook trilogy

Research about board games has revealed a whole new world. The history of board games is full of mysteries, myths and secrets. We have created a collection of forgotten board game classics. These games are the foundation of so many modern board games. We have chosen eight board games for the first edition of Gamebook, but we would love to continue our investigation and search for lost board games around the world. There are so many more games to find, explore, study and publish. We want to make a Gamebook collection — possibly a Gamebook trilogy.

 

People behind the project

Founders:

  • Hana Jesih (founder of Gamebook) is a book designer & illustrator who loves to make mind-maps, travel and is taller than Peter. You can see her other book design projects on her website.
  • Peter Plantan (cofounder of Gamebook) is an architect who hates and loves everything at the same time and is a fan of Anthony Bourdain.

Video Credits:

  • Nejc Gazvoda is a film director and writer. He was in charge of the script and directing the video. He wanted to use slider in the video, we made his wish come true.
  • Marko Pirc takes credit for photography and shooting the presentation video. His favourite sandwich is chips with sausage and chips on the top.
  • Voice over: Michael Manske 
  • Song: "Jadranje", from the original soundtrack for the film "Pot v raj" composed by Andi Koglot and Laren Polic Zdravič.

 

THANK YOU

Special thanks to NEJC GAZVODA, friend no.1. Big thanks to STAŠ STANKOVIČ and MARKO PIRC from LUMULABS for all advices. They also let us work on the presentation in their office and lent us their equipment and gadgets. MARUŠA HREN for all her tips and help with bookbinding, MILENA JAKOVLJEVIČ from MEDIODROM for tips in mediamarketing, JURE TURK for IT support, NIKO KLANŠEK for business support, GREGA PLANTAN for legal advice, SAMO KRALJ for producing wooden playing sticks, IVO VESELIČ for his own versions of texts and our FAMILY for moral support and food. Thanks also to all other friends who helped us in any kind of way. ;)

 

Risks and challenges

During the process of making the Gamebook prototypes, we collaborated with different print shops and book manufacturers. On a technical level, the pages and binding, even though they are innovative, shouldn't present any major manufacturing difficulties. The final look and materials may change a little bit in the production process, but only to improve the durability and sustainability of the product. The main task will be to manufacture a box for figures and dice that satisfies the level of craftsmanship we stand for. Considering all the facts, we believe that everything is possible if you stand by your goals and believe in your product. We believe in ours. We will try to keep the process as simple as possible. Support our project, and in return we'll send you your own edition of Gamebook. If you have any questions or concerns, don't hesitate to post them in the comment section.

story:
Here we are! In another crazy project!

 

Yes, this time the project is really peculiar!

In our family we have 4 nieces and of course they are super in love with princesses, and various fairy tales, that they make us read or see on repeat!

 

At a certain point we asked ourselves what would happen if the princesses weren't so sweet and cute anymore, but they would get angry and go crazy?

 

And here is the result!

 

In addotion we discovered that the classic fairy tales, the original ones, are anything but cheerful, they are dark and disturbing!

Another good reason for our girls to go crazy!

 

By now 3D miniatures are an established reality.

When in 2017 we launched the first kickstarter with this formula many called us heretics, avant-gardists and dreamers.

 

Today, just 4 years later, it is a widespread market and a reality that is increasingly entering people's homes.

 

And we are proud to have been the forerunners of this new technology and therefore also on this occasion we offer our sculptures in stl version ready for your 3D printer!

 

PLEASE NOTE - This Kickstarter is for digital files (STLs) to make all these items on your own home 3D printer - these are not physical goods **

 

 

All models have been presupported (where necessary)

Several printing tests have been carried out to get the Best result possible, and we hope that you will also get an optimal result with your printers.

 

cross lances is committed, as always, to solving any problem you may encounter in printing, fixing the files and creating together with you an ever-improving product.

 

Also this project has many sculptures and many varieties: we thought to satisfy as many people as possible: from collectors who love to print their miniature in resin and paint it, from fantasy football players who in recent years have often supported us, and also to those who are dedicated to filament printing and love scenery and decorative elements.

 

So let's go to present all our sculptures!

 

The first set is about Alice's fantastic adventure in Wonderland!

 

We decided to accompany it with three classic characters: cheshire cat , queen of hearts and mad hatter.


Here we introduce a new famous fairy tale: Beauty and the Beast.

It seems that its origin is inspired by an event that really happened in Italy, in Viterbo in 1550.

But then various versions have followed in history.


Sleeping Beauty is another classic fairy tale that has been passed down through time and come down to us.

We have documented a bit on the history of this fairy tale, and the first versions are anything but cheerful, indeed they are very disturbing and not suitable for children, if you are curious I recommend you to document and you will be amazed, and perhaps horrified



 

Little Red Riding Hood

 

It's not a princess, no that's true, but it's perhaps the most famous fairy tale of all!

 

This story also underwent several changes in the story going to cut very bad scenes and inserting a happy ending.

In the past the stories didn't end very well I would say....

From what we have been able to learn, this is the oldest fable that we are going to discuss.

It seems in fact that the origins date back even to the Egyptians, and over three hundred versions have been made in history.

Traveling around the world has collected variants from China, Persia, Russia, England and who knows how many others up to the present day.

Another traditional fairy tale.

This time the origins are Danish and we can say that it has more recent origins, in fact it was published for the first time in 1837.

But even here the story is a little different from what we remember, and the ending is rather sad.

This story has also undergone numerous variations over time and has traveled throughout Europe, there are many ways in which the prince becomes human again.

 

The most famous is surely, as often happens, the one created by the Grimm brothers.

 

Rapunzel is another classic in the history of fairy tales.

The myth of the maiden locked in the tower has its origins in ancient Greece with the mythological figure of Danae.

But it seems that the true origins of the story come from Italy from a racocnto of 1634.

Also here multiple versions and variations, some more alelgre, others decidedly less happy.

 

And here's the prince!

Yes, because in every good fairy tale there is a prince!

But we wanted to interpret him in a nice way:

Going to know more about the classic fairy tales and how they have evolved in history we discovered that these princes were often not so beautiful, good and kind.

So we imagined that the princesses got in the way of the prince in revenge for his misdeeds, and he was put to "work".

 

Hoping this is nice and doesn't offend anyone!

 

We decided to dedicate a small area also to lovers of scenic and filament printing.

 

We created this castle, partly modular, in fact you can freely assemble the pieces in order to create the composition you prefer.

 

The castle is in fact composed of 16 elements!

 

inspired by the most famous fairy-tale castles in northern Europe.



 

We said we would make a small dedication to our Fantasy Football supporters as well and here it is!

 

Sculpting the seven dwarves from Snow White we realized that a team of dwarves with this design would be beautiful!

 

 

Pumpkin carriage.

Maybe it would have been better on halloween but we liked carving it anyway.

 

Inside we left it open for those who wish to turn it into a lamp.

 

This time it's Sissi's turn, when we talk about princesses, we can't help but think of her, even if she doesn't belong to a traditional fairy tale but is a historical character who really existed.

 

Here is our interpretation of Princess Sissi!

 

 

Here is the dice throwing tower!

 

 

 

Here is the white rabbit!

 

We went to sculpt another of the most famous princesses: the princess on a pea!

 

We have made another of the most famous fairy tales in the world: the three little pigs!

 

Okay, they're not exactly princely, but we think they might like it! 

Also this time we have moved away from the world of princesses, but it is a fairy tale that is very close to our heart, from the tales of Collodi here is Pinocchio and the Turquoise Fairy!

 

 

A whole new team made of many little pinocchios.

We really liked the pinocchio sculpture so much that we decided to make a whole team.

With the addition of a fire-eater!

We hope you like it too!

What would a fairy tale be without a dragon?



And finally here it is for you, all our princesses (but not only) without weapons.

By buying the rights of these files you will be allowed to:

- print the 3D miniatures

- print them for friends

- Print in 3D and resell the printed miniature in 3D

-use render-prints and other derivatives of the file for promotional purposes. -modify the file according to needs and educational purposes

- Modified derivative files may be sold printed in 3D

-use the models inside videogames, indicating their origin -use templates for videos and creative projects

Not allowed:

- Use the files to create molds for mass production

- sell the files for profit

- distribute the file to third parties

-sell the sculptures to shopkeepers and retailers

-grant intellectual rights to third parties

-Authorize third parties to sell the sculptures, in any form whatsoever

-indicate crosslances studio as assistance for sculptures sold to clients.

-use the sculptures for profit in any form not specified in the contract

-sell any intellectual property of crosslances and colalboratories without having signed this contract

any item not specified in the contract shall be deemed unauthorised unless expressly permitted by crosslances, in which case please contact us prior to purchase.

It is asked in addition to cite study crosslances where possible.

For all the remaining details we stick to the common creative.

At the end of the kickstarter you will receive a signed return contract which will summarize these conditions.

Crosslances studios is founded by 3 artists and their commons passion for the world of games. Students at the Comics courses in Florence, made by the greebo games sculptures, they approached the world of miniatures. It has actually become a revelant studio in the world of miniatures and digital miniatures prototyping. Our products can be found in many places, we had collaborations with: Labmasu, Megalith Godslayer, Hidden Dreams, Minuteman miniatures, Fireforge , and many others.
story_txt: Here we are! In another crazy project! Yes, this time the project is really peculiar!In our family we have 4 nieces and of course they are super in love with princesses, and various fairy tales, that they make us read or see on repeat! At a certain point we asked ourselves what would happen if the princesses weren't so sweet and cute anymore, but they would get angry and go crazy? And here is the result! In addotion we discovered that the classic fairy tales, the original ones, are anything but cheerful, they are dark and disturbing!Another good reason for our girls to go crazy! By now 3D miniatures are an established reality.When in 2017 we launched the first kickstarter with this formula many called us heretics, avant-gardists and dreamers. Today, just 4 years later, it is a widespread market and a reality that is increasingly entering people's homes. And we are proud to have been the forerunners of this new technology and therefore also on this occasion we offer our sculptures in stl version ready for your 3D printer! PLEASE NOTE - This Kickstarter is for digital files (STLs) to make all these items on your own home 3D printer - these are not physical goods **  All models have been presupported (where necessary)Several printing tests have been carried out to get the Best result possible, and we hope that you will also get an optimal result with your printers. cross lances is committed, as always, to solving any problem you may encounter in printing, fixing the files and creating together with you an ever-improving product. Also this project has many sculptures and many varieties: we thought to satisfy as many people as possible: from collectors who love to print their miniature in resin and paint it, from fantasy football players who in recent years have often supported us, and also to those who are dedicated to filament printing and love scenery and decorative elements. So let's go to present all our sculptures! The first set is about Alice's fantastic adventure in Wonderland! We decided to accompany it with three classic characters: cheshire cat , queen of hearts and mad hatter.Here we introduce a new famous fairy tale: Beauty and the Beast.It seems that its origin is inspired by an event that really happened in Italy, in Viterbo in 1550.But then various versions have followed in history.Sleeping Beauty is another classic fairy tale that has been passed down through time and come down to us.We have documented a bit on the history of this fairy tale, and the first versions are anything but cheerful, indeed they are very disturbing and not suitable for children, if you are curious I recommend you to document and you will be amazed, and perhaps horrified Little Red Riding Hood It's not a princess, no that's true, but it's perhaps the most famous fairy tale of all! This story also underwent several changes in the story going to cut very bad scenes and inserting a happy ending.In the past the stories didn't end very well I would say....From what we have been able to learn, this is the oldest fable that we are going to discuss.It seems in fact that the origins date back even to the Egyptians, and over three hundred versions have been made in history.Traveling around the world has collected variants from China, Persia, Russia, England and who knows how many others up to the present day.Another traditional fairy tale.This time the origins are Danish and we can say that it has more recent origins, in fact it was published for the first time in 1837.But even here the story is a little different from what we remember, and the ending is rather sad.This story has also undergone numerous variations over time and has traveled throughout Europe, there are many ways in which the prince becomes human again. The most famous is surely, as often happens, the one created by the Grimm brothers. Rapunzel is another classic in the history of fairy tales.The myth of the maiden locked in the tower has its origins in ancient Greece with the mythological figure of Danae.But it seems that the true origins of the story come from Italy from a racocnto of 1634.Also here multiple versions and variations, some more alelgre, others decidedly less happy. And here's the prince!Yes, because in every good fairy tale there is a prince!But we wanted to interpret him in a nice way:Going to know more about the classic fairy tales and how they have evolved in history we discovered that these princes were often not so beautiful, good and kind.So we imagined that the princesses got in the way of the prince in revenge for his misdeeds, and he was put to "work". Hoping this is nice and doesn't offend anyone! We decided to dedicate a small area also to lovers of scenic and filament printing. We created this castle, partly modular, in fact you can freely assemble the pieces in order to create the composition you prefer. The castle is in fact composed of 16 elements! inspired by the most famous fairy-tale castles in northern Europe. We said we would make a small dedication to our Fantasy Football supporters as well and here it is! Sculpting the seven dwarves from Snow White we realized that a team of dwarves with this design would be beautiful!  Pumpkin carriage.Maybe it would have been better on halloween but we liked carving it anyway. Inside we left it open for those who wish to turn it into a lamp. This time it's Sissi's turn, when we talk about princesses, we can't help but think of her, even if she doesn't belong to a traditional fairy tale but is a historical character who really existed. Here is our interpretation of Princess Sissi!  Here is the dice throwing tower!   Here is the white rabbit! We went to sculpt another of the most famous princesses: the princess on a pea! We have made another of the most famous fairy tales in the world: the three little pigs! Okay, they're not exactly princely, but we think they might like it! Also this time we have moved away from the world of princesses, but it is a fairy tale that is very close to our heart, from the tales of Collodi here is Pinocchio and the Turquoise Fairy!  A whole new team made of many little pinocchios.We really liked the pinocchio sculpture so much that we decided to make a whole team.With the addition of a fire-eater!We hope you like it too!What would a fairy tale be without a dragon?And finally here it is for you, all our princesses (but not only) without weapons.By buying the rights of these files you will be allowed to:- print the 3D miniatures- print them for friends- Print in 3D and resell the printed miniature in 3D-use render-prints and other derivatives of the file for promotional purposes. -modify the file according to needs and educational purposes- Modified derivative files may be sold printed in 3D-use the models inside videogames, indicating their origin -use templates for videos and creative projectsNot allowed:- Use the files to create molds for mass production- sell the files for profit- distribute the file to third parties-sell the sculptures to shopkeepers and retailers-grant intellectual rights to third parties-Authorize third parties to sell the sculptures, in any form story:
• 81 plastic components
  • An easy to follow manual
  • A slick white box to place the completed model onto

The parts will come in a high quality, gloss finish white box. This acts as a reflective surface upon which you can view your bridge when it's finished — just like the water of the River Cam reflecting the complex design in Cambridge.


You have the choice of three bridges:


Ying & Yang Limited Edition - only 80 available so back this soon!

 


You will receive black and white pieces that you can use to create your own unique model. This also comes with:
 

  • A one off chess board display
     
  • A certificate of authentication


There are only 81 of these that have been made and created especially for Indiegogo, (no. 81 has been given to our sponsors). We recommend that you back this reward as soon as you can.
 

Black bridge kit - if you want a stark black on white contrast for a minimalist style.


White bridge kit - if you either want to paint the bridge to make it more realistic, or just prefer the colour scheme.

 


The Mathematical Bridge was first built back in 1749 over The River Cam in Cambridge, England. Its distinctive design and rather mythic status has made it one of the most unusual yet iconic sights in the popular university city.
 



Its arched structure is special, as it’s based on a philosophy of function over form, every beam supports every other beam that it's connecting to and vice versa. This means that every part has an important place in its construction.



It is said that when the bridge was first designed it was made without any nuts or bolts, and stayed up due to mathematical principles alone. Although this is a myth, the design is really quite spectacular and offers a great opportunity to understand other bridge designs.
 

We’re very passionate about bringing the bridge’s unique design into the hands of those interested in the complexities of engineering, fascinated by structural design or just to anyone who’s fond of Cambridge and the beauty of the bridge in real life.
 


The concept of the bridge can be related to countless other bridge designs around the world and for this reason it is invaluable information for anyone interested in bridges and architecture.


 


 





We are offering the chance to come along to the River Cam for a bespoke tour by the creator of the bridge. You will see all of the main sights including Kings College, Trinity College, and of course The Mathematical Bridge.
 


You can redeem the punt tour whenever the campaign is over, but we will be in contact once it is so we can organise a time that suits you best.
 


Punting is a great way to spend the day with family and friends, so come along and learn all about the history of Cambridge.
 

Many parents want to get their children into STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics). With that in mind, we believe that outside of the professional industry it’s important for youngsters to practice the skill of modelling from a young age to enhance their engineering minds. This gives them a foundation of knowledge that they can draw on throughout their lives.

We are passionate about getting people young and old into Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics.

We believe it's best to get kids into engineering from a young age using interesting and goal-driven activities. What started with Lego and Meccano should carry on and should give a solid, inspiring goal for all people who like being creative.


 


 


 


We currently have all the manufacturers, printers and infrastructure secured for The Mathematical Bridge Project.

Now that these important initial steps are finished, we are looking to launch the kit to as many people as possible. We need funding to get the units made, finalised and sent out to our customers worldwide. This will enable us to bring you more projects in the future and involve more people from around the world in creating them.

We felt this would present the perfect opportunity to offer a discounted price for end users, possible suppliers and international clients as it is currently up for sale in Cambridge only.

So don't miss out on the chance to buy one before it’s too late!

 

 

 

About the creator:

 

 

I am an aerospace engineering graduate and I am looking to find a rewarding place to fit in within the industry of engineering by helping people realise their engineering and modelling interests. I have worked in education (teaching young children), engineering (CAD/ CAM) and also tourism in Cambridge punting around the mathematical bridge, where I came upon the inspiration to create the Mathematical Bridge model. I am interested in creating an excitement for structural design, engineering and manufacturing and I believe this product is a great resource to educate and entertain.

story:
Game That Song is a party game for music lovers.  

If you love music, you’ll love playing Game That Song.  Music opens the doors to deeper connections that other card games can’t.

"It's my favorite thing to do.  Whenever anyone comes over we play it." - Stef M.

"We played until 2am.  I didn't want to stop!" - Chris D.

"This game is my jam.  Literally!" - Erin S.

"I couldn't stop thinking about it the day after I played it for the first time!" - Kim R.

We’ve been testing and refining the game for a year and a half, and we can’t wait to share it with the Indiegogo community.

story:
Millennium Hobbies & The Gundam Kitchen opened in December 2014 to bring South Jersey a new type of hobby store experience.  Not only would the store present gunpla right when you walk in the door, it would also carry tools, paints, host events, and provide the knowledge to help new and seasoned builders.  In early 2017 miniature war gaming was added to the mix and we have grown a great group of gamers who meet on Wednesday nights for game night.  If you have spent any time in this store you know this is not your everyday store and with the growth of our gaming and gunpla community it is time for more space to better serve you.  More space will mean that we can have gaming 7 days a week and still have plenty of space for classes. We will also have plenty of available hobbying tables for the classic Gundam Kitchen experience of hanging out and building all day. The additional space will also provide more floor space for product, displays, and storage space.  With more storage we will be able to keep deeper stock and better serve our instore customer and our new After Dark Facebook Live Shop customers.

The goal is to be opened in our new location in downtown Blackwood (https://goo.gl/maps/6ZhvJisnCh72) by the first week of October so that we can be established in our new location before the holiday season.  We are looking to raise $8500 to help with the following expenses:

  • $1250 for signage
  • $2500 for flooring
  • $1000 fixtures and display cases
  • $1000 gaming tables, chairs, and terrain
  • $500 decorative touches
  • $250 hot water dispenser for instant noodles
  • $500 for glass front fridge
  • $1500 for paint and paint racks: citadel rack, Mr. Gundam colors, Alclad, and Tamiya spray

These expenses are a portion of the costs involved with moving to a new location and your help will greatly improve the new store experience.  Any money raised over the 8,500 will go toward increasing the product selection and more amenities for the space such as additional TVs.  If we do go over $8500 all contributors will receive a onetime 15% off coupon (expires November 15, 2018).

Your generous donations will be rewarded with the following perks (perks stack):

  • $25 donation, custom Gundam Kitchen chopsticks
  • $50 donation, custom painting stand
  • $100 donation, Gundam Kitchen Haro logo bowl
  • $250 donation, $25 Millennium Hobbies gift card
  • $450 donation, fat head decal of your head on a SD or gaming character displayed on the store wall
  • $1000 donation, your choice of any in stock PG or gaming starter set (expires November 15, 2018)

Please share this campaign with friends, family, and online groups.  Even if someone is not local they may be interested in visiting the store or interested in supporting small businesses. 

If you would also like to volunteer your help with the physical move and/or building out the new space , please contact me on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/thegundamkitchen) in mid September.

story:
The City that Dripped Blood
An Adventure for Fifth Edition and Swords & Wizardry!

Frog God Games is proud to announce The City that Dripped Blood, the first in a four part series centered in and around the city Temelpa.  This mid-level adventure is written by D & D Legend Steve Winter, whose credits include over 30 years of best selling games, adventures, and supplements for some of the most popular RPG companies in the industry.  He has played a part in many of the most beloved titles from Star Frontiers to the Fifth Edition rule books. He was a contributor most recently to the Frog God Games' Quests of Doom 4 series. Steve's incredible legacy and experience in the RPG world makes The City that Dripped Blood a perfect Indiegogo project debut title. 

Overview

Temelpa, an ancient walled city on a forgotten trade route, thought to be abandoned ages ago, and now, the adventurers find themselves besieged within. 

Unable to leave their refuge, the adventurers will quickly discover the city is inhabited, not deserted as initially believed, by an ancient society. They will soon be embroiled in the affairs of a twisted caste system built on servitude and cannibalism and headed by an inter-dimensional vampiric overlord.

This open-ended adventure allows the GM to unleash an array of unique monsters, factional power struggles, and intriguing plots upon the characters as they fight and scheme to stay alive, entrapped in a hostile city where they are viewed as useful pawns or a tasty exotic meal.

Can the characters hold out until the siege is broken and escape with their lives? Will they champion the cause of the downtrodden and upend the social order? Or will they be the main course for the next cannibalistic feast?

Welcome to the City!

The Adventure

The City That Dripped Blood - available in either Fifth Edition or Swords & Wizardry versions, is an adventure for mid-level characters inside you will find-

  • New creatures and new variants
  • NPC Cultists and unusual citizens are spread across various districts and factions.
  • All under the shadow of the two ziggurats which stand menacing guard over the decrepit. desert city where the player characters begin.
  • Options for and potential hooks are provided, but the design lends itself to modifications, GM tailored for their ongoing campaigns.

 

The Tiny Print Run

Why Indiegogo?

Frog God Games is testing a new approach with the launch of this project- almost the inverse of how we design our crowdfunding projects on Kickstarter. We call it the 'Tiny Print Run'.

Thus, Indiegogo projects by Frog God Games will-

  • Be short in duration
  • Be limited to a single title
  • Have options priced between $5-$30
  • Have simple fulfillment process that does not use Backerkit

Since 2012 our crowdfunding approach has been extravagant in every way. Ambitious with massive page counts, plus numerous add-on options and stretch goals. All supporting a primary title itself as many as 990 pages.

This has resulted in Kickstarter's with memorable pledge rewards that include top-quality hardcover books with sometimes dozens of stretch goal bonuses and add-on extras. These are awesome AND they are expensive.

Is Frog God Games giving up on Kickstarter?

No. Far from it, in fact these smaller projects are happening in response to the feedback we have heard from both fans and 'almost' fans alike. We hear the request for less expensive options for our projects and products all the time. A second frequent desire expressed to us, whether at conventions, on social media or in email, is for a larger selection of smaller, faster-paced adventures that can be completed in 2-3 sessions and not necessitate a full two year campaign.

Additionally,  Frog God Games has grown in both sales and audience awareness.  This opportunity will give us the additional resources to invest in the very best books in all of our formats. Thus we have launched the first of, what we hope are frequent, 'Tiny Print Run' campaigns on Indiegogo.

Project Reward

With the wishes of the fans in mind, this and future Indiegogo projects will fund standalone projects that are both affordable and fun. This project, as well future Tiny Print Run projects, is narrowly focused. This meansThe City that Dripped Blood  will only have two reward options-

1. A softcover, full-color copy of The City that Dripped Blood which is at least 24 pages long and includes the PDF version

or

2. The City that Dripped Blood in PDF

There will be no paid add-on options and all additional funds raised focus on making the highest quality module the funding can buy.  Supporters will select a rules system when they make the reward selection. For City that Dripped Blood that is a choice between Fifth Edition or Swords & Wizardry (other systems or system agnostic content is possible with future projects).

As of the project launch The City that Dripped Blood  manuscript is complete for Fifth Edition. It is currently being edited and converted to Swords & Wizardry. The module will be published, what is unknown is how much we raise to improve this release for everyone.

What more supporters will mean for the project

The level of quality we want to bring to The City of Dripped Blood is, at a minimum, similar softcover releases from larger companies. An example of this is a Wizards of the Coast Adventurer's League softcover. We have the potential to do even better and that is what 18 days will be focused on.

The best way surpass our quality goal for every supporter (PDF only and/or Print and PDF) is-

  • Commission more art from top artists
  • Create more cartography pieces/offer more mapping resources
  • Create PDF player handouts like creature cards or treasure maps
  • Other options that are cutting edge and unique which only funding makes possible

The first and most important is to invest in top-quality, custom color art beginning with the cover. At Frog God we have a dedicated gentleman named Casey Christofferson whose job it is to procure great art. His only constraint is his budget, which is were supporters like you come in.

The biggest milestone will be upgrading from a planned half-page illustration to a full-page color cover by a top artist similar to the examples above. After we have enough funding for the cover we will add additional internal art pieces (possibly full page).

Softcover Specific Goals

  • The best paper we can afford. Glossy durable pages that showcase the art as it deserves.
  • A thick, glossy cover stock
  • Maps/charts/tables reprinted on the interior covers for reference (duplex cover printing)
  • Signed copies
  • and a few really special options if the funding really takes off

NOTE ON AVAILABILITY: The softcover is likely to be a single print run. The number of units we print will be determined by how many supporters choose the The City of Dripped Blood softcover. We have no plans to offer the softcover for general sale after this project ends, so this is the best way to guarantee a copy for yourself in print.

Shipping and Distribution

Shipping is simple for those who select the a softcover copy of The City of Dripped Blood. 

Softcover Shipping

  • $5 shipping fee will be added upon checkout for supporters in the United States.
  • $15 shipping fee will be added upon checkout for supporters in the European Union, Australia, New Zealand and Canada.
  • The PDF that comes with the softcover option will be fulfilled as outlined below.

PDF Distribution

  • The digital copies will be fulfilled using the Frog God Games Website.
  • There will be no pledge manager so once the book or PDF is ready we will fulfill using contact information from Indiegogo.
story_txt:
The City that Dripped BloodAn Adventure for Fifth Edition and Swords & Wizardry!
Frog God Games is proud to announce The City that Dripped Blood, the first in a four part series centered in and around the city Temelpa.  This mid-level adventure is written by D & D Legend Steve Winter, whose credits include over 30 years of best selling games, adventures, and supplements for some of the most popular RPG companies in the industry.  He has played a part in many of the most beloved titles from Star Frontiers to the Fifth Edition rule books. He was a contributor most recently to the Frog God Games' Quests of Doom 4 series. Steve's incredible legacy and experience in the RPG world makes The City that Dripped Blood a perfect Indiegogo project debut title. OverviewTemelpa, an ancient walled city on a forgotten trade route, thought to be abandoned ages ago, and now, the adventurers find themselves besieged within. Unable to leave their refuge, the adventurers will quickly discover the city is inhabited, not deserted as initially believed, by an ancient society. They will soon be embroiled in the affairs of a twisted caste system built on servitude and cannibalism and headed by an inter-dimensional vampiric overlord.This open-ended adventure allows the GM to unleash an array of unique monsters, factional power struggles, and intriguing plots upon the characters as they fight and scheme to stay alive, entrapped in a hostile city where they are viewed as useful pawns or a tasty exotic meal.Can the characters hold out until the siege is broken and escape with their lives? Will they champion the cause of the downtrodden and upend the social order? Or will they be the main course for the next cannibalistic feast?Welcome to the City!The AdventureThe City That Dripped Blood - available in either Fifth Edition or Swords & Wizardry versions, is an adventure for mid-level characters inside you will find-
New creatures and new variants
NPC Cultists and unusual citizens are spread across various districts and factions.
All under the shadow of the two ziggurats which stand menacing guard over the decrepit. desert city where the player characters begin.
Options for and potential hooks are provided, but the design lends itself to modifications, GM tailored for their ongoing campaigns.
 The Tiny Print RunWhy Indiegogo?Frog God Games is testing a new approach with the launch of this project- almost the inverse of how we design our crowdfunding projects on Kickstarter. We call it the 'Tiny Print Run'.Thus, Indiegogo projects by Frog God Games will-
Be short in duration
Be limited to a single title
Have options priced between $5-$30
Have simple fulfillment process that does not use Backerkit
Since 2012 our crowdfunding approach has been extravagant in every way. Ambitious with massive page counts, plus numerous add-on options and stretch goals. All supporting a primary title itself as many as 990 pages.This has resulted in Kickstarter's with memorable pledge rewards that include top-quality hardcover books with sometimes dozens of stretch goal bonuses and add-on extras. These are awesome AND they are expensive.Is Frog God Games giving up on Kickstarter?No. Far from it, in fact these smaller projects are happening in response to the feedback we have heard from both fans and 'almost' fans alike. We hear the request for less expensive options for our projects and products all the time. A second frequent desire expressed to us, whether at conventions, on social media or in email, is for a larger selection of smaller, faster-paced adventures that can be completed in 2-3 sessions and not necessitate a full two year campaign.Additionally,  Frog God Games has grown in both sales and audience awareness.  This opportunity will give us the additional resources to invest in the very best books in all of our formats. Thus we have launched the first of, what we hope are frequent, 'Tiny Print Run' campaigns on Indiegogo.Project RewardWith the wishes of the fans in mind, this and future Indiegogo projects will fund standalone projects that are both affordable and fun. This project, as well future Tiny Print Run projects, is narrowly focused. This meansThe City that Dripped Blood  will only have two reward options-1. A softcover, full-color copy of The City that Dripped Blood which is at least 24 pages long and includes the PDF versionor2. The City that Dripped Blood in PDFThere will be no paid add-on options and all additional funds raised focus on making the highest quality module the funding can buy.  Supporters will select a rules system when they make the reward selection. For City that Dripped Blood that is a choice between Fifth Edition or Swords & Wizardry (other systems or system agnostic content is possible with future projects).As of the project launch The City that Dripped Blood  manuscript is complete for Fifth Edition. It is currently being edited and converted to Swords & Wizardry. The module will be published, what is unknown is how much we raise to improve this release for everyone.What more supporters will mean for the projectThe level of quality we want to bring to The City of Dripped Blood is, at a minimum, similar softcover releases from larger companies. An example of this is a Wizards of the Coast Adventurer's League softcover. We have the potential to do even better and that is what 18 days will be focused on.The best way surpass our quality goal for every supporter (PDF only and/or Print and PDF) is-
Commission more art from top artists
Create more cartography pieces/offer more mapping resources
Create PDF player handouts like creature cards or treasure maps
Other options that are cutting edge and unique which only funding makes possible
The first and most important is to invest in top-quality, custom color art beginning with the cover. At Frog God we have a dedicated gentleman named Casey Christofferson whose job it is to procure great art. His only constraint is his budget, which is were supporters like you come in.The biggest milestone will be upgrading from a planned half-page illustration to a full-page color cover by a top artist similar to the examples above. After we have enough funding for the cover we will add additional internal art pieces (possibly full page).Softcover Specific Goals
The best paper we can afford. Glossy durable pages that showcase the art as it deserves.
A thick, glossy cover stock
Maps/charts/tables reprinted on the interior covers for reference (duplex cover printing)
Signed copies
and a few really special options if the funding really takes off
NOTE ON AVAILABILITY: The softcover is likely to be a single print run. The number of units we print will be determined by how many supporters choose the The City of Dripped Blood softcover. We have no plans to offer the softcover for general sale after this project ends, so this is the best way to guarantee a copy for yourself in print.Shipping and DistributionShipping is simple for those who select the a softcover copy of The City of Dripped Blood. Softcover Shipping
$5 shipping fee will be added upon checkout for supporters in the United States.
$15 shipping fee will be added upon checkout for supporters in the European Union, Australia, New Zealand and Canada.
The PDF that comes with the softcover option will be fulfilled as outlined below.
PDF Distribution
The digital copies will be fulfilled using the Frog God Games Website.
There will be no pledge manager so once the book or PDF is ready we will fulfill using contact information from Indiegogo.

story:
Sequel to our Book of Taverns 1, the Book of Taverns Two  gives you two more strange watering-holes for your fantasy RPG game. Both of these system-neutral taverns offer NPCs for the characters to interact with (or slay), a diverting history, convenient descriptions, and compelling adventure hooks.

The Witch’s Teat is a tavern cursed with a portal to hell itself. As one can imagine, the management has found ways to take advantage of it, and the characters might be in for a very interesting time when they make their visit. 

Quintain’s Tower presents a tavern off the beaten path with a bizarre clientele: ogres and goblinoids! The ruins of this once mighty human fortress have become a drinking spot, meet-up, and trade bazaar for the many dangerous humanoids dwelling in the area. The old castle holds many secrets, not the least of which is a pair of rival cults. Management recommends the steamed spider legs.

COVID-19 Effect: The printing for this adventure is done by a family-owned shop in Arizona, where a shelter-in-place order is in effect, making us one of their largest customers. Sales like this also allow us to keep a stream of income moving to our freelance artists, authors, layout artists, and editors during the shut-downs. Frog God will come out of this crisis intact, so this isn't a "keep the doors open" plea, but we want to let you know that your purchase is one that you can feel comfortable about. It directly affects small businesses and households. We hope that all of you remain safe and well for the duration!

 

 

The Project 

Necromancer Games projects on Indiegogo are simple, focused, and short.

  • Short in duration (2-3 weeks)
  • Fast delivery of PDF once funding is completed
  • Limited to a single title
  • Have options priced between $5-$30
  • Stretch goals and project bonuses (if any) affect the principle reward only (usually both the PDF and the softcover).
  • Are the only guaranteed method to get the premium* print copy (NOTE: the softcover versions  in this printing will not be sold on our website: see FAQ for explanation).
  • Have a simple fulfillment process that does not use Backerkit

*Premium means heavyweight glossy interior pages enhancing the art and color elements. The  thick, glossy cardstock brings out the vibrant color of the cover illustration. These are the nicest softcover books we have ever sold and we only print a title this way once.

Any reprint would use print on demand service that, although nice, do not approach the quality of our INDIEGOGO funded books.

Why the Tiny Print Run?

Since 2012 our crowdfunding approach has been extravagant in every way. Ambitious with massive page counts, plus numerous add-on options and stretch goals. All supporting a primary title itself as many as 990 pages.

This has resulted in Kickstarter's with memorable pledge rewards that include top-quality hardcover books with sometimes dozens of stretch goal bonuses and add-on extras. These are awesome AND they are expensive to buy for customers like you because they are very expensive to make for publishers like us.

Why not use Kickstarter?

We will still be using Kickstarter, frequently, for our large-scale projects, but we hear the request for less expensive options for our products all the time, especially smaller, faster-paced adventures that can be completed in 2-3 sessions.

 

Product enhancements tied to project success 

During the funding period for Lost Menagerie and after the funding goal is met we will  improve the delivered product based on additional sales. There are no special tiered collectors editions or add-on purchase extras. Thus, as total project funding increases, the better the final product will be for everybody.

Examples of improvements made to earlier products:

  • Additional commissions for interior color art specific to the adventure. 
  • The previous Indiegogo project added 2 interior art pieces and 3 extra creature illustrations for its appendix.
  • Downloadable Options designed for popular virtual table-top software (The rewards for both How Orcus Stole Christmas! and In Vino Gigantus included the new creature/NPC tokens and player maps). 
  • High-resolution files of illustrations to share with players at the table.

Project Delivery

PDF Perks

We will email the instructions to all eligible supporters with instructions on accessing PDF items. The PDF files are distributed using Constant Contact service and our web store. You will need to have a customer account on the Necromancer Games website to get your PDF; it's how we keep track of everything and grants unlimited access by you to your reward.

The Indiegogo perk PDF files are 'purchased' at zero cost by supporters (as they are paid for during the Indiegogo promotion) at the Necromancer Games web store using a coupon code. That code we will be sent via Constant Contact to the address provided by Indiegogo. Please contact us with any questions/requests about this.

Softcover Perks

Softcover perks will be mailed to the address provided by us via Indiegogo. 

 

Overseas Shipping

NOTE TO INTERNATIONAL BACKERS: Shipping international has become very expensive. We understand this. Likewise, some countries charge VAT tax or other fees to our customers on receipt. We cannot fraudulently lie about the value of materials we mail out. We are happy to ship you anything regardless of where you live, but we have to stay in business at the same time thus even our lightest books are affected. In the near future we expect to have a print on demand system in place for everyone overseas; it is not ideal, as the final book is not printed at the highest-quality when compared to the ones we fulfill in Indiegogo.

To explain what we mean, please see the shipping calculator for UPS

story:
The Savage Kingdoms RPG

Now entering its 3rd edition after extensive (and highly successful!) playtesting, the Savage Kingdoms heroic sword-and-sorcery is created and designed by Mike Yow, a professional actor and dabbling game designer who has always been passionate about medieval fantasy, roleplaying games, and interactive storytelling. Mike's small indie press company is Fire In The Head Productions based out of the beautiful mountains of Asheville, NC.

Savage Kingdoms (and Fire In The Head Productions) needs your help in raising enough funds to adequately pay talented artists and graphic designers to help bring to vivid life its full-color hardcover core rulebook for the new and improved 3rd edition. Offering streamlined and more comprehensive rules, but still maintaining its robust (and yet simple) game system and detailed setting, SK III aims to keep the dream of grittier, immersive, interactive storytelling alive.

What's Needed & What You'll Get In Return

At minimum, this project needs a generous $3,000 in order to, as mentioned above, to hire skilled illustrators and graphic designers. This will leave next to nothing for the creator, but that's fine - he's perfectly okay with simply seeing this project succeed and get the attention that it deserves. Any more than $3,000, well, that'd be nice for sure, which would then go to even more artwork - perhaps even affording some famed fantasy illustrators - and maybe even a few bucks for the creator's myriad work-hours (but it's a labor of love, folks!).

For those backing this project, some excellent perks await you - digital files of the complete core rulebook, full-color hardcover books, digital versions of The Savage East campaign supplement (not yet even released!), T-shirts, and our eternal gratitude and further confirmation how wonderful gamers and lovers of medieval fantasy tend to be. 

 

 

Impact & The Future

A successful goal-reaching campaign would mean, not only the production of the full-color hardcover core rulebook, but with enough additional funding - including a potential future Indiegogo campaign - additional productions in the Savage Kingdoms game line will likely be possible. This is includes a full-color hardcover version of The Savage East campaign expansion guide, a potential Game Master's supplement, and other possibilities such as published adventure modules, a Savage Bestiary, and more.

Risks & Challenges

Naturally, with any crowd-funding campaign, there are always risks that supporters take in somewhat blindly putting their monetary faith in another, and more often than not, someone they don't even personally know. As producers of past crowd-funding projects, we understand this the value of hard-earned money. Moreover, stuff happens in peoples' lives and emergencies occur, our current pandemic situation being a prime example. We, however, enjoy a past track record of crowd-funding successes and have delivered our promises on-time, something we most certainly aim to do again here. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monetarily, then we'd still love your help in other capacities: spreading the word verbally and on social media, including the tools provided by Indiegogo for sharing and such. Anything (within reason ;)) you can do help make this campaign a reality is more than welcome!
