story:
NOTE: Thank you to the many fans who requested a Swords & Wizardry option for this book. That option is now available as its own perk. To receive your copy of Grimmsgate in the Swords & Wizardry version, please select S&W PDF Only or S&W Softcover Book + PDF.  To make a change your existing order please contact pexx@froggodgames.com for assistance.

 

An Adventure for 5th Edition D&D and Pathfinder First Edition, for Characters Level 1-3

Deep in the wooded wilderness, the village of Grimmsgate is an outpost town on a seldom-traveled trail, right at the edge of nowhere. The village’s half-ruined temple of Law, dilapidated inn, drunken blacksmith, exiled trader and a few fur-trappers are enough to keep the bloody-minded denizens of the dark forest at bay, but nobody really expects the village to still be there in another ten years. The woods have become too dangerous for the trappers who once caught animals for fur, and merchants no longer travel the poorly-maintained road.

What great evil and what fabulous treasures are to be found in these lands? A brave band of adventurers might make their fortunes here. Or perhaps they might never return … 

What's Inside?

  • A small village with map, key, and information for the characters to learn about the area
  • A wilderness map and key for outdoor adventures
  • A temple and underground complex with a dark mystery
  • A variety of new monsters

 

COVID-19 Effect: The printing for this adventure is done by a family-owned shop in Arizona, where a shelter-in-place order is in effect, making us one of their largest customers. Sales like this also allow us to keep a stream of income moving to our freelance artists, authors, layout artists, and editors during the shut-downs. Frog God will come out of this crisis intact, so this isn't a "keep the doors open" plea, but we want to let you know that your purchase is one that you can feel comfortable about. It directly affects small businesses and households. We hope that all of you remain safe and well for the duration!

The Project 

Frog God Games projects on Indiegogo are simple, focused, and short.

  • Short in duration (2-3 weeks)
  • Fast delivery of PDF once funding is completed
  • Limited to a single title
  • Have options priced between $5-$30
  • Stretch goals and project bonuses (if any) affect the principle reward only (usually both the PDF and the softcover).
  • Are the only guaranteed method to get the premium* print copy (NOTE: the softcover versions  in this printing will not be sold on our website: see FAQ for explanation).
  • Have a simple fulfillment process that does not use Backerkit

*Premium means heavyweight glossy interior pages enhancing the art and color elements. The  thick, glossy cardstock brings out the vibrant color of the cover illustration. These are the nicest softcover books we have ever sold and we only print a title this way once.

Any reprint would use print on demand service that, although nice, do not approach the quality of our INDIEGOGO funded books.

 

Why the Tiny Print Run?

Since 2012 our crowdfunding approach has been extravagant in every way. Ambitious with massive page counts, plus numerous add-on options and stretch goals. All supporting a primary title itself as many as 990 pages.

This has resulted in Kickstarter's with memorable pledge rewards that include top-quality hardcover books with sometimes dozens of stretch goal bonuses and add-on extras. These are awesome AND they are expensive to buy for customers like you because they are very expensive to make for publishers like us.

Why not use Kickstarter?

We will still be using Kickstarter, frequently, for our large-scale projects, but we hear the request for less expensive options for our products all the time, especially smaller, faster-paced adventures that can be completed in 2-3 sessions.

Product enhancements tied to project success 

During the funding period for Lost Menagerie and after the funding goal is met we will  improve the delivered product based on additional sales. There are no special tiered collectors editions or add-on purchase extras. Thus, as total project funding increases, the better the final product will be for everybody.

Examples of improvements made to earlier products:

  • Additional commissions for interior color art specific to the adventure. 
  • The previous Indiegogo project added an interior art piece and 2 extra creature illustrations for its appendix.
  • Downloadable Options designed for use with popular virtual table-top software (The rewards for both How Orcus Stole Christmas! and In Vino Gigantus included the new creature/NPC tokens and player maps). 
  • High-resolution files of illustrations to share with players at the table.

Project Delivery

PDF Perks

We will email the instructions to all eligible supporters with instructions on accessing PDF items. The PDF files are distributed using Constant Contact service and our web store. You will need to have a customer account on the Frog God Games website to get your PDF; it's how we keep track of everything and grants unlimited access by you to your reward.

The Indiegogo perk PDF files are 'purchased' at zero cost by supporters (as they are paid for during the Indiegogo promotion) at the Frog God Games web store using a coupon code. That code we will be sent via Constant Contact to the address provided by Indiegogo. Please contact us with any questions/requests about this.

Softcover Perks

Softcover perks will be mailed to the address provided by us via Indiegogo. 

 

Overseas Shipping

NOTE TO INTERNATIONAL BACKERS: Shipping international has become very expensive. We understand this. Likewise, some countries charge VAT tax or other fees to our customers on receipt. We cannot fraudulently lie about the value of materials we mail out. We are happy to ship you anything regardless of where you live, but we have to stay in business at the same time thus even our lightest books are affected. In the near future we expect to have a print on demand system in place for everyone overseas, It is not ideal, as the final book is not printed at the highest-quality when compared to the ones we fulfill in Indiegogo.

To explain what we mean, please see the shipping calculator for UPS.

story:
Available on: slyklydesign.com 

http://www.slyklydesign.com/product/floating-face-polyhedral-7-die-set-aluminum/


What are Floating Face Dice?  

Floating Face Dice are precision machined from a solid piece of metal into 2 pieces. The middle of the die is loose and moves freely, but will not separate from the outer cage. 


Floating Polyhedrals in Red Anodized Aluminum

See images below where I have highlighted the Outside Cage in red and the Inside Floating Center in Gray.

These Cool and Unique dice are made by machining around the edges of every side of the dice. Each side is machined to the depth where it intersects the other machined sides. By doing this the center is now able to float around and be separate from the outer cage.  The Aluminum dice are milled to shape and then anodized. That way the numbers and the floating feature machined into each side will show off the bare aluminum and give a really good contrast to the anodized surface!

Interactive 3D Model of Floating D6




How to Add-on Additional Dice  

I get asked a lot about how you can order more than one set of dice. Indiegogo only allows you to select one reward but you can increase your pledge amount to include an extra award, or two, or three, or etc. Then you can select what you ordered through the Backerkit system. 

 Please note that Early Bird Levels can not be an Add-On. 

 When you are pledging and choosing your reward please choose the highest reward level 1st then increase your pledge by the amount of the lower pledge level(s) that you want to add-on. 

 International backers because these dice are basically heavy chunks of metal so an extra $5 international shipping charges will be applied in Backerkit for every add-on you order. 

 You can add these additional funds through Indiegogo or you can add additional funds to your order through Backerkit to pre-order more dice than what is offered in just one selected reward level.

What Colors of Anodized Aluminum and what Heavy Metals will be Available?

Anodized Aluminum Colors:

  • Red
  • Orange
  • Yellow
  • Green
  • Aqua
  • Blue
  • Purple
  • Clear/Silver
  • Black

Heavy Metals:

  • Copper
  • Brass
  • Stainless Steel

How these Precision Floating Dice are Made

My Previous Projects on Crowdfunding Projects

Why do I Crowdfund my Projects?  

 Precision Machined Dice are made one at a time on CNC Mills. This takes a lot of time, more time than I could ever put in on a Hobby Mill. So I need your help to launch these into mass production by commissioning a machine shop to produce these in bulk. The Machine Shop(s) that I work with have dozens of CNC machines to accomplish this task. Your pledges will go toward purchasing the Metal Alloys and to commission a machine shop to produce these in bulk. Your reward will be a set(s) of these beautiful one of a kind METAL Dice!

Risks and challenges

This is my 9th Crowdfunding Project and my 4th Dice Project. Of the 5 projects that funded 3 of them have been metal dice projects. Every funded project has been 100% fulfilled. I know to expect the unexpected and how to set realistic/conservative timelines.

Depending on the number of dice that are ordered will obviously determine the time to produce all of the dice as well as ship all of them to the backers. 
I plan on being as transparent as possible and provide regular updates because I know how it feels to not get a response to a burning question. 
With my background in Product Development and being a Mechanical Engineer I know how to meet deadlines and expectations. But if something were to arise that is going to delay production or delivery I have been in that boat before and know how to push Manufacturers into pushing my item to the top of the list of priorities.

How these Precision Floating Dice are Made

Step #1 - Start with Stock Solid Metal Alloys

tep #2 - Shape the Dice One by One with Precision CNC Machines

Step #3 - Add Brushed Finish

Step #4 - Anodize Aluminum to Specified Color

Step 5 - Engrave Numerals and Floating Feature one side at a time with CNC Machines

Risks and challenges
This is my 9th Crowdfunding Project and my 4th Dice Project. Of the 5 projects that funded 3 of them have been metal dice projects. Every funded project has been 100% fulfilled. I know to expect the unexpected and how to set realistic/conservative timelines.
Depending on the number of dice that are ordered will obviously determine the time to produce all of the dice as well as ship all of them to the backers. I plan on being as transparent as possible and provide regular updates because I know how it feels to not get a response to a burning question. With my background in Product Development and being a Mechanical Engineer I know how to meet deadlines and expectations. But if something were to arise that is going to delay production or delivery I have been in that boat before and know how to push Manufacturers into pushing my item to the top of the list of priorities.

story:
About the game

A fun card game to make learning math more fun!

Able to support 2-6 players, Melon Warrior is about collecting the most number of melon warriors in order to win the game. Fun and interactive, we promise quality family time and a great time with the least expected thing... Math. 

Divide and Conquer is a Meloncrates product that marries the division operation with a fun card game design.


Features


1) Cute Melon Characters - with a cute captivating storyline

Dew is eating its cupcake happily, but it got snatched away by a division sign?! 

Find out the rest of the story by supporting our Kickstarter!


2) 20 Unique and Fun Penalty Cards 

The person who collects the least melon warriors to protect against the division fiends, would have to draw from the penalty deck. Each deck also comes with 4 blank penalty cards for the creatives to create their own penalty. 

3) Trump 'Hiyah' Cards

To add to the randomness of the game, "Hiyah" cards are added so anytime someone sees a "Hiyah" card, the first to yell "Hiyah" and hit the pile gets the pile as points. 

How it came about


Being passionate about education, we provide quality, affordable materials for kids development in math - in free-play, experiential learning and fun. 

Learning Math has traditionally been a lot about drilling, practice, repetition, assessment books, grades. This way of learning neglects the beauty and fun of Math. All kids learn differently, and the current way of learning math does not suit all kids - resulting in some of us hating and disliking Math, because we 'do not get it'.

We seek to revolutionize the way Math is taught and learnt - by providing a multitude of experiences, like interactive games.  

We started this game through just plain flashcards, realized it was more fun than we thought it would be. Since then, we have modified the game to make it more balanced and fun by adding "Hiyah" and Penalty cards! 

You can also visit our website at www.meloncrates.com for more worksheets and fun activities!

Happy kids and Us :) 
 

Why Indiegogo? 
We hope to reach out to more people and kids to help revolutionize the way kids learn Math, and with the help of Indiegogo's community, achieve more together than we can by ourselves, to spread the love for learning.

story:
Hello!

My name is Nastya, and I am the owner of Tiny Furniture Store. I'm passionate about creating, manufacturing and painting miniature accessories for tabletop games.

In addition to “Warhammer”, “Dungeons and Dragons” and “Frostgrave”, I really love computer games from the Fallout series and for a long time I dreamed of creating new miniatures in a post-apocalyptic - retro - futuristic style. That's why I decided to run a crowdfunding project and asking you for support.

My friends from  “MyWayMiniatures” company already developed 3-D models of 15 miniatures: computer panels, racks, desktop consoles, garbage cans and others. The entire set of models you can see in the description of the project below.

All these models will be printed on a high-quality industrial printer, and then cast in resin.

We have been professionally casting miniatures for a 2 year period. We have a workshop, pressure chambers, pumps and high-quality materials. We are deeply committed to ensuring miniatures that each client buys are the best quality.

 

What We Need & What You Get

3-d sculpting and specially 3-d printing in the best quality is very expensive. The total cost of one finished master-model is about $200-$300. That's why I need your support, folks. Without you, it will take me about one year to produce all of these miniatures. 

To this day we have sculpted, print and cast the Grocery Stand miniature to give you a taste of the game visuals. If the campaign will be successfully funded, we will produce more according to the plan below.

We aim to provide not just decorative items, but highly functional tools to help people enhance their hobby experience in a multitude of ways.

 

Miniatures

UPDATE: If you  want to add multiple perks or special sets of items  in a single transaction feel free to message me and I will create "secret perk" individually for you :)

 

1. Grocery Stand with food

Classic grocery stand comes with assorted products: canned beans, snacks, Bombshell Soda bottles and crates with Root beer bottles. This is the essential element for a supermarket or a small gas station in wastelands. 

 

2. Scientists Best Pal x3

Advanced electronic console with three removable modules: screen, data storage, and control system. Panels can be used separately as a wall decor. The shape of consoles allows you to group it in the form of a circle. A true scientist's mate!

 

3. JET x3

Table top all-in-one computer machine - JET. Give a warm welcome to the world's best-selling personal computer. Complete with a flat and bright screen, innovative keyboard and a built-in projector. Every kid should get a JET after school! 

 

4. LOCKAWAY x3

Simple and durable steel locker. Lockaway lockers are built to last and versatile. They are the best choice for schools, gyms, hospitals, manufacturing facilities, police stations, and vaults. 

 

5.  The Providence with 3 cameras

New wall-mounted surveillance terminal with a native support for the satellite cameras (included). "The Providence" will show how easy it can be to gain a higher sense of security. 

 

6. Swell Bed

Swell Bed - strong, elastic, noiseless and bugless! Made of steel and high-quality plastic. Will last a lifetime! Bed storage with safe box included.

 

7. Book case with books

Modern and stylish book case. Designed by the famous artist Alex Zigle. Produced in weightless fiberglass.

 

8. Universal Support Beam and lamps

The support beam is a versatile item that can be used to provide separation in rooms, add detail to walls and increase stability in your models. The design is suitable for walls of different heights and offers you lots of different opportunities for including it in your futuristic gaming.

 

9. Vend-O-Mat

"The handiest vending machine ever made!" That is how enthusiastic users describe the revolutionary new Vend-O-Mat. It's packed with new ideas...a new design... in fact, a whole new conception of vending unit. Two changeable modules: box with soda cans and gas pump. Visible stock display. Handy upright design. Vend-O-Mat is built for fast sales!

 

10. COVER x2

New modular defense and fencing system - COVER. Panels made of light polymer with the addition of titanium fibers. Quickly combined into blocks. COVER has successfully passed ballistics testing in accordance with BP_F 0408.04 against BF Level III and special plasma rifle threats. With a thickness of just 32mm COVER modules are 20% lighter than existing in-service solutions and allow for increased mobility and endurance. New materials research and development coupled with our processing expertise and extensive product testing have allowed us to develop an ultra-lightweight ballistic defense system that meets the needs of modern law enforcement and military personnel.

 

11. FOOD-O-RAMA fridge

Every man's dream is to give his wife the best gift of all! What can be better than to give her more health, leisure, and freedom from food shopping? Of course, you've guessed it...FOOD-O-RAMA Upright Freezer! No Defrosting! No De-Freezing! No Dried Out Foods! Your wife will be the happiest woman in the world! And your food bills will be much lower because with her new FOOD-O-RAMA freezer, your wife saves money on buying food, on preparation and on left-overs...

 

12. Magic Workbench

Wonderful news for homes everywhere! Big party or Christmas dinner? Unexpected guests? Hard work day? There's no problem with Magic Workbench! It's a new and exciting type of furniture designed for every house. Big when needed, compact when out of use. Easily converts to a bar counter, work surface or big dining table. Burn, scratches and stain resistant plastic top. Ideal for homes, workshops and small restaurants.

 

13.  Wheels x6

Thought wheels were just for vehicles? Think again! Use our wheels for spare parts, barricades, room decor, junk piles, cover and much more. Three different designs including tires to give you some variety.

 

14. Slate Shingles x4

Tiles for the construction of roof and houses.

 

15. Garbage Can x4

Every post-apocalyptic landscape can guarantee one thing: trash. The perfect solution for all your garbage needs!

 

STRETCH GOALS.

* If you have already bought perks, please message if you want to add new perks to your order.

$3000

16. Sector crate x4 for $8 *UNLOCKED*

You can use these crates as corner shelves, as a round table, as columns, as barricades, as a nightstand, maybe.

 

$3250

17. LabTab x2 for $10 *UNLOCKED*

Two modern tables with drawers. And two chairs for a productive work.

 

$4300

18. Omega bath fo $12 *UNLOCKED*

Omega - a happy end to all things, your meal included!

 

*******

 

A short list of miniatures for your comfort:

  1. Grocery Stand
  2. Scientists Best Pal
  3. JET
  4. LOCKAWAY
  5. The Providence
  6. Swell Bed
  7. Book case
  8. Universal Support Beam
  9. Vend-O-Mat
  10. COVER
  11. FOOD-O-RAMA
  12. Magic Workbench
  13. Wheels
  14. Slate Shingles
  15. Garbage Can
  16. Sector Crate ($3000) - UNLOCKED
  17. LabTab ($3250) - UNLOCKED
  18. Omega Bath ($4300) - UNLOCKED

 

Miniature creation process.

All miniatures for "Barren Lands" project designed and modeled in 3D by our good friend Alexander Zigle from MyWaMiniatures company. Our business partners from the factory in Saint Petersburg print prototypes using super quality industrial 3d printer with  ~0.1 mm layers. After receiving prototypes we mold and cast it in pressure cans in our workshop. If you have already bought tiny furnishings from in our shop, you know that we create the high-quality product without bubbles and other defects.

 

3d model of the Grocery Stand.

 

Resin model after the first casting

 

Additional photos from Tiny Furniture "factory" :)

 

Road Map

An optimistic view of the "Barren Lands" campaign future below.

July: prototyping

August: making initial molds, begin casting

September: Casting, casting, casting

October: Casting continues and shipping starts

November: Casting again and shipping main part of orders

December: no casting anymore! Shipping remain orders.

 

Risks and challenges

Risks to this project are minimal. We do mold making and casting every day. And have been doing so for almost 2 years as a small workshop.

3d printing of prototypes is outsourced to trusted and friendly company. Molding and casting happen in our workshop. 

We cast miniatures in resin. And it is an intensive manual labor without any automatization. Casting 10 units or casting 1000 units, its the same amount of time and work to produce each piece. 
If the project is particularly successful, then this may overstretch our current capacity. If so, we will expand production with new staff and equipment. 

This kind of miniature manufacturing is what we have been doing for years. There is nothing out of the ordinary workflow. Everything will be produced to our usual high standard.

 

Special thanks to

Alexander Zigle for models and arts

Roman Tarasov, Vadim Wayland Parshutkin (SOUNDWay Records) and Irina Cherkasova for recording english voiceover

Michael Todd for helping in translation

David Avraamides  for helping in translation and for great ideas

Nikita Sychev for the video

story:
The road through Tegan's Bridge is not safe anymore.

The small village of Teganhsire is in disarray as the workers sent to repair the bridge never came back to town, and rumors spread that a monster has killed them all. Hired PCs investigate the situation, but find themselves thrown into a maelstrom of druidic intrigue and repercussions of an old feud between the village and forest spirits.

Burials of Teganshire is a module for level 1-3 characters that can be used in any campaign setting (commercial or homebrew). It is the first module of the Circle of the Blood Moon adventure path that will take characters to level 10, through a long campaign filled with complex encounters and ancient mysteries. 

 

A few things that are important to us in the design of this adventure:

Campaign Setting Agnostic. We wanted to propose a module that can be inserted in any campaign world. The Kingdom of Lothmar is our own setting, and in the appendix of the module, we provide guidance on how to play this adventure in this setting. However, we designed it so that if you want to play the module in your own setting, you totally can. How do we achieve that? First off the action of the module is local, it spans an area of about 15 miles wide, that you can easily plug into your preferred setting. Also, we made sure to strip any lore or NPC behavior that would not be applicable to most settings, offering the possibility to play it as it is, or DMs to add their custom lore-specific content to their liking.

Heroic Story Centric. We want players to feel like heroes. Our modules are tough and complex because players do not like to feel their progression is undeserved. Nothing beats a party of players cheering at each other after a tough battle. We also believe that actions should have consequences and our modules include many different possible endings based on how the players behaved. Compelling stories are supported by motivated and plausible NPCs. We have designed this module so that every NPC's motivations and perspectives are described, giving DMs the tools to bring the environment to life.

Burials of Teganshire is a module that brings together the investigation of a murder mystery and the combat elements of a dungeon-crawl adventure. For those of you who intend to play the complete adventure path, the conclusion of the module also offers different possible endings - based on the decisions of the PCs - and how these branch off to the second module in the series. We want this journey to wrap around your players and put them in the driver's seat, instead of forcing them on a set of rails they will have to follow.

Burials of Teganshire comes with:

  • Complete monster statblocks as part of an original bestiary
  • DM guidance on how to play the main encounters
  • Detailed motivations and perspectives for all NPCs
  • Immersive detailed maps, also available in digital format for VTT or prints

 

Staying alive…

 

…will be the least of your troubles.

Tales of Lothmar is a new collection of modules and adventure paths from Griffon Lore Games. Its objective is to both propose a set of exciting content that can be played with any setting, and also introduce players and DMs to our own campaign world, Kingdom of Lothmar.

In Burials of Teganshire, DMs will have the opportunity to play the adventure in this setting, and more precisely in the Viscounty of Kandra, one of the thirteen provinces of the kingdom. Kandra will be the setting for the whole adventure path named Circle of the Blood Moon that starts with this module. Characters will be compelled to untie a complex knot of intrigue and face terrifying enemies, through a total of five modules, leading up to 10th level.

We have published a 15-page gazetteer that covers lore about the history, the people, the places of the Viscounty. This Viscounty of Kandra Gazetteer is a free add-on to all backer tiers of this Indiegogo campaign!

Who are We?

Griffon Lore Games was started by Christophe and Anthony about two years ago, though this is our first IndieGogo campaign. We are both long-time players of tabletop RPGs and had been authoring modules and adventures for our private groups for 30+ years and decided we'd like to share what we built with the rest of the community.

Christophe was born in France and has lived in the US for the last 15 years. He started RPGs with the D&D Red Box, played a lot of 2E and ran years-long campaigns in Ars Magica and Vampire as well.

Anthony grew up in Washington State, and played all editions of D&D. He remains locally famous for DMing his 20+ years D&D campaign in the Greyhawk setting.

We are both super excited to become a part of the Indiegogo community and experience your support for our projects!

Exquisite, Precise and Immersive Maps

One last word about our maps. We're pretty proud of them and excited to put them in your hands. We humbly think we have the best maps in the industry!

This module comes with maps-you-can-play-with. Our maps are not only meant to be fancy illustrations for the book. They are immersive tools for players and DMs to use. The maps presented in the module are of small enough scale that, again, you can plug them in any world you want to use. We think of maps as story generators: when characters need to travel from one locale to another, a rich and detailed map turns that journey into an adventure.

Addon products and freebies to the module will include Map Packs that will provide high-resolution files for the maps so you print them and/or use them on VTT platforms. Anna Meyer authored all the maps for the campaign setting. You can look at her previous work on her website (http://ghmaps.net)

Why Indiegogo?

This is our first campaign on Indiegogo - but not our first crowd-funding campaign. We have been looking at Indiegogo for a while. From our perspective, its one of the remaining platforms that stayed true to the original purpose of crowd-funding: get guys like us in contact with folks like you and enable our ideas and projects to come to life. It has been a frustrating journey on other platforms that turned into marketplaces and online stores where large companies come to score high sales numbers and leave crumbs for the Indie publications.

We hope this campaign is the first of many as we bring the collection to life. We aim for these campaigns to:

  • Only run for a couple weeks
  • Have options priced between $5 and $30
  • Flexible goals so you know the campaign is a go whatever happens
  • We seek to cover our costs - if the campaign should get funded beyond our goal, this money will go towards improving the product and help finance the products to come. We will find our profit as a company outside of IndieGogo.

Delivery

PDF:
After the campaign concludes and as soon as the document is ready, you will receive a unique code by email allowing you to download the module from our website. You will need to setup a free customer account on the Griffon Lore Games website to get your PDFs. Please contact us with any questions/requests about this.

Softcover:
This version of the module is printed on premium paper, with a thick, glossy cardstock cover. These are the nicest prints available from Ingram.

Softcover perks will be mailed to the address provided by us via Indiegogo. 

Overseas Shipping

Shipping internationally has become very expensive. All softcover orders are shipped with USPS based on their International rates (We do not make any profit on shipping!). We think they offer the best speed/quality/price ratio.

However, we designed it so that if you want to play the module in your own setting, you totally can. How do we achieve that? First off the action of the module is local, it spans an area of about 15 miles wide, that you can easily plug into your preferred setting. Also, we made sure to strip any lore or NPC behavior that would not be applicable to most settings, offering the possibility to play it as it is, or DMs to add their custom lore-specific content to their liking.
Heroic Story Centric. We want players to feel like heroes. Our modules are tough and complex because players do not like to feel their progression is undeserved. Nothing beats a party of players cheering at each other after a tough battle. We also believe that actions should have consequences and our modules include many different possible endings based on how the players behaved. Compelling stories are supported by motivated and plausible NPCs. We have designed this module so that every NPC's motivations and perspectives are described, giving DMs the tools to bring the environment to life.

Burials of Teganshire is a module that brings together the investigation of a murder mystery and the combat elements of a dungeon-crawl adventure. For those of you who intend to play the complete adventure path, the conclusion of the module also offers different possible endings - based on the decisions of the PCs - and how these branch off to the second module in the series. We want this journey to wrap around your players and put them in the driver's seat, instead of forcing them on a set of rails they will have to follow.
Burials of Teganshire comes with:

Complete monster statblocks as part of an original bestiary
DM guidance on how to play the main encounters
Detailed motivations and perspectives for all NPCs
Immersive detailed maps, also available in digital format for VTT or prints

 
Staying alive…
 
…will be the least of your troubles.
Tales of Lothmar is a new collection of modules and adventure paths from Griffon Lore Games. Its objective is to both propose a set of exciting content that can be played with any setting, and also introduce players and DMs to our own campaign world, Kingdom of Lothmar.


In Burials of Teganshire, DMs will have the opportunity to play the adventure in this setting, and more precisely in the Viscounty of Kandra, one of the thirteen provinces of the kingdom. Kandra will be the setting for the whole adventure path named Circle of the Blood Moon that starts with this module. Characters will be compelled to untie a complex knot of intrigue and face terrifying enemies, through a total of five modules, leading up to 10th level.
We have published a 15-page gazetteer that covers lore about the history, the people, the places of the Viscounty. This Viscounty of Kandra Gazetteer is a free add-on to all backer tiers of this Indiegogo campaign!
Who are We?
Griffon Lore Games was started by Christophe and Anthony about two years ago, though this is our first IndieGogo campaign. We are both long-time players of tabletop RPGs and had been authoring modules and adventures for our private groups for 30+ years and decided we'd like to share what we built with the rest of the community.
Christophe was born in France and has lived in the US for the last 15 years. He started RPGs with the D&D Red Box, played a lot of 2E and ran years-long campaigns in Ars Magica and Vampire as well.
Anthony grew up in Washington State, and played all editions of D&D. He remains locally famous for DMing his 20+ years D&D campaign in the Greyhawk setting.
We are both super excited to become a part of the Indiegogo community and experience your support for our projects!
Exquisite, Precise and Immersive Maps
One last word about our maps. We're pretty proud of them and excited to put them in your hands. We humbly think we have the best maps in the industry!
This module comes with maps-you-can-play-with. Our maps are not only meant to be fancy illustrations for the book. They are immersive tools for players and DMs to use. The maps presented in the module are of small enough scale that, again, you can plug them in any world you want to use. We think of maps as story generators: when characters need to travel from one locale to another, a rich and detailed map turns that journey into an adventure.

Addon products and freebies to the module will include Map Packs that will provide high-resolution files for the maps so you print them and/or use them on VTT platforms. Anna Meyer authored all the maps for the campaign setting. You can look at her previous work on her website (http://ghmaps.net)
Why Indiegogo?
This is our first campaign on Indiegogo - but not our first crowd-funding campaign. We have been looking at Indiegogo for a while. From our perspective, its one of the remaining platforms that stayed true to the original purpose of crowd-funding: get guys like us in contact with folks like you and enable our ideas and projects to come to life. It has been a frustrating journey on other platforms that turned into marketplaces and online stores where large companies come to score high sales numbers and leave crumbs for the Indie publications.
We hope this campaign is the first of many as we bring the collection to life. We aim for these campaigns to:

Only run for a couple weeks
Have options priced between $5 and $30
Flexible goals so you know the campaign is a go whatever happens
We seek to cover our costs - if the campaign should get funded beyond our goal, this money will go towards improving the product and help finance the products to come. We will find our profit as a company outside of IndieGogo.

Delivery

PDF:After the campaign concludes and as soon as the document is ready, you will receive a unique code by email allowing you to download the module from our website. You will need to setup a free customer account on the Griffon Lore Games website to get your PDFs. Please contact us with any questions/requests about this.
Softcover:This version of the module is printed on premium paper, with a thick, glossy cardstock cover. These are the nicest prints available from Ingram.
Softcover perks will be mailed to the address provided by us via Indiegogo. 
Overseas ShippingShipping internationally has become very expensive. All softcover orders are shipped with USPS based on their International rates (We do not make any profit on shipping!). We think they offer the best speed/quality/price ratio.

story:
You're in the middle of a major campaign. It's long and involved, and takes tons of prep. Now you're just hours away from your next session, and you don't have anything ready. Fear not! When Professor Humbert Drumsley shows up at the table, there's a problem that your players need to solve. Or Humbert is the problem, whatever works. At any rate, it will keep the characters busy for the night!

Professor Humbert Drumsley: 5e Adventure Codex is a collection of short adventures compatible with the latest edition of the world's oldest fantasy roleplaying system. Not only are these adventures ideal for low level characters, they're designed to be fun, fast-paced, and light-hearted.

Humbert is the stereotypical bumbling mage, perfect for introducing early in a campaign. He leans hard into the familiar fantasy tropes, and he brings along his special brand of kooky arcane accidents and unrelenting eldritch errors. You can use him to provide comic relief between major adventures, or to introduce your own quest hooks and plot points.

The finished Codex will be approximately 80+ pages in a 5.5 by 8.5 inch format. It will contain 10 short adventures, a character write up, statblocks, magic items, and more! The Codex is fully written and has seen a first round of editing. Illustrations have also been secured, using some top-notch artists from both in and outside the industry. Playtesting is ongoing, and we're looking forward to trying everything at the table before it's delivered to you.

Professor Humbert Drumsley is an aging wizard who is confined largely to his tower and estate. He dresses in the traditional garb of the magically inclined, favouring long flowing robes that match his long flowing beard. Often, he is seen wearing a pointy hat, which is purple and adorned with silver stars. While other wizards may scoff at his choice of attire, Humbert revels in it, feeling that it gives him an air of classic representation.

Humbert was once considered a wise scholar, but years of arcane invocations have left somewhat of a mark on his mind. After a magical incident, Humbert has been suspended from his chair at the local magical university ("But I'm still a professor, dammit!"). Humbert’s peers agree that his incompetence makes him an embarrassment, but he is so oblivious that many consider him blameless. 

Humbert makes friends with nearly everyone he meets, seemingly having lost the ability to be cautious long ago (likely due to an early magical mishap). Humbert often barrels forward with delight, leading him to become (for better or worse) the center of attention at cocktail parties. Regardless of the latest mishap, he pursues his magical research with reckless abandon and rushes towards with his latest (and greatest!) discovery. He fails to consider that the common element in every disaster is himself. 

Want to get your hands on one of the adventures in the Codex? Check out Oh, I Hate Spiders!, available free over at DriveThruRPG

Oh, I Hate Spiders! is a 2-hour 5e OGL adventure, suitable for 3-5 characters at 3rd level. Here the characters are introduced to Humbert, and of course, he needs help with something. God, he always needs help with something. Ok fine, just one more time!

Humbert was studying a sac of phase spider eggs in the basement of a local tavern, when he suddenly had to abandon his research. Because they were about to hatch. But don't worry, he didn't tell anyone. Probably everything is just fine, these things have a way of working themselves out. Well, now the entire place is infested, the tavern is empty, and the building is filled with ethereal fog!

"Just bring back a few live specimens," he says. "It'll be easy," he says. Humbert. What a thoughtless jerk.

Click here to download the free adventure

All the PDFs rewards will be delivered through DriveThruRPG's digital delivery service. You must have a DriveThruRPG account in order to get your digital rewards.

If you are backing at the softcover or hardcover print-on-demand levels, please consult DriveThruRPGs estimated shipping costs for printed products to find the approximate rates for your country.

John Scott is a long-time tabletop RPG fan and DM living in Calgary, Canada. He loves crafting memorable encounters and custom magic items. Not only is he passionate about 5e, he's a fan of narrative, story driven adventures. Years of designing his home campaigns have helped bring Humbert to life in the pages of the Codex.

Terry Herc is a tabletop game designer, with many well received pieces published for 5e over at the DMs Guild. Based in Calgary, Canada, this is their first major release using the OGL, with previous experience writing adventures, creature collections, magic items, and gazetteers. Everything is designed to be low prep, and to be used at the table right away.

Travis Legge is a prolific writer, layout artist, and tabletop game designer living in Illinois, USA. Since founding Aegis Studios in 2009, he has been publishing tabletop products full time, producing a number of original settings, adventures, and supplements for several Community Content programs including the DMs Guild. In addition to creating content, he is also an active member of the tabletop designer community. 

Jeremy Hart is a freelance illustrator and tabletop game designer. He publishes 5e compatible creatures in his Creature Features, and regularly publishes collections in his Creature Feature Quarterlies.  Based in Wisconsin, USA, he illustrates paper minis, virtual tabletop minis, and makes high quality stock art. 

Some examples of Jeremy's creature art. Other examples will be found in the finished book.

Rick Hershey is an illustrator, graphic designer, writer, and tabletop game publisher. He has worked in the gaming industry for over 15 years, providing work as a freelancer many big names. In 2011 he founded Fat Goblin Games in South Carolina, USA. Not only has he created hundreds of support books, he also produces high quality stock art.

Some examples of Rick Hershey's art. Other examples can be found throughout the campaign page.

Jared Glodde is an rpg enthusiast and tabletop game designer. In addition to that, Jared is also a talented voice actor and contributed the voice over work in our campaign video.

Rafael Krux is a digital music producer. Rafael has released several compositions into the public domain, including One Step Closer, which can be heard in our campaign video.

Over the course of our original campaign, we unlocked a ton of stretch goals! Each and every one of these stretch goals will make the final product even more useful at your table. Some include lore, statblocks, and even more cool stuff!

Incredible! We've unlocked all 5 Social stretch goals! That means we will add extra lore on Humbert's tower, a list of oddities found in Humbert's pockets, a list of Humbert's former class mates, a collection of minor incantations from Humbert's spellbook, and a list of 20 quest items!

Astounding! We've unlocked all 7 Backer stretch goals! That means we will add over 24 statblocks, 20 minor magic items, a one page dungeon, an alternate statblock format as a digital addon, and some advice on what to do if Humbert (unfortunately) dies.

Amazing! We've unlocked 8 Funding stretch goals! That means we will add pregenerated characters, a one page dungeon, 20 adventure seeds, 3 of Humbert's friends, and 3 of his foes.

Not only that, we unlocked Humbert's Extra Appendix! This will be a 32+ page zine, designed to be the ultimate campaign companion for Humbert!

We want to give you more tools to bring Humbert to life at your table. If you are starting a new campaign, or adding to your regular weekly game, Humbert's Extra Appendix will give you more of what you need to run great games: inspiration!

Inside these pages you will find quest hooks, locations, npcs, quest items, and more! Not only that, we will include our unlocked Bonus Adventure, expand it, and make it even better! Plus, we will add advice on extended campaigns that feature Humbert, and ways you can add magical mishaps to any campaign.

This zine will be available as a PDF to all backers. Our physical reward levels will also have it available as print-on-demand through DriveThruRPG.

The final PDF will be delivered via DriveThruRPG as a free copy to your account. The softcover, hardcover, and zine portion of the campaign will be delivered with DriveThruRPG. At these levels you will receive an at-cost voucher for DriveThruRPG's print-on-demand service. This means that the shipping on the softcover and hardcover print pledges have shipping paid for by the backer while going through DriveThruRPGs order checkout; you should be aware of shipping costs for your area.

story:
Act 2: Ha'Ot - the Undergrowth Birth of the Blight Root

In this campaign, we descend into the rooted cave system of the Undergrowth.

The Undergrowth is an all but forgotten cave system that is now entrenched with corrupted roots from the Ironwood forest above.  

 

This project was successful on Kickstarter and now we are using the Indiegogo InDemand feature to  offer packages 

 

Story Prologue -

The journey begins with our adventurers who were commissioned with an assignment from Leordric, Lord of the Ironwood Citadel.  The adventurers were given four tasks.  First, find the source that caused the corruption in the Ironwood Forest.  Second, interview an order of Druids who's dark practices have recently been outlawed.  Third, search for a hermit named Olson J. Sapson whom fled justice after committing a despicable crime.  Fourth, if the rumors are true, find and exterminate the hag in the forest.   

The order of Druids were easy to track down.  When encountering a handful of them they spoke plainly at first.  It certainly appeared there was a sense of fear among some of them.  When the conversation ended and the members of the order of Druids dispersed, the last member to leave looked back at the adventurers and whispered a riddle in a cold voice "look for the mark, the cave under the tree, under the tree... is corruption".

While searching the expansive Ironwood forest for over 3 moons, the adventurers found a barren cottage. Cumulative evidence framed the picture that Olson J. Sapson dwelled there.  Yet, Olson was no where to be found.  Much of Olson's belongings are still in the cottage including some exquisite valuables.  The adventurers were careful not disturb or to take anything from the cottage, but did set up hidden markers in and around the cottage parameters.  These indicators would serve to identify if Olson was still occupying the residence. 

The adventurers continued deeper into the Ironwood Forest and the corruption was unmistakably thick.  It was, as if, they were in a darkness... that could be felt.  It was just then a second cottage was spotted, but this time the chattering of children could be heard.  The adventurers were not deceived by the voices...  the Hag had spotted them.  Knowing they were being watched by the Hag, they planned a trap to trap their trapper.  All things come to pass and the Hag... was no more.

The darkness in the Ironwood Forest diminished only but a little.  They continued and the adventurers remembered the cold words of the last Druid.  So they continued to search... and search... 

the Undergrowth Story Begins -

In the space of the fourth moon the adventurers found something unmistakable.  A tree so grotesque that all the trees around it seems to have moved away.  This beastly tree had ripped the ground open, enlarging the mouth of a mysterious cave for all to see.  The cave's mouth is now part of the tree and the tree opened its mouth to anyone brave enough to enter.

The adventurers investigate the opening before entering.  A glowing low lit light pierces the darkness inside the cave.  Holding onto roots and stepping into the muddy foundation the adventurers feet quickly meet solid ground.  A formation of stones suspended and held together by roots nearly create a half circle around a pool of water.  Careful not to disturb the water the party moves into a cave system.

Immediately the adventurers find several ancient runic pillars and the adventurers contemplate the lore of the Na'Hash.   It is said that an ancient reptilian race known as the Na'Hash built a cave system in these very parts in the beginnings of creation.  Until the corruption of the Ironwood forest this very cave system and the Na'Hash were considered a myth.  

Just then the adventurers notice something ever so slightly move in the midst of the roots.  "What is it?" an adventurer whispered.   Holding very still the adventurers plan their next steps. Carefully approaching the roots the adventurers find themselves surrounded by roots.  The roots with all their twist and turns made it very difficult to notice at first.  Once the adventurers eyes locked on the eyes of the Blight Root creature they quickly reacted before the creature could entangle them.

The adventures now believe they understand the riddle of the Druids.  They believe the Druids didn't cause the corruption but when they found the sanctuary they saw the opportunity to create the Blight Root creatures.   The lord over these lands was right to want to put a stop to this dark order of Druids.

 

Our Ideas and Innovations

 

Act 2: the Undergrowth Birth of the Blight Root 
In this campaign, we are introducing an all new set of terrain.  We are officially releasing our new Jericho Wall System [edges], Undergrowth root floors, Multi-Level terrain, Multi-Level cave system, Sanctuary root floors, Sanctuary Pillars & Altar, corrupted grotesque tree, mushroom creature, Purple Musk Vine and Blight Root creatures!

 

Jericho Wall System - Rises the floors, lowers the walls and increases thematic experience

 

Jericho Wall System -
This is our vision on how we increase the visual theme and lower the exterior floor walls.  Terrain floor walls looks amazing yet sometimes they get in the way visually.  Our Jericho Wall System decreases the wall height then lowers the walls under the floor.  By doing this we increase viability and expand the immersive themed appearance.  We carve deeper into the wall system making very unique looking edge walls.   This method also raises the floors off the gaming table and it looks fantastic!

One of the things we contemplated for a long time was ways to make pools of water at the floor level and below.   We didn’t want water effects like nail polish simply brushed over the top surface of a floor tile [which is fine in most cases].  We wanted depths of water similar to our Water Feature Collection.  

It really wasn’t possible, until now.  

Thanks to our Jericho Wall system it's now possible to add a pools of water at the floor level with the depth of the pool below the surface of the floor.  The Jericho Wall system also made it possible to create a pit trap below the floor surface as well.  Check out the pit trap in our opening Undergrowth video.  

These are just a couple more examples why we designed our Jericho Wall system.  Opening the realm of possibilities.

 

Multi-Level Terrain - 

DM "Climbing up Multi-Level Terrain requires a Dexterity check"

We are also introducing Multi-Level terrain where players and NPC's can climb up the terrain and find another playable surface.  The top surface of the terrain could be used to create an upper path.  Stack two piece and gain even more height or perhaps the path may lead to another level in the cave system.

 

Multi-Level Cave System -

Root Pillars are stackable


It just keeps growing!  We are also introducing our Root Pillars which connect to our Mystic-Lock bases.  Root Pillars create the opportunity to make upper cave rooms and passages.  DM's at any time can increase the size of the Undergrowth by simply making an upper expansion.  The upper expansion can easily be added to the table or removed when not in use.  

 

The Sanctuary -


The sanctuary floors, pillar and altar are overgrown with corrupted roots that seem to be alive. This is the center where the first Blight Root was birthed.

 

Blight Root & Creatures -


NEW CREATURES!  Those vile Druids birthed unnatural creatures from the roots of the Ironwood Forest.  The perfect creature for this adventure.  They blend into the environment and characters climbing up Multi-Level terrain might be in for a surprise when they mistakenly grab part of a living creature.  The Blight creatures also include the grotesque tree, monstrosity mushroom and an interesting mushroom that exploded and a Purple Musk Vine is growing out of it.

Purple Musk Vine -
The Purple Musk Vine usually have some sort of adventure equipment and or treasure near or within it.

The Purple Musk Vine latches onto creatures that comes into range [5 feet] and inject them with a brain eating serum.  At the beginning of the victims round a successful strength save of 15 must be made to break free from the grasp.  A constitution save of 15 also must be rolled each round [even after breaking free] or suffer the consequences of the injected brain eating serum.  Even if a victim broke the grasp in the first round this constitution save must be rolled each round until a successful constitution save is made. The injected serum loaded with microbial seed eat 1 intel point per round for each failed constitution save.  

If the victim reaches 0 intel it is permanently transformed into a Purple Musk Bondservant [NPC] for the reminder of its now shortened miserable life.  When the Purple Musk Bondservant dies a new Purple Musk Vine will grow from its corpse.  The corpse and all of its gear set the trap for the next set of creatures attempting collect the armor, weapons and treasure left behind.

There is no cure to recover diminished intelligence point.

The heart of a Purple Musk Vine is a large 1-2 foot bulb [AC12] that sits 1 foot somewhere under the surface of the creature.  The bulb has 4 health points.   Purple Musk Vines can be cut [AC12] but any attached vines will continue grasping onto their victim for 1d4+1 rounds or if a strength saves is successful.  Anyone attempting to pull off a vine must also make the strength and constitution saves as the vine will quickly grab anything touching it.

Purple Musk Bondservant -
Purple Musk Bondservants retains the AC of its former self and lives 1d4 hours before it appears to die on its own.  The eyes of a freshly turned Purple Musk Bondservant will become full of red veins and random visible flesh areas will move like worms are just under the surface of the flesh.  

Aside from wondering behind its former party this creature has no memory of its past life, can only speak gibberish and is functioning as a botanical reproduction host.  During its short life it will continuously attempt two mindless tactics.  The Purple Musk Bondservant will try to lure other creatures into the grasp of a nearby Purple Musk Vine or stare mindlessly into the eyes of another creature giving the impression it needs help.  It will appear completely hopeless.  

Just before death the Purple Musk Bondservants will lay down on its back, its eyes will turn completely black before liquifying, its skin will crack and curl away and it will attempt to die in the presence of creatures trying to help it.  While this is taking place a bulb forming off the lower back of the Purple Musk Bondservant will bury into the ground so new life can spring forth.

Upon death, a new Purple Musk Vine shoots forth from the corpse of the Purple Musk Bondservant grasping all creatures with in range [5 feet].  

If the Purple Musk Bondservant is killed by a creature before it dies on its own the new internal Purple Musk Vine will be premature. Premature Purple Musk Vines will not reveal themselves and are not be able to grasp near by victims until the Purple Musk Vine has completed its full term [remaining hours] and its bulb is buried.

 

Mystic-Lock v3 -


Our Mystic-Lock is OpenLOCK compatible.  The system has a circular top connection to allow different texture top to be attached to the Mystic-Lock.  This means you can use our Grass Tile Collection from the Ironwood Forest or the Undergrowth floor tile to mount to the very same Mystic-Lock bases.  This will save plastic and time because once we have enough bases printed we only need to print texture tops to match the realm we are playing.  

NEW Version 3 has eight slots for our LED system*.  This means our new Undergrowth floor tile with brazier can be lit up!   It also means when the floor is raised up via Root Pillars LED's can be inserted upside down casting light onto the terrain below!

 

Perk Options

Undergrowth Jericho Wall System Collection 1 - 
This is the Jericho Wall system also know as edges.  The Undergrowth Jericho Walls mount to our Mystic-Lock base v3 via OpenLOCK clips.  Jericho Walls raise the floors up about 8mm.  This collection also includes a transition piece that takes the terrain from the Jericho Wall system height down to a standard floor tile height. The Jericho Wall System need to be attached to our Mystic-Lock base which allow you to attach either the Root Floors or the Sanctuary Root Floors to. You also could attack our Jericho Walls to any OpenLOCK compatible 4x4 floor. This Collection will retail on our site for 30$ USD.

 

Root Floor Collection 1 -
Floors are 4 inch x 4 inch and mount to our Mystic-Lock base v3.  The collection includes 13 unique floors.  Two of the floors have braziers, one has a small rock pile all 3 of them are LED ready*.  We including an A & B version of the 1st root floor tile so technically its 14 tiles 13 of which are unique.  The collection also includes a pit trap and a water pool which drop below the floor surface and have no need to mount to our Mystic-Lock base.  This Collection will retail on our site for 26$ USD.

 

Sanctuary Root Floor Collection 1 - 
Sanctuary Floors are 4 inch x 4 inch and mount to our Mystic-Lock base v3.  The collection includes 11 unique floors.  Two of the floors have braziers and are LED ready*. One of the floors has a pool of water surrounding a sanctuary stone.  The pool of water drops down below the surface of the the tile and does not need to be mounted to a Mystic-Lock base.  This Collection will retail on our site for 22$ USD.

 

Multi-Level Terrain Collection 1 -
This collection includes 15 unique Multi-Level terrain designs.  Nearly every piece has a top playable surface.  Threshold terrain has a space for player and NPC miniatures to be placed under.  Some pieces have clear top paths and others have roots covering the top surface which players can walk, run or jump on.  A couple pieces have water pools and one is LED ready*.  This collection will retail on our site for 30$ USD.

 

Sanctuary Pillars & Altar Collection 1 -
This collection of 8 unique pieces includes 4 standing pillars, 2 broken pillars, a pillar being toppled by roots and a stone altar over run by roots.  This Collection will retail on our site for 16$ USD.

 

Root Pillar Collection 1 - 
Our Root Pillars are designed to connect to our Mystic-Lock floor bases.   When connected the terrain will be raised off the table.  Play an entire campaign in an elevated game space or add an upper cave expansions as the game unfolds. The Root Pillars 1, 2 & 3 are designed in such a way they can stack seamlessly onto themselves.  In our video we stacked the Root Pillars 4 high to raise the Ironwood Forest over the Undergrowth. The collection includes 4 unique Root Pillars, 2 are LED ready* and one has a pool on the bottom.  This Collection will retail on our site for 10$ USD.

 

Blight Root and Corrupted Creatures Collection 1 -
The Blight Root creatures were birthed by the Druids but the other corrupted creatures were already here.  It's time to be afraid, Blight Root are not animated creatures nor are they magical, they are a race of creatures capable of awaking other corrupted roots. The creatures are attracted to magic items and will call on near by roots to entangle players. This collection will sell for 20$

 

*LED ready = Slotted to fit our included Realm battery & LED holder system.

 

In Play -

 

 

Pools -

 

Get 50% off all STL files on our website this includes Act 2 collections while the Undergrowth Indiegogo InDemand campaign is active.  

www.Mystic-Realm.com || DISCOUNT CODE: SavageAtoll_KS

 

 

Mystic-Realm Innovation:
Water Feature Collection - In our first Kickstarter we introduced the Water Feature Collection which enhanced the tabletop atmosphere and the terrain itself provided interactive game play.  Anyone drinking the waters would randomly receive a benefit or penalty for a short period of time.  We also made painting videos and a video on how to get water effects the Mystic-Realm way.

Ironwood Forest - In our second Kickstarter we introduced LED's into our Corrupted Forest.  We created a grass tile floor system for outdoor adventuring and included methods to make hills and slopes.  We designed everything one would need to create an enchanted or corrupted forest adventure.   

We believe with this expansion we have moved the bar once again with our Jericho Wall System, Multi-Level Terrain, Multi-Level Root Pillars and version 3 Mystic-Lock built around LED lighting.

We have been hard at work turning innovative ideas into 3d prints and taking tabletop game play to the next level.  Please support us and we will continue bring more innovative ideas to the table. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you don't have a 3d printer, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • How about using the Indiegogo share tools!
 

Risks & Challenges

Nearly every design is complete, we just need a little bit more funding to finish the last few models. By the time the crowd funding campaign comes to a close 100% of the designs will be ready for downloading.  In fact we will be waiting for Indiegogo to give us the all clear and then we will instantly take action to get you the files! No need to wait a year or several months to play your game pieces.

As a courtesy and a big thank you for supporting us, we will also post videos of some of the models being painted and set in play.
story_txt:
Act 2: Ha'Ot - the Undergrowth Birth of the Blight Root
In this campaign, we descend into the rooted cave system of the Undergrowth.
The Undergrowth is an all but forgotten cave system that is now entrenched with corrupted roots from the Ironwood forest above.   This project was successful on Kickstarter and now we are using the Indiegogo InDemand feature to  offer packages  Story Prologue -
The journey begins with our adventurers who were commissioned with an assignment from Leordric, Lord of the Ironwood Citadel.  The adventurers were given four tasks.  First, find the source that caused the corruption in the Ironwood Forest.  Second, interview an order of Druids who's dark practices have recently been outlawed.  Third, search for a hermit named Olson J. Sapson whom fled justice after committing a despicable crime.  Fourth, if the rumors are true, find and exterminate the hag in the forest.   
The order of Druids were easy to track down.  When encountering a handful of them they spoke plainly at first.  It certainly appeared there was a sense of fear among some of them.  When the conversation ended and the members of the order of Druids dispersed, the last member to leave looked back at the adventurers and whispered a riddle in a cold voice "look for the mark, the cave under the tree, under the tree... is corruption".
While searching the expansive Ironwood forest for over 3 moons, the adventurers found a barren cottage. Cumulative evidence framed the picture that Olson J. Sapson dwelled there.  Yet, Olson was no where to be found.  Much of Olson's belongings are still in the cottage including some exquisite valuables.  The adventurers were careful not disturb or to take anything from the cottage, but did set up hidden markers in and around the cottage parameters.  These indicators would serve to identify if Olson was still occupying the residence. 
The adventurers continued deeper into the Ironwood Forest and the corruption was unmistakably thick.  It was, as if, they were in a darkness... that could be felt.  It was just then a second cottage was spotted, but this time the chattering of children could be heard.  The adventurers were not deceived by the voices...  the Hag had spotted them.  Knowing they were being watched by the Hag, they planned a trap to trap their trapper.  All things come to pass and the Hag... was no more.
The darkness in the Ironwood Forest diminished only but a little.  They continued and the adventurers remembered the cold words of the last Druid.  So they continued to search... and search... 

the Undergrowth Story Begins -
In the space of the fourth moon the adventurers found something unmistakable.  A tree so grotesque that all the trees around it seems to have moved away.  This beastly tree had ripped the ground open, enlarging the mouth of a mysterious cave for all to see.  The cave's mouth is now part of the tree and the tree opened its mouth to anyone brave enough to enter.
The adventurers investigate the opening before entering.  A glowing low lit light pierces the darkness inside the cave.  Holding onto roots and stepping into the muddy foundation the adventurers feet quickly meet solid ground.  A formation of stones suspended and held together by roots nearly create a half circle around a pool of water.  Careful not to disturb the water the party moves into a cave system.
Immediately the adventurers find several ancient runic pillars and the adventurers contemplate the lore of the Na'Hash.   It is said that an ancient reptilian race known as the Na'Hash built a cave system in these very parts in the beginnings of creation.  Until the corruption of the Ironwood forest this very cave system and the Na'Hash were considered a myth.  
Just then the adventurers notice something ever so slightly move in the midst of the roots.  "What is it?" an adventurer whispered.   Holding very still the adventurers plan their next steps. Carefully approaching the roots the adventurers find themselves surrounded by roots.  The roots with all their twist and turns made it very difficult to notice at first.  Once the adventurers eyes locked on the eyes of the Blight Root creature they quickly reacted before the creature could entangle them.
The adventures now believe they understand the riddle of the Druids.  They believe the Druids didn't cause the corruption but when they found the sanctuary they saw the opportunity to create the Blight Root creatures.   The lord over these lands was right to want to put a stop to this dark order of Druids.
 
Our Ideas and Innovations

 
Act 2: the Undergrowth Birth of the Blight Root In this campaign, we are introducing an all new set of terrain.  We are officially releasing our new Jericho Wall System [edges], Undergrowth root floors, Multi-Level terrain, Multi-Level cave system, Sanctuary root floors, Sanctuary Pillars & Altar, corrupted grotesque tree, mushroom creature, Purple Musk Vine and Blight Root creatures!
 

Jericho Wall System - Rises the floors, lowers the walls and increases thematic experience

 
Jericho Wall System - This is our vision on how we increase the visual theme and lower the exterior floor walls.  Terrain floor walls looks amazing yet sometimes they get in the way visually.  Our Jericho Wall System decreases the wall height then lowers the walls under the floor.  By doing this we increase viability and expand the immersive themed appearance.  We carve deeper into the wall system making very unique looking edge walls.   This method also raises the floors off the gaming table and it looks fantastic!
One of the things we contemplated for a long time was ways to make pools of water at the floor level and below.   We didn’t want water effects like nail polish simply brushed over the top surface of a floor tile [which is fine in most cases].  We wanted depths of water similar to our Water Feature Collection.  
It really wasn’t possible, until now.  
Thanks to our Jericho Wall system it's now possible to add a pools of water at the floor level with the depth of the pool below the surface of the floor.  The Jericho Wall system also made it possible to create a pit trap below the floor surface as well.  Check out the pit trap in our opening Undergrowth video.  
These are just a couple more examples why we designed our Jericho Wall system.  Opening the realm of possibilities.
 
Multi-Level Terrain - 

DM "Climbing up Multi-Level Terrain requires a Dexterity check"
We are also introducing Multi-Level terrain where players and NPC's can climb up the terrain and find another playable surface.  The top surface of the terrain could be used to create an upper path.  Stack two piece and gain even more height or perhaps the path may lead to another level in the cave system.
 
Multi-Level Cave System -

Root Pillars are stackable
It just keeps growing!  We are also introducing our Root Pillars which connect to our Mystic-Lock bases.  Root Pillars create the opportunity to make upper cave rooms and passages.  DM's at any time can increase the size of the Undergrowth by simply making an upper expansion.  The upper expansion can easily be added to the table or removed when not in use.  
 

The Sanctuary -

The sanctuary floors, pillar and altar are overgrown with corrupted roots that seem to be alive. This is the center where the first Blight Root was birthed.
 
Blight Root & Creatures - 


NEW CREATURES!  Those vile Druids birthed unnatural creatures from the roots of the Ironwood Forest.  The perfect creature for this adventure.  They blend into the environment and characters climbing up Multi-Level terrain might be in for a surprise when they mistakenly grab part of a living creature.  The Blight creatures also include the grotesque tree, monstrosity mushroom and an interesting mushroom that exploded and a Purple Musk Vine is growing out of it.
Purple Musk Vine -The Purple Musk Vine usually have some sort of adventure equipment and or treasure near or within it.
The Purple Musk Vine latches onto creatures that comes into range [5 feet] and inject them with a brain eating serum.  At the beginning of the victims round a successful strength save of 15 must be made to break free from the grasp.  A constitution save of 15 also must be rolled each round [even after breaking free] or suffer the consequences of the injected brain eating serum.  Even if a victim broke the grasp in the first round this constitution save must be rolled each round until a successful constitution save is made. The injected serum loaded with microbial seed eat 1 intel point per round for each failed constitution save.  
If the victim reaches 0 intel it is permanently transformed into a Purple Musk Bondservant [NPC] for the reminder of its now shortened miserable life.  When the Purple Musk Bondservant dies a new Purple Musk Vine will grow from its corpse.  The corpse and all of its gear set the trap for the next set of creatures attempting collect the armor, weapons and treasure left behind.
There is no cure to recover diminished intelligence point.
The heart of a Purple Musk Vine is a large 1-2 foot bulb [AC12] that sits 1 foot somewhere under the surface of the creature.  The bulb has 4 health points.   Purple Musk Vines can be cut [AC12] but any attached vines will continue grasping onto their victim for 1d4+1 rounds or if a strength saves is successful.  Anyone attempting to pull off a vine must also make the strength and constitution saves as the vine will quickly grab anything touching it.
Purple Musk Bondservant -Purple Musk Bondservants retains the AC of its former self and lives 1d4 hours before it appears to die on its own.  The eyes of a freshly turned Purple Musk Bondservant will become full of red veins and random visible flesh areas will move like worms are just under the surface of the flesh.

Just before death the Purple Musk Bondservants will lay down on its back, its eyes will turn completely black before liquifying, its skin will crack and curl away and it will attempt to die in the presence of creatures trying to help it.  While this is taking place a bulb forming off the lower back of the Purple Musk Bondservant will bury into the ground so new life can spring forth.
Upon death, a new Purple Musk Vine shoots forth from the corpse of the Purple Musk Bondservant grasping all creatures with in range [5 feet].  
If the Purple Musk Bondservant is killed by a creature before it dies on its own the new internal Purple Musk Vine will be premature. Premature Purple Musk Vines will not reveal themselves and are not be able to grasp near by victims until the Purple Musk Vine has completed its full term [remaining hours] and its bulb is buried.

story:
Be the player with the most chips after seven rounds of play

Gameplay:

Players ante a $1 chip into the pot

Player rolls the dice to determine category and game mode.  If a "You Pick" is rolled, the player selects the category

Player grabs a card from the determined category and reveals the subject to all players - no peeking at the answers on the back!

Did we mention we have a ton of fun subjects?

There are three fun game modes:

Silent Bet:  Players write the number of answers to the subject they can name in one minute. Players then flip their cards simultaneously.  The player with the highest bet places that amount of chips into the pot.

Live Bet:  Players bet out loud the number of answers to the subject they can name in one minute until the highest bet is reached.  The player with the highest bet places that amount of chips into the pot.

All Play: No bets are placed - everyone gets to play!

Silent or Live Bet:  Start the timer!  The player with the highest bid now has one minute to say the amount of answers they bet.

All Play:  Each player has one minute to write down as many answers to the subject as they can

Silent or Live Bet:  Did the player give the number of answers they bet? Yes:  Player collects the pot and banker pays them the amount of their bet.  No:  Pot is split evenly with the other players.

All Play:  Players collect a $1 chip for each correct answer written on their board.  The player with the most correct answers also collects the ante pot.

 

Man Vs Meeple

 
Game Boy Geek
 
 

 

 

Risks and challenges

We have been very diligent in selecting the best vendors for this project. Our fulfillment partners in the USA and Canada are experts in delivering Kickstarter projects, allowing us to keep shipping costs as low as possible for our valued backers. Our manufacturing partner, Ad Magic, has produced Kickstarter blockbusters such as Cards Against Humanity and Exploding Kittens.

We will do everything we can to deliver earlier than the promised delivery date and will keep our backers updated regularly on the timeline. Please feel free to contact us with any questions at info@graymattersgames.com. Thank you so much for your support as we strive to Brighten Your Play!

Game on! 
Gray Matters Games

story:
Our story

Hello! We're Josh and Evan, the creators of Charty Party. If you're reading this and thinking about helping to bring Charty Party to life, you're most likely...

  • Someone looking for a fresh and hilarious party game
  • A huge nerd
  • One of our moms

Whether you've birthed us or not, we're super excited that you're as interested in creating absurd and ridiculous charts as we are. We played the first version of Charty Party on sticky notes at our little office conference table (we're coworkers at a tiny consulting firm), and when our coworker April couldn't stop laughing we knew we were onto something.

We've already raised 500% of our initial goal on Kickstarter, and now we're continuing the party here on Indiegogo! We're new to board games but not new to launching and producing products, so we're excited to put our entrepreneurial experience into making sure everyone gets a beautifully printed game as smoothly as possible.

 

Reward Levels

$25 - The Full Charty Party Game! You'll be one of the first people on earth (seriously) to own a copy of Charty Party, and can brag about this great honor to your friends. Each Charty Party game includes 250 wacky orange "Y-Axis" cards and 44 (upgraded from 39) hilarious chart cards with scales ranging from "Criminal History" to "Drunkenness" to "Number of People at a Party."
