story:
Introduction

Here at DMB we games love our RPG and table-top games. We live for our board games and we are passionate about modelling and creating new things for the table-top. We have always enjoyed bringing the table-top to life through battle maps and scenery. 

Some of you will already know who we are and what we do. But for those of you who are new to the DMB train, I’ll explain, no wait we don't have enough time for that I’ll just sum up!

Two years ago, I started a little company making 3D terrain for D&D games. I saw what was out there and it didn't quite fit what i wanted, so I started making my own. It's proved popular enough for me to give up working in IT full time and to make it my main job, that is down to everyone who has purchased the tiles up to this point, and I can't thank you enough!

Now I can expand the range and the company but I need your help to do so. There are some exciting things ahead, let’s get them released!

What's the story, and why do I need help?

Well to lay my cards on the table as it where, I need some help to raise money to expand the company and get it to the next stage, which is quite an exciting step for me.

There are two things I want to achieve from this campaign:

  1. Release new tiles, including some brand-new ranges as well as accessories and tiles for our existing ranges.
  2. Expand the company to include other members of staff and a new workshop to help with promotion, production and all the other tasks I currently do myself.
  3. Revamp the website and improve the photography that is on it now.

O.K. so that is three things, but the third one was an afterthought and would only be considered if the campaign was very successful.

I have poured not only money in to the business to get the original molds, the silicone, get us to shows, and the packaging, but my heart and soul into making a product that is great to look at but is also practical and usable for gaming, which at the end of the day is what it is all about.

What are we offering you if you decide to support us?

We have several Pledge Levels for you guys to chip in on if you would like to. if you look on the Right hand of your screen - That's it just over there... you will see a list of campaign cards. They tell you everything you can get for your pledge levels. I'll also post a pictographic thing down the page a bit that shows you what you will be getting as well.  

But as an overview there are two things you'll get:

  1. Access to our existing range at a reduced cost
  2. Access to new range as its unlocked throughout the campaign at the same reduced cost.
  3. Some cool free DMB Goodies along the way

Ok again I know that's 3 things again... but mugs, dice bags, game bags and other paraphernalia don’t count...

Here is a list of the rewards and the pictographic thing I promised showing what you can get, and what our first set of stretch goals are:

Perks

The following is a list of the Perks currently available to you on the campaign.

£1+ - Show Us Your Support! 

At this level, you can pledge however much you want to support us expand our scenery range, but won't actually receive anything other than our heartfelt thanks, and a mention on our website!

£20 - Accessory Pack

This perk will get you 20 pieces of scatter scenery.

You will receive a choice of 4 sets each containing 5 pieces of scatter sceenry. The sets on offer will include:

  • Treasure Chests
  • Barrels
  • Coin Piles
  • Crates, Large & Small
  • Tubs
  • Grain Sacks
  • Mixed sets 
  • 2 Dungeon Doors
  • A set of 2 Support Pillars. 

The door, and accessory pack styles can be picked at the end of the campaign, and there will be new styles on offer as Extras as we proceed through the campaign.

This bundle retails at Retail at £30, so you save yourself £10!

£25 - 30' x 30' Room Set

This Perk is for a 30’ x 30' Room Set :

The picture Shows a 30x30 Room Set in Cracked Flagstone Floor Style, Gothic Wall Style and Painted in the Gothic Grey Finish.

This set includes:

1x Crossroads Tile, 
4x Standard Floor Tiles,
2x Wall Spacers, 
4x 4 and 1/2 Block Walls, 
2x 2 and a Half Block Walls, 
2x Dungeon Doors 

The door, floor and wall styles can be picked at the end of the campaign, and there will be new styles on offer as Extras as we proceed through the campaign.

This set normally retails at retail £35 so you save yourself £10!

£45: Dungeon Starter Set

This Perk contains a Dungeon Starter Set:


The picture shows some of the parts of the Dungeon Starter, a 4x4 Tile, the L-Corner Wall and floor and wall tiles arranged to make a T-Junction..

This is a brand new starter set offering a simple and easy way to start collecting and using the tiles in your game.

The starter sets will include:

9 Floor Tiles: (1x 4x4 Floor Tile 5x 2x2 Floor Tile 2x L-Corner Floor Tiles 1x T-Junction Floor Tiles 2x 1x2 Floor Tiles 4x Internal Wall Spacers)

14 Wall Tiles: (4 x 4 Block Walls 4x 2.5 Block Walls 4x 2 Block Walls 4x1.5 Blocks 2x L-Corner Walls)

2 Doors

The door, floor and wall styles can be picked at the end of the campaign, and there will be new styles on offer as Extras as we proceed through the campaign.

This set normally retails at retail £60 so you save yourself £15!

£60: Core Set A Cavern Core Set - 32 pieces

This Perk contains a Hand Painted & Hand Finished Cavern Core Set:


This picture shows a cavern set painted in the Cavern Brown Finish.

This is our Cavern Set which includes:

1x Set of 18 Cavern Floor Tiles (6x 4x4 Floor Tiles, 10x 2x2 Floor Tiles, 2x 1x2 Floor Tiles)
1x Set of 7 Cavern Topper Tiles (7x Cavern Toppers)
1x Set of 7 Cavern Accessories (6x Stone pillars 1x Stone Well)

The door, floor and wall styles can be picked at the end of the campaign, and there will be new styles on offer as extras as we proceed through the campaign.

This set normally retails at retail £80 so you save yourself £20!

£90: Dungeon Core Set - 62 Pieces

This Perk contains a Dungeon Core Set. The Core set includes:


The picture shows core set pieces in Cracked Flag Floor Style, Gothic Wall Style, and painted in the Gothic Grey Finish.​

1x Set of 28 Floor Tiles: (10x Standard Floor Tiles (2 x 2), 4x Half Floor Tiles (1 x 2), 4x L-Corner Tiles, 2x T-Junction Tiles, 1x Crossroads Tile, 1x Set Of Stairs, 6x Inner Wall Spacers)
1x Set of 32 Wall Tiles: (2x 4 ½ block walls, 4x 4 block walls, 2x 3 ½ block walls, 4x 3 block walls, 6x 2 ½ block walls, 4x 2 block walls, 4x 1 ½ block walls, 6x 1-block walls)
Accessories: 2x Dungeon Doors

This set normally retails at retail £115 so you save yourself £25!

Tile Styles/Paint Finishes Available

Currently you can choose from the following Styles/Finishes for your pledges:

Floor Styles:

  • Cracked Flagstone
  • Fieldstone
  • Ruins

Wall Styles:

  • Gothic
  • Fieldstone

Paint Finishes:

  • Gothic Grey
  • Cavern Brown
  • Earthen Brown
  • Sandstone

There are more to be unlocked as the Campaign Progresses as you can see from the stretch goals below!

Stretch Goals:

Campaign Funded Everyone gets a Virtual Hug or High Five, or a real one at a convention we are at, if you prefer!

Patterned Floors:  Set of 6 New Patterned 2x2 Floors will be put in to production - these can be selected as part of your core set pledge (swap out 2x2's included in the pledge) or you can add a pack of 6 tiles for £10 (Retail £15)

1 of each pattern type will be added to each core set pledge (or equivalent.)

A Set of 10 different 4x4 Cavern Tiles that will form a lake and shore for your cavern adventures. All the tiles in this set will have tinted resin on them to show the murky surface of the water.
(The image used is to show an example of what they will look like)

Large floor tiles (5x5) and odd sized floors (3x3 and Narrow Corridors) available in the fieldstone floor finish. L-corner wall and Support pillars & Doors also produced in the Fieldstone finish

Egyptian Stone Floor - Core Set Floor in flagstone (including the large sized odd sized and narrow corridor pieces.) The Tomb Floor can now be selected as a finish for the Core Set Reward, or as an add on.

4x 2x2 Tiles will be added to each Core Set Pledge (or equivalent)

Egyptian Stone Wall - The Tomb Wall finish can now be selected as part of the Core Set Reward - or you can add a set to your pledge for £50

2x 4 block and 4x 2 and a Half Block Walls Added to Each Core Set Pledge (or equivalent)

Large floor tiles (5x5, 4x4) and odd sized floors (3x3 and narrow Corridors) available in the Temple Ruin Floor Tile finish.

Core Set Floor in flagstone (including the large sized odd sized and narrow corridor pieces.)

4x 2x2 Tiles will be added to each Core Set Pledge (or equivalent)

Sci-fi Floors Walls and Accessories - This is the first of our new Core Sets. You can select this as your core set reward if you would prefer it

4x 2x2 Tiles will be added to each Core Set Pledge (or equivalent)

Including, Tavern, Sewer and wilderness sets, Scatter Terrain Accessories, like Pillars, Sarcophagus and coffin sets, and furniture, more pattern floor tiles, more doors and walls, and even special edition exclusive items for you!

Add Ons

To include them with your perk, just click the custom additional Gift button and enter the total amount of the extra you would like to get.

A servey will be sent around at the end of the Campaign so that you can list exactly what it is that you would like.

The add ons are listed below as well for ease of reference.

Add ons

Core Set Floor Set: 28 Floor Tiles £50

Core Set Wall Set: 32 Wall Tiles £50

Accessories Small Set:  £3 - 6 Accessories 

Accessories Medium Set: £5 - 6 Accessories 

Accessories Large Set: £7 - 6 Accessories 

Additional Full Core Set: £90

Additional Cavern Floor Set: £40

Additional Cavern Topper Set: £10

Additional Cavern Accessory Set: £15

Additional Cavern Set: £60

More will be added to this list as the campaign progresses!

Couple of other things to note about the tiles you will be receiving:

  • All Tile masters are hand made from Hirst Arts molds (we are fully licenced) and then cast in to solid pieces using silicone mold, for strength and ease of use.
  • Each piece you receive is:
    • Hand Cast
    • Hand Painted
    • Hand finished
    • Hand Packed
  • You can pick from the color variations we do, if you don't want grey then don't have it grey!
  • You can pick from any tile or Wall finish that we currently have or that is unlocked as we go through the campaign

What are you going to use the Money for?

Well, that’s a great question, and here is how I see it working.

First and foremost, I am going to buy as much RTV Silicone as I can. We use this to make the molds that we cast from, and with so many new floor tiles, and accessory sets that we want to release we are going to need a lot of it.

5Kg of Silicone costs about £90 and the amount of molds we can get out of one box varies depending upon the size of the molds.

We can roughly produce one core set out of 2 box’s Silicone. So, for every 2 “Core set” pledged on this campaign will see the equivalent of a new set of floor tiles & wall tiles produced.

Obviously on top of that we have the cost of the plaster and the packaging but you get the idea.

I have a list of nearly 70 Accessory sets I’d like to get in to production, and then there are the completely new sets, the Tavern, the Sci-fi, The sewers and the Wilderness sets.

The Accessory sets would benefit from being made from resin, so that would be an additional expense, and we would need to procure a vacuum chamber to ensure there are no bubbles.

We also currently have a 3D printer sitting in the corner of the office gathering dust so who know what we could do with that as we progress.

There are then some new tiles that should have been launched ages ago that feature in the video at the top of the page, the patterned and runic ones. Then we have wooden floors and cobblestone floors to release.

Moreover, there are special tiles I want to create, cavern tiles with resin lake pieces, so many pieces, we have over 300 new tiles in our list of tiles waiting to be created and produced.

Then there are room and corridor sets that we want to produce like the Arched hall way and the Chapel.

All of that is a lot of work for one person, and will require a larger work space, so this is where I need you guys to dig as deep as you can.

If we can hit £1000 the extra money raised will go on kitting out my garage as a work space. I need to buy worktops, shelving and flooring to go in there.

The Garage is large enough for me to get three people working in there, and will stop me having to spray paint in the back garden on the garden furniture!

It means we can get properly organised, have space for stock to be stored so it’s ready to ship when people order it and to enable us to prepare for shows in an easier fashion.

And if the campaign reaches the £5,000 I will be able to hire a part time assistant to help me cast and paint, allowing me to produce new pieces with more regularity, and work on the website as well.

What if we can’t contribute?

I understand not everyone will be able to pledge the money for a core set, but there are a few lower level pledges that you can pledge on, and if you can’t do that, then any think you can do to help spread the word would be greatly appreciated.

  • Share the link on social media
  • email friends and colleagues
  • Talk about the campaign at your local games cub/school/pub
  • Hire a plane to skywrite the info so everyone in your neighbourhood can see it

Ok maybe not the last one but you get the idea, any way you can share the campaign and raise awareness is excellent.

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks to any project, especially one where everything is hand made, but we have spent 2 years mitigating what we can, where we can.

I have chosen to go with the flexible funding on the campaign, which means, if you pledge you will receive something, EVEN IF WE ARE NOT FULLY FUNDED!

So, you don’t have to worry about that, you’ll get your pledge no matter what happens.

  • Current Product Range
    • We have all the moulds for our current sets, and the space to churn them out and paint them, as we need to. We have all the Hirst arts moulds we need to make the new sets, as well as the licence from Bruce to enable us to do so.
  • Resin Casting
    • The resin piece is new, but I have access to people who have used resin and vacuum chambers before, so that shouldn’t be a problem.
  • Casting Time
    • Hand Casting everything can be a long process. We will mitigate this by producing out standard stock as the campaign progresses, and then the new unlocked pieces at the end, so we should be able to cover everything that everyone wants easily.

      The only thing that could affect the dispatch of the tiles at the end of the campaign is if everyone wants the new tiles, but we plan to contact backers towards the end of the campaign and see what people are thinking about getting to help us cope with the demand.
  • New Range
    • We are currently working on the moulds for the first few new sets, so this should help us keep up with demand, but as mentioned above we will be keeping in touch with everyone to make sure we prepare the correct moulds as the campaign goes along.

​FAQ

Are your tiles compatible with other systems?

In Short, YES!

Our tiles are set on a 1 inch by 1 inch grid that is compatible not only with other terrain tile systems out there, but also with the various battle maps, flip mats and other gaming aids out there. Our Tiles are double thickness to make it easier for the tiles to integrate with the other systems out there.

Why Plaster and not Resin?

For starters, it gives the tiles a stone feel, and a weight to help them not slide around on the table when your using them The Plaster has a very high PSI rating at 18,500, which is extremely high.

This makes the tiles very durable and resilient to accidental damage and breakage. The unpainted tiles can be swept of a table and in to a backpack and carried around, ready for the next session.

Why should I Buy from you when these are just made from the Hirst Arts Moulds and i Can Buy them from Hirst arts? Why are you trying to sell his bits as your own?

That's a very good question!

Firstly we are not trying to sell the Hirst Arts bits as our won, we are selling Dungeon Terrain made from the Hirst Arts Moulds, and we are fully licensed to do so.

Secondly, the pieces we are making are solid pieces. This means we create the original from the Hirst Arts moulds, and then create our own silicone moulds of the pieces. We do this for two reasons:

1) Durability - the crossroads floor piece alone has 40 individual 1 inch square tiles in it. if we made the production piece out of single tiles you would have so many places that the tile could break it would eventually break. One 6-inch by 6-inch piece of plaster is much sturdier than lots of smaller pieces stuck together.

2) Production speed. To create the core set we have used over 500 individual tiles! For one core set you would need to cast up the individual moulds around 35 times to get all the pieces needed to create the pieces.

For you to make this set in all of the finishes we are offering would require you to purchase quote a few different moulds from Hirst Arts, which if that's what you want to do or already have done, we think that's awesome, as we wouldn't be doing this without the amazing moulds that Bruce produces, but we wanted to offer an easier and cheaper way for you guys to get your dungeon terrain.

Obviously if you already have your own moulds, you could still pledge for a core set or two and use your moulds to make accessories or additional pieces, which would also be pretty great!

Ok maybe not the last one but you get the idea, any way you can share the campaign and raise awareness is excellent.Risks & ChallengesThere are always risks to any project, especially one where everything is hand made, but we have spent 2 years mitigating what we can, where we can.I have chosen to go with the flexible funding on the campaign, which means, if you pledge you will receive something, EVEN IF WE ARE NOT FULLY FUNDED!So, you don’t have to worry about that, you’ll get your pledge no matter what happens.

Current Product RangeWe have all the moulds for our current sets, and the space to churn them out and paint them, as we need to. We have all the Hirst arts moulds we need to make the new sets, as well as the licence from Bruce to enable us to do so.


Resin CastingThe resin piece is new, but I have access to people who have used resin and vacuum chambers before, so that shouldn’t be a problem.


Casting TimeHand Casting everything can be a long process. We will mitigate this by producing out standard stock as the campaign progresses, and then the new unlocked pieces at the end, so we should be able to cover everything that everyone wants easily.The only thing that could affect the dispatch of the tiles at the end of the campaign is if everyone wants the new tiles, but we plan to contact backers towards the end of the campaign and see what people are thinking about getting to help us cope with the demand.


New RangeWe are currently working on the moulds for the first few new sets, so this should help us keep up with demand, but as mentioned above we will be keeping in touch with everyone to make sure we prepare the correct moulds as the campaign goes along.


​FAQ
Are your tiles compatible with other systems?In Short, YES!Our tiles are set on a 1 inch by 1 inch grid that is compatible not only with other terrain tile systems out there, but also with the various battle maps, flip mats and other gaming aids out there. Our Tiles are double thickness to make it easier for the tiles to integrate with the other systems out there.Why Plaster and not Resin?For starters, it gives the tiles a stone feel, and a weight to help them not slide around on the table when your using them The Plaster has a very high PSI rating at 18,500, which is extremely high.This makes the tiles very durable and resilient to accidental damage and breakage. The unpainted tiles can be swept of a table and in to a backpack and carried around, ready for the next session.Why should I Buy from you when these are just made from the Hirst Arts Moulds and i Can Buy them from Hirst arts? Why are you trying to sell his bits as your own?That's a very good question!Firstly we are not trying to sell the Hirst Arts bits as our won, we are selling Dungeon Terrain made from the Hirst Arts Moulds, and we are fully licensed to do so.Secondly, the pieces we are making are solid pieces. This means we create the original from the Hirst Arts moulds, and then create our own silicone moulds of the pieces. We do this for two reasons:1) Durability - the crossroads floor piece alone has 40 individual 1 inch square tiles in it. if we made the production piece out of single tiles you would have so many places that the tile could break it would eventually break. One 6-inch by 6-inch piece of plaster is much sturdier than lots of smaller pieces stuck together.2) Production speed. To create the core set we have used over 500 individual tiles! For one core set you would need to cast up the individual moulds around 35 times to get all the pieces needed to create the pieces.For you to make this set in all of the finishes we are offering would require you to purchase quote a few different moulds from Hirst Arts, which if that's what you want to do or already have done, we think that's awesome, as we wouldn't be doing this without the amazing moulds that Bruce produces, but we wanted to offer an easier and cheaper way for you guys to get your dungeon terrain.Obviously if you already have your own moulds, you could still pledge for a core set or two and use your moulds to make accessories or additional pieces, which would also be pretty great!

story:
My name is Dirk Laureyssens, I am a Belgian inventor. My background: I am MS in Political and Social Sciences. In 1986 I invented a new type of flat-to-cube foam puzzles (http://www.happy.be). With these puzzles I was able to give kids worldwide a fun puzzle that brings 3D thinking and gives kind of logic and math at the same time. 

 

In 1993 I invented another toy: A changeable dice. The basic idea is quiet simple: A cube frame has six empty spaces in which fit small face-disks with various kind of information (dots, numbers, symbols, logos, actions, images, rules). The fun thing: these disks can be removed and replaced by other face-disks with other information. So you get a different dice, completely at your wish. Thus it is a changeable dice. Check the website: www.zapdice.com to see what this campaign is in general about.


This Zap concept brings a revolution in toptable games since you can adapt famous games, like Monopoly® or Parchisi, the personal way you want yourself, or you can create yourself new personal table games. I wrote three technical books about the changeable concept to protect the copyrights. So I received official USA-copyrights (VA 637632 and VA 637629, Tx 3747990, Tx 3884658)  and similar in Belgium. In these books I described several ways to play, how the most famous toptable games can be adapted, a number of new board games and how the disks can be transferred also into other game tools the like of checkers, pawns, stratego pieces, etc.

Thus the Zap concept is all about “information transfer” between game tools. This is similar like software that can run on several Operating Systems. You are able to change information, a value, an instruction, … parameters of your own dice/pawn/checker, but also hack the zap dice or zap pawn of your opponents!

In 1993/1994 I started production of the changeable dice in China. I had about 20 different moulds. With a large dice distributor in USA an agreement was signed for the USA-market. Together we designed various dice, the like of a weather dice, a sports dice, a power dice, a medical dice, etc. So the basic fundament was ready to create a revolution in toptable games. However then a disaster happened. The factory in China had a giant fire and was destroyed completely, including my moulds and the stock with dice-frames, pawn-frames, checker-frames and disks.

 

Give it a second life!

 Because the changeable dice concept is that exciting and offers so much fun and freedom to gamers, I want now to introduce my zapdice campaign here on Indiegogo, to give it a second life. This zap approach is so innovative and original too good to disappear. Further it has educational aspects too. The zap parts can be an excellent tool to learn words and grammatical rules/mechanics of other languages.

I know that the zap approach for toptable games will bring very exciting new game concepts and games because it triggers your creative imagination. Just imagine you can create a high-speed dice, where you can replace in your dice the 1-dot-face by a disk with 9 dots! But there comes also strategy! Because a high-speed dice may not be that smart in a game like Monopoly® because you will run too fast to buy the best houses! In Zap Moneypoly all four stations receive a “change-a disk” sticker. But think about another way: speed-up the pawn of your competitor by putting a disk with +9 on the top. That pawn becomes a high-speed runner! That player can solve his problem only by landing on a station! Real fun! Real emotions and tension to remove the +9 disk.

 

Contributions.

 

By the support of the contributors we will be able to order the injection moulds to have High Quality products. Without your support we will have financial difficulties to bring the zapdice project into reality because moulds are expensive (± 18,750 $/unit).

 

The basic mould.

The Basic zap mould has four parts: (1) the frame of the dice (each side: 18 mm), (2) the frame of a special game-part, (3) 12 little face-disks (Ø: 12,5 mm) which fit into the connector parts of the dice or fit on top of the pawn/checker, and (4) a small tool (protecting your finger nails) to help you to remove easily the disks from the dice.

 

With this basic mould we can produce zap tools in any color. We plan to have zap dice/tools in next colors: white, red, blue, green, purple, yellow, grey, orange, lime and pink.

 The production in 1995 was complicated since all faces were locally printed with dots and designs. However that gave assembly problems during the handling in plastic bags. Some face-disks were mixed. Therefore we will work now with small transparent stickers that you can glue on the face-disks. You can choose yourself which one(s) when you compose your own zap dice.

 

Yet ten sticker sets.

 

We use small stickers to be glued on the face-disks.

 As a first step we have designed 10 different sticker sets, each with 60 different designs. Later we will design much more of such stickers, where people can make suggestions, or even offer their own design(s).

We designed 10 sticker sets; each has 60 small circular stickers. 7 sets have transparent plastic.  Six of the sets are printed in black with images, numbers, letters, objects, signs, symbols and actions. One set is in color.

 One set stays blank. This blank set is not printed so you can write, design or add with a fine permanent marker your own “information” or “value” on each of the little circular stickers.

One set is not transparent but based on white plastic. On that set is printed 60 times in color the “change-a-disk logo”. You can glue such small stickers on parts of the board or playfield of an existing board game to indicate that on that place you can change the disk of any dice, pawn or checker.

This change-a-disk logo will also appear on one or more of your face-disks in your "power" or "action" zap dice. 


What We Need & What You Get

 

Our goal is to have at least 5 production moulds with multi-units (1 zapdice frame + 12 disks + 1 second zap frame + 1 help-remove spoon). These parts are all connected to a small central plastic connector-beam. The users can easily remove each separate part from the connector by a simple turn of the hand.

 

1) The first mould where the second zap frame is a pawn (zap pawn). 

2) The second mould where the second zap frame is a checker (zap checker). 

3) The third mould where the second zap frame is a stratego mover (zap stratego).

4) The fourth mould where the second zap frame is another dice + 20 disks + 1 remove spoon (double zapdice).

5) The fifth mould just has 30 face-disks.

 The average price per mould is 18,750 $. That is a total cost of $93,750 for these 5 moulds.

 

Other costs: In addition to the costs for the moulds there are variable and fixed costs related to the initial stock of the zap dice, new 3D and 2D designs, Packaging design and stock, Office rent in Hong-Kong, Travel, Administration, handling and cost of EMS postal services for our perks. These additional costs are budgeted on 125,000$.

 

Thus the total project is 218,750$.

 

I want to contribute but what do I get?

 

We have a fork of contributions and related perks:  25$, 50$, 75$, 100$ and 125$.

 

A contribution of 25$ gives you a perk with next zap-parts:


a) 2 zap dice frame in colors:

-   •   white,

-   •   red.

b) 24 zap faces, 12 disks in the same 2 colors;

c) 2 zap pawns in the same 2 colors;

d) 2 remove tools in the same 2 colors;

e) 180 face-stickers (3 sets with each 60 face-stickers).

 

This perk set will be send by EMS postbox after 60 days the Indiegogo campaign ends or from the moment we have reached half of our goal, because we need (1) about 30 days for the making of the moulds, and (2) after that, starting the mould-injection production of the zap-parts and the packaging. We will be able to make 10,000 zap sets per working day per mould.


A contribution of 50$ gives you a perk with next zap-parts:


a) 4 zap dice frame in colors:

-              •    white,

-              •   red,

-              •   blue,

-              •   green.

b) 48 zap face-disks, 4 x 12 disks in the same 4 colors;

c) 4 zap pawns in the same 4 colors;

d) 4 remove tools in the same 4 colors;

e) 300 face-stickers (5 sets with each 60 face-stickers).

 

This perk set will be send by EMS postbox after 60 days the Indiegogo campaign ends or from the moment we have reached half of our goal, because we need (1) about 30 days for the making of the moulds, and (2) after that, starting the mould-injection processing of the zap-parts and the packaging. We will be able to make 10,000 zap sets per working day per mould..

 

A contribution of 75$ gives you a perk with next zap-parts:

a) 6 zap dice frame in colors:

-             •  white,

-             •   red,

-             •   blue,

-             •  green,

-             •  purple,

-             •  yellow.

b) 72 zap face-disks, 6 x 12 disks in the same 6 colors.

c) 6 zap pawns in the same 6 colors;

d) 6 remove tools in the same 6 colors;

e) 480 face-stickers (8 sets with each 60 face-stickers).

 

This perk set will be send by EMS postbox after 60 days the Indiegogo campaign ends or from the moment we have reached half of our goal, because we need (1) about 30 days for the making of the moulds, and (2) after that, starting the mould-injection production of the zap-parts and the packaging. We will be able to make 10,000 zap sets per working day per mould..


 A contribution of 100$ gives you a perk with next zap-parts:


a) 8 zap dice frame in colors:

-             •   white,

-             •    red,

-            •    blue,

-            •    green,

-            •   purple,

-            •   yellow,

-            •   grey,

-            •   orange.

b) 96 zap face-disks, 8 x12 disks in the same 8 colors.

c) 8 zap pawns in the same 8 colors;

d) 8 remove tools in the same 8 colors;

e) 600 face-stickers (10 sets with each 60 face-stickers)

f)  Additionally we add 150 zap face-disks in various colors.

 This perk set will be send by EMS postbox after 60 days the Indiegogo campaign ends or from the moment we have reached half of our goal, because we need (1) about 30 days for the making of the moulds, and (2) after that, starting the mould-injection processing of the zap-parts and the packaging. We will be able to make 10,000 zap sets per working day per mould..

 

 

A contribution of 125$ gives you a perk with next zap-parts , and with an additional 300 face-disks:

a) 10 zap dice frame in colors:

-             •   white,

-             •   red,

-             •    blue,

-             •   green,

-             •   purple,

-             •   yellow,

-             •    grey,

-             •   orange,

-             •   Lime (yellow-green),

-             •   pink.

b) 120 zap faces, 10 x12 disks in the same 10 colors.

c) 6 zap pawns in the same 10 colors.

d) 6 remove tools in the same 10 colors.

e) 300 additional face-disks in a mix of the 10 colors.

f) 600 face-stickers (10 sets with each 60 face-stickers).

 

This perk set will be send by EMS postbox after 60 days the Indiegogo campaign ends or from the moment we have reached half of our goal, because we need (1) about 30 days for the making of the moulds, and (2) after that, starting the mould-injection processing of the zap-parts and the packaging. We will be able to make 10,000 zap sets per working day per mould..


During this Indiegogo campaign we will create a new special zap sticker set for Dungeons and Dragons role-playing games. We will add this D&D sticker set (60 small face stickers) to all perks ($25 to $125) as an extra gift.

 

For the administration of the perks and orders, credits and add-ons we will use the www.backerkit.com post management system.

 

What is the Impact of our Zap Dice Campaign?

 

The Zap Concept is going to create a revolution in toptable games, with exciting variations of games like Snakes and Ladders, Parcheesi, Monopoly®, Risk, and … Collector card games and other RPG’s.

 In general we can say that Zap Concept changes completely the mechanics of toptable games, and creates new ways to play our favorite board games and role-playing games. Did you know that in 1994/1995 a new draft edition of D&D (Dungeons and Dragons) of TSR was designed with the Zap dice? The stupid lawyer of TSR prevented an agreement.

The zap dice can solve a lot of the problems D&Ds have because a number of zap die can focus on specific tasks in RPG’s, like by a Game Master Dice, a Charisma Dice, a Level Dice, a Battle Dice, a Map Dice, a Trap Dice, Food Dice, Wormhole Dice, two or three weapons Die, a Spells Dice, etc., each with related zap faces.

 With the Zap Dice the players have suddenly a new freedom to use logic and strategy combined with “luck dynamics” in an unprecedented way. The player is no longer dependent on the traditional mathematical random outcome. No, the player can now adapt the dice (the traditional randomizer) and the game pieces the way he wants. I call this guiding luck.

But that’s not all! The player can influence the game by the possibility to give and transfer powers, skills, values, and properties to other parts of the game, the like of the pawns, the checkers and Stratego movers.

Just a simple example: Imagine a chess-game where a simple pawn receives the power to jump as a knight!

 For game-inventors the Zap approach is a heaven. The face-disks offer the possibilities to avoid complex problems in design, like the need to use extra cards to give instructions or chance. Now it is possible to create a “power” dice, a “functions” dice, a “trash” dice, a ‘chance” dice (with go-to-jail, pay-100$-tax, receive-500$ faces, etc) or a “NASDAQ” dice with tickers! And such special die can be thrown together or … depending on the rules. So, imagination unlimited.

 

And there is more! You can adapt your actual games with our zap stickers. Just glue some stickers on certain spots of the board. You want to give more excitement to Hasbro’s Monopoly®? You just glue a “change-disk-logo” on each Station. Thus on arrival on a station that player has the right to change a face of his own zap dice or of his zap pawn, or in the zap dice or zap pawn of one of an other player! A special transfer or trash zap dice can contain the face-disks that were “stolen” before and are now available for retransfer.

 Next image shows how the Parcheesi game can be adapted with change-a-disk-stickers.


I hope you will contribute to our Zap Dice campaign. That way you help to save the zap concept for the future, and you help to bring back the Zap tools in physical reality. The traditional dice exists for more than 5,000 years. With the zap dice we modernize the old Die, like we live now in a society with more freedom, choice and possibilities than there was before. The zap concept offers us the possibility to include thousands of objects, actions and interacting processes in our analysis of the complex world we live in. This zap concept even resembles real life. Most toptable games are a mini reflection of one or a combination of the certain aspects of life in our society. When we understand that we can guide “luck” in a limited way and if we can master it’s  mechanics by logic, experience and lateral thinking, we can become a winner. If although we make the wrong choice(s), we may loose. That’s one of the insights the Zap dice and it’s zap companions learn us. That’s why this campaign is important.

 

                                        ----------------------------- 

If you cannot contribute to our Zap Dice campaign there are other ways you can help!

Some suggestions:

(1) If you have artistic skills you might want to design - copyright free - a number of original face-disks. That would be very useful. Especially sports-related zap faces and Dungeons & Dragons designs are needed. For D&D I think about faces for Medieval Magic Weapons, Charisma, Skills, Monsters, Worlds, Combat, Level, Spells and the Game Master Die. Your name will be printed as “designed by: credit your name and email address” on such D&D or sports sticker set. However you must keep in mind that the logo’s of sports clubs are mostly trademarks. Please send your ideas about stickers to zapstickers(at)zapdice.com or to dungeons(at)zapdice.com. Thank you!

(2) If you have original ideas of special game-frames (game pieces in 3D like ships, cars, airplanes, …) we would appreciate your suggestions. We have already the idea to make special 3D-head disks to put on top of the zap pawns. 

These can be perfect for D&D games and RPGs.

If you have other original ideas or even .stl-files or .stp-files, please send them to zapsuggestions(at)zapdice.com. Thank you!

(3) If you like the zap concepts and if believe that this is a fundamental innovation in gaming you might want to inform the public by publishing an entry in the dice section of Wikipedia. Thank you!

(4) You can help also by promoting our Zap Dice Indiegogo campaign or inform friends or people on Internet about the Zap concepts (your web site, forums, blogs, facebook, YouTube or other social media). You can use the Indiegogo share tools to make real noise! Thank you!

                                              ---------------------------

As last point next disclaimer about copyrights: By your contribution you receive automatically the right to use personally the zap rules as described in the above mentioned USA-copyrights and partly published on the website www.zapdice.com. However this counts not for commercial use to distribute zap games for sale. If you developed a new great toptable game based on the zap concept and you have the intention to commercialize it you just request a distribution license (license(at)zapdice.com), and probably the only condition we will have is that the production of the zap parts will be through our new company.

EMS postbox after 60 days the Indiegogo campaign ends or from the moment we have reached half of our goal, because we need (1) about 30 days for the making of the moulds, and (2)
after that, starting the mould-injection processing of the zap-parts and the
packaging. We will be able to make 10,000 zap sets per working day per mould.. 
During this Indiegogo
campaign we will create a new special zap sticker set for Dungeons and Dragons
role-playing games. We will add this D&D sticker set (60 small face
stickers) to all perks ($25 to $125) as an extra gift.
 
For the administration of the
perks and orders, credits and add-ons we will use the www.backerkit.com post
management system.
 
What is the Impact of our Zap
Dice Campaign?
 
The Zap Concept is going to
create a revolution in toptable games, with exciting variations of games like
Snakes and Ladders, Parcheesi, Monopoly®, Risk, and … Collector card games and
other RPG’s. 
 In general we can say that
Zap Concept changes completely the mechanics of toptable games, and creates new
ways to play our favorite board games and role-playing games. Did you know that
in 1994/1995 a new draft edition of D&D (Dungeons and Dragons) of TSR was
designed with the Zap dice? The stupid lawyer of TSR prevented an agreement.
The zap dice can solve a lot
of the problems D&Ds have because a number of zap die can focus on specific
tasks in RPG’s, like by a Game Master Dice, a Charisma Dice, a Level Dice, a
Battle Dice, a Map Dice, a Trap Dice, Food Dice, Wormhole Dice, two or three
weapons Die, a Spells Dice, etc., each with related zap faces. 
 With the Zap Dice the players
have suddenly a new freedom to use logic and strategy combined with “luck
dynamics” in an unprecedented way. The player is no longer dependent on the
traditional mathematical random outcome. No, the player can now adapt the dice
(the traditional randomizer) and the game pieces the way he wants. I call this
guiding luck.
But that’s not all! The
player can influence the game by the possibility to give and transfer powers,
skills, values, and properties to other parts of the game, the like of the
pawns, the checkers and Stratego movers.Just a simple example: Imagine a
chess-game where a simple pawn receives the power to jump as a knight! 
 For game-inventors the Zap
approach is a heaven. The face-disks offer the possibilities to avoid complex
problems in design, like the need to use extra cards to give instructions or
chance. Now it is possible to create a “power” dice, a “functions” dice, a
“trash” dice, a ‘chance” dice (with go-to-jail, pay-100$-tax, receive-500$
faces, etc) or a “NASDAQ” dice with tickers! And such special die can be thrown
together or … depending on the rules. So, imagination unlimited.
 
And there is more! You can
adapt your actual games with our zap stickers. Just glue some stickers on
certain spots of the board. You want to give more excitement to Hasbro’s
Monopoly®? You just glue a “change-disk-logo” on each Station. Thus on arrival
on a station that player has the right to change a face of his own zap dice or
of his zap pawn, or in the zap dice or zap pawn of one of an other player! A
special transfer or trash zap dice can contain the face-disks that were
“stolen” before and are now available for retransfer. 
 Next image shows how the
Parcheesi game can be adapted with change-a-disk-stickers.
I hope you will contribute to
our Zap Dice campaign. That way you help to save the zap concept for the
future, and you help to bring back the Zap tools in physical reality. The
traditional dice exists for more than 5,000 years. With the zap dice we
modernize the old Die, like we live now in a society with more freedom, choice
and possibilities than there was before. The zap concept offers us the
possibility to include thousands of objects, actions and interacting
processes in our analysis of the complex world we live in. This zap concept
even resembles real life. Most toptable games are a mini reflection of one or a
combination of the certain aspects of life in our society. When we understand that
we can guide “luck” in a limited way and if we can master it’s  mechanics by
logic, experience and lateral thinking, we can become a winner. If although we
make the wrong choice(s), we may loose. That’s one of the insights the Zap dice
and it’s zap companions learn us. That’s why this campaign is important. 
 
                                        ----------------------------- 
If you cannot contribute to
our Zap Dice campaign there are other ways you can help!
Some suggestions: 
(1) If you have artistic
skills you might want to design - copyright free - a number of original face-disks. That would be very useful. Especially sports-related zap faces and
Dungeons & Dragons designs are needed. For D&D I think about faces for
Medieval Magic Weapons, Charisma, Skills, Monsters, Worlds, Combat, Level,
Spells and the Game Master Die. Your name will be printed as “designed by:
credit your name and email
address” on such D&D or sports
sticker set. However you must keep in mind that the logo’s of sports clubs are
mostly trademarks. Please send your ideas about stickers to
zapstickers(at)zapdice.com or to dungeons(at)zapdice.com. Thank you!
(2) If you have original
ideas of special game-frames (game pieces in 3D like ships, cars, airplanes, …)
we would appreciate your suggestions. We have already the idea to make special
3D-head disks to put on top of the zap pawns. These can be perfect for D&D games and RPGs.
If you have other original
ideas or even .stl-files or .stp-files, please send them to
zapsuggestions(at)zapdice.com. Thank you!
(3) If you like the zap
concepts and if believe that this is a fundamental innovation in gaming you might want to
inform the public by publishing an entry in the dice section of Wikipedia. Thank
you!
(4) You can help also by
promoting our Zap Dice Indiegogo campaign or inform friends or people on Internet
about the Zap concepts (your web site, forums, blogs, facebook, YouTube or
other social media). You can use the Indiegogo share tools to make real noise!
Thank you!
                                              ---------------------------
As last point next disclaimer
about copyrights: By your contribution you receive automatically the right to
use personally the zap rules as described in the above mentioned USA-copyrights
and partly published on the website www.zapdice.com. However this counts not for commercial use to
distribute zap games for sale. If you developed a new great toptable game based
on the zap concept and you have the intention to commercialize it you just
request a distribution license (license(at)zapdice.com), and probably the only
condition we will have is that the production of the zap parts will be through
our new company.

story:
As I describe, my primary profession is Psychology. However, I always kept an extraordinary interest in creativity, mainly in media products for children: TV, theater, animated characters, 3D animation and others.


Watching my grandsons using cell apps and watching a video, I designed a game that is a combination of colors. The main objective was to provide the entire family with a way to interact, just as we were used doing in our childhood. They engaged incredibly quickly and enjoyed playing with it for hours. I felt that the result could be translated to almost every family.


The game’s rules are easy to learn and the more they practice,  they begin to discover the logic and the strategies to earn more points and stop the opponents from getting theirs.


My idea is to give at least 1000 units (of acrylic model) to Charter schools to help youngsters discover the fun of a board game, enhance the awareness of colors, develop logic and strategic skills.


Since Internet apps are an undisputable reality, I plan to develop a digital version that will maintain the basic features of the "material" version, including being interactive among players.


To do all that I'm requesting $50,000.00 (US Dollars)


Some of the items I consider:


Inclusion of the invention in the InventHelp virtual trade show
Listing in an edition of the product in Invention catalog to be presented to Companies
Attendance to 32 trade shows and exhibition of products to Companies
Contacting Companies expressing initial interest
Presentation to potential License agreements
Press release and posting to an online publicity distribution services
Production of a demo prototype of a Digital version of the game, including:
Preparation of the tech specifications and project management
 Core logic, game rules
Graphics integration
AI
 Debugging, testing, polishing
Presentations, brochure design, 3d Presentations, etc.
Trips to negotiate with potential buyers


HEXAGONON aims to bring back to families all over the world the joy of face-to-face interaction among friends and family alike.


All my extended experience creating and producing creative products for all ages will facilitate the presence of HEXAGONON to public of all cultures

story:
Who Are We

It's Your Turn Livestream is a discussion and game walkthrough channel. Each discussion is focused on individual topics, kickstarter practices, and board game related issues that can be improved on. This one-on-one discussion not only gives the audience the viewpoints from both the publisher and the consumer/content creator; audience interaction is encouraged. Similar to an AMA (ask me anything), we answer questions live on the stream. In our game walkthroughs, each episode starts with a quick how to play then immediately launches into a game playthrough. As we play through games, each host talks to the audience about strategies and go further into detail of the mechanics of the game. It's Your Turn Livestream also just launched a playtest option for new game designers and publishers to aid in getting their game ready for Kickstarter. (PM us for more details)

TLDR Game Series is a standalone review channel. We made this separation between our channels to keep our reviews honest. These reviews provide fun, engaging, concise, and knowledgable content for viewers to enjoy while on the go. In each video, we provide a quick overview of the game then explain what we liked and what we found could be improved on in each game. Instead of concluding each review with an arbitrary point or start system we just ask three questions:

  • Would you recommend?
  • Would you play it again?
  • Would you buy? 

This allows you, the viewer, to continue the conversation about whether a game is for you.

 

Fundraising Goal

Below you will find our fundraising targets:

$1500: (LOCKED) Funded! More content on both channels and new equipment! Over the past year we decided that if we wanted to make the content we wanted to see that it was going to take equipment we just didn't have. So, what did we end up doing? Rented it. At this goal level we will be able to purchase the equipment and be able to be more consistent in our content. No more waiting for shipping and delivery dates.

$2500: (LOCKED) A monthly how to play video and continuation of our monthly game giveaway! At this goal level we will add in How to Play videos. Our how to play videos is what got us started in the content creation side of board games. These how to plays will be filmed from the player's perceptive and narrated by a voice actor. See sample below. Also, to give back to our supporters we started with a monthly giveaway on our reviewed games. So at this goal we will be unlocking another year of giveaways.

$3000: (LOCKED) 'Mechanics Monday / Monthly Top 10' the beginnings of our new channel 'Behind the Board': Our next project that we want to launch in November is a daily livestream dedicated to what happens behind the board. Each day will focus on its own series about the board game industry. This goal opens up our 'Mechanics Monday / Monthly Top 10'. The series will dissect a mechanic each episode and show off which games effectively use it.   

This content is in partnership with the Board Game Revolution Network. Thanks to Thomas Covert and his fantastic admins and community we will have a home on their Twitch channel and Facebook page. 

$3500: (LOCKED) 'Kickstarter Tuesday': The 'Kickstarter Tuesday' series focuses on games launching on Kickstarter. We will go over all new games launching in a quick fire rundown then follow up with sponsored highlighted campaigns. These highlights will show off game components, how to play, and overview of gameplay.

$4000: (LOCKED) 'Women In Gaming': We're really excited about this series. With special host Jenna Marion, this series will focus on acknowledging the women in gaming. Filled with interviews, discussions, and game strategies we hope to dissolve the barrier and misconceptions out there about being a female within the gaming community.

$4500: (LOCKED) 'The Design Room': 'The Design Room' series focus will be on game designers talking about what it is like building a game from idea to retail. Each going in-depth on which area of the board game process was the most difficult for them and giving advice to potential new game designers. 

$5000: (LOCKED) 'Game Day!' Our channel is here!: Our full channel is live! (More details to come once unlocked)

 

Perks

$1 - Contributor level 1 - Thank you for your support! At this pledge level you will receive a personal thank you letter from me for believing and supporting in our content.

  • personal thank you letter

$10 - Contributor level 2 - Thank you for your support!  At this pledge level you will receive a personal thank you letter from me for believing and supporting in our content. You will also get access to our exclusive discord channel to talk to us one on one.

  • personal thank you letter
  • access to discord channel

$25 - Associate Producer - this perk adds you to our mailing list. In these monthly emails, you will get to know ahead of time what games and giveaways are coming up. Not only that, you will be able to take part of our poll to decide what game should be reviewed in the coming months. Producers will be thanked at the end of every video.

  • personal thank you letter
  • access to discord
  • first to know whats coming up
  • named at the end of recorded content

$50 - Producer - this perk you will get exclusive behind to scenes content of what goes into making our content. This will include our livestreams, preview videos, how to plays, and reviews. Each producer will also get access to our pre-recorded content early.

  • personal thank you letter
  • access to discord
  • first to know whats coming up
  • named at the end of recorded content
  • behind the scenes
  • sneak peak

$100 or more - Executive Producer - Ever wanted to be on the editing room floor to help make decisions? Or wish you could give feedback before one of your subscribed channels posted their latest video? This is the pledge for those who want to help out in the creative process! You will get to help us improve all our videos before they go live and get creative control.

  • personal thank you letter
  • access to discord
  • first to know whats coming up
  • named at the end of recorded content
  • behind the scenes
  • sneak peak
  • creative control with us

$50 and up - Publisher Only - This perk opens up special introductory pricing on ads and videos for your upcoming kickstarter project! Starting at $50, we will include you in a sponsored spot on It's Your Turn Livestream starting 6 weeks before your campaign. Add $75 to be highlighted on our Kickstarter Tuesday. Add $100 for a preview video for your game. PM for more details.

  • Weekly ad space on our livestream
  • Sponsored highlight and component breakdown during campaign
  • Preview video

 

Community Support

This past year has been a blast. Because of our followers and subscribers we have been able to make the content we envisioned. Without you, we probably would have stopped after the third video and for that... Thank you.

 

Where can you find us?

It's Your Turn Livestream Facebook and It's Your Turn Livestream YouTube

TLDR Game Series Facebook and TLDR Game Series YouTube

We have also provided content on the Board Game Revolution Community.

 

Why support us

We know there are a lot of content creators for board games out there and more still popping up every day. What makes us different is that we strive to improve our content with every video and to someday be able to change the current video medium that is available today.

We hope you consider donating to our cause. Thank you.

story:
We are already producing some of the components for GT9S, so we decide to have a head start. We plan to begin shipping soon after the campaign completes. (first in first out)

  

Our story:

Geeetech, found in 2011 ,specializes in 3D printing， EDB(Embedded Development Board), MCU as well as open source hardware design, produce and sales. We can  provide you a  wide  range of electronic parts and components , especially 3D printer control boards and accessaries in virtue of the largest electronic market (Seg & HuaQiang market) and the most complete chain of electronics industry in China,even in the world.

We have 3 different versions of printer designed by our engineer and they are are selling quiet well , the other two new printers will be unveiled  recently. please stay tuned .We also have different extruder in our company from GT1 to GT9 . For GT9, our engineers create distinctive designs, making this extruder more suitable for our friends to use. We have already produced some parts of this extruder, all of them works well. And now we are launching this campaign to raise funds for the volume purchase of raw materials to keeo our project moving forward and to get more people know us , this is where you come in.


About extruder:

With the increasing popularity of 3 d printing, more and more printer appeared in our life, printing technology update rapidly, especially in the design of extruder. Take our team as example; through constant innovation and continuous improvement, we have designed 12 models of extruder, standard and Bowden in 3 years. GT9s is our latest one. This extruder adopts high-quality aluminum alloy heat radiator and brass nozzle, with stainless steel pipe as feeding pipe, which ensures good heat insulation effect and prevents blockage. Its surface is covered with anodic oxide coating, which can resist oxidation corrosion and increase nozzle hardness and surface area of heat radiator. Besides, the cooling fan directly faces to operation area. All such special designs ensure better heat insulation as well as finer and more stable printing.If you are aspiring for higher stability of Print technology, our GT9S is a good choice for you.

 Cool end: Motor-driven, simple structure, easy to assemble. The fan is better in heat insulation that reduce the workload for the motor, so that it can work more stability for a long time.


Hot End : Metal J-head V2.0- hotend high temperature, stable, brass nozzles, fixed with cooling fan that makes heat better and more stable, fan mounting bracket can be connected to a nozzle heating block and bottom bracket, fixed more stable.

Design

We are looking for a better design that can avoid the same problem as traditional hotends suffer. So we add the cooling fan directly faces to the operating area. Besides, PTFE and PEEK are replaced by the stainless steel pipe which ensures more stable printing.

Design Features:

  • Material: all-metal
  • Suitable raw material: PLA and ABS
  • Printing resolution: 0.1mm
  • Molding form: FDM
  • Printing thickness: 0.1mm-0.3mm
  • Nozzle temperature: 180℃-260℃
  • Movement speed: 50cc
  • Outline dimensions: 85*53*119 mm (L/W/H)
  • Weight: 525g
  • Input voltage: default to 12V
  • Flow rate in nozzle: about 24cc/h
  • Printing material: 1.75mm or 3mm ABS or PLA
  • Cooling fan: operating voltage defaulted to 12V
  • Heating voltage of extruding head: 12V
  • Thermistor: 100K 1% high-precision NTC Thermistor

All the size of the extruder is well-designed by our engineer.

 coolend

 hotend

What can we do with the GT9S?

install GT9S on your 3D printer, you can print any ornaments you want as long as you have the g code for the model you are printing. Like lampshade, shoes, cup, portrait, toy…….. GT9S can be compatible with most 3D printers, including the following 3 printers from our company..

 Unassembled-Full kit for JIETAI Delta Rostock minn

 Unassembled-Full kit for Prusa Mendel I3(iteration 3)

 Unassembled-Full kit for Prusa Mendel I2(iteration 2)

Sample printer

Education, Manufacturing, high-technology also need a lot of 3D printing products. Because both the cose, speed and accuracy are better than traditional technology. The 3D printing technology is also suit for mass production. So it will bring us much more benefits if we use 3D printing in our life, it also is no longer a problem for the quality.


Rewards



Thank you for your support!!
www.geeetech.com

to have a head start. We plan to begin shipping soon after the campaign 
completes. (first in first out)

and sales. We can  provide you a  wide  range of electronic parts and 
components , especially 3D printer control boards and accessaries in 
virtue of the largest electronic market (Seg & HuaQiang market) and 
the most complete chain of electronics industry in China,even in the 
world.
We have 3 different versions of printer designed by our engineer and 
they are are selling quiet well , the other two new printers will be 
unveiled  recently. please stay tuned .We also have different extruder 
in our company from GT1 to GT9 . For GT9, our engineers create 
distinctive designs, making this extruder more suitable for our friends 
to use. We have already produced some parts of this extruder, all of 
them works well. And now we are launching this campaign to raise funds 
for the volume purchase of raw materials to keeo our project moving

story:
How Game Club came to be

I was placed at Craigmillar Library after library staff submitted a proposal for a Reading Champion to work with young people aged 10-18. The library has brilliant engagement with younger children – but when they move towards high school, they almost always stop attending the public library. 

I didn't want to parachute in and start things without speaking to the young folk in question, so the first thing I did in post was run focus groups in the local high schools – and in other partnership organisations – to determine what they'd most enjoy and benefit from. The word that kept coming up was “games.” I took this magical word back to the library staff and we spent a while thinking about ways in which we could combine games and gaming with books and reading. Then, in June 2016, we launched Game Club.

At Game Club – which is free, open to anyone aged 10-18, and meets every Monday evening in the library – we play analogue, table-top games with boards, dice, cards and tokens. All the games we play have a connection to reading, writing, storytelling and literacy. We play Once Upon A Time, a beautifully illustrated card game that allows the young people to write and share their own intricate fairytales. We play Storycubes, a pictoral dice game that serves as an always-random creative writing prompt with hundreds of variations. And we play Story Stones, a game created with inspiration from the Scottish Storytelling Centre – the young people use words painted on stones to create short, tactile, beautiful poems and short stories.

Now, the Game Club kids and teens are creating their own table-top game. They've spent the last few months planning it, and making mock-ups. The board would be a haunted house, and be built one room at a time, with each room like a new chapter of a story. The theme would be fairy tales: playable characters in the game include vampires, fairies, werewolves, witches and ghosts. Each new room the characters move into contains a new challenge, written by the kids themselves – solve a riddle before you can go on; do battle with a bad guy; open a secret chest and read the clue inside. The aim of the game is to find the hidden treasure room, and solve the various riddles and puzzles to be the first to unlock it.

What we'd like to do

We'd like to take this game from its current state (played using cards and pieces made of paper, drawn on with felt pens) all the way to industry-level completion.  We'd spend money from this crowdfund on:

  • Bringing in a game artist, illustrator or designer to run workshops with the group, and -- with their collaboration -- create a full set of game artwork
  • Having the game professionally printed and boxed -- as many copies as we can afford!
  • Distributing the printed games (entirely for free) to schools, libraries and other community settings -- we'd like the Game Club members to be able to sit down and play this game with their peers, families, teachers, or anyone they wanted to challenge!
  • Creating an accompanying set of PDF printables, so the game has the potential to travel anywhere -- it could be played in schools, libraries and communities across the world!

How this will benefit the Game Club

Craigmillar is a community in flux: there are lots of big changes happening in the form of regeneration, and the arrival of new buildings, businesses and organisations.  Though things are improving, Craigmillar remains one of Edinburgh's (and indeed, Scotland's) most deprived areas.  Investment in the local community is not only needed, but truly valued.

One of the things I heard when I started in my job as Reading Champion was: "the young people here don't settle to anything.  They start projects but then they drift away without finishing them.  We're currently struggling to improve that."

Against the odds -- transition to high school; homework; exams; family commitments and worries, and all manner of other barriers -- the young people who come to Game Club have kept on showing up, and have worked really hard over a period of several months to create their game.  They've worked together across community and cultural lines, bonded with their gaming peers and welcomed new people into their group.

The group are already proud of what they have made.  But a professionally-produced version of their brilliant game would make their work all the more worthwhile.  Right now, they play the game together in the library -- we'd like them to be able to play the game in their school library, or take it to the local council office and challenge the staff there, or even take it to the Scottish Parliament and see if the First Minister fancies a go.  Not to mention -- being able to put 'game developer' on your CV at the age of eleven?  Impressive, right?  We'd like this game to be another step on the road to a bright future for these young people.

Risks & Challenges

This is going to be hard work.  The young people already involved know that.  But they also know that they have other commitments, and can't always be in a specific room in a specific place at a specific time.  As library staff, we're accustomed to dealing with patchy attendance, or providing pastoral support when it's needed.  One of our challenges will be ensuring that other professionals we bring in to work on the game are also flexible enough to do this.

We've already encountered a lot of challenges along the way.  Happily, we come to this crowdfund with working mock-ups of the game already made -- we've already ironed out the game play and game mechanics, and have a rough idea of the physical form that the game will take.  Trust me -- this was not an easy process!  But while we're hoping that the hardest part of the process is over, we're always ready to solve new problems and figure out a collaborative solution to challenges that may arise.  The young people who attend Game Club are nothing if not resilient!

Other Ways You Can Help

We'd love it if you could give just a little bit of money to help us make this game a real thing in the world.  However, we understand that not everyone can do that.  But what you CAN do is one or all of the following:

  • Tweet about this campaign, share it on Facebook, blog about it, or otherwise spread the word online
  • Talk to people 'IRL' (in real life!) about this campaign.  Put it in front of people who like games, people who want to support libraries, people who engage with youngsters, or anyone who might be able to help us promote it

We'd be so grateful for any support you can offer!

Now... let the games begin!

story:
Hi, my name is Kenechukwu Ogbuagu KC. I am a 25 year old boardgame designer, publisher and producer in Nigeria - Africa's most populated country. Since I designed my first game in 2013, I have been volunteering and working with a charity to improve the quality of education and increase youth employment/participation in Nigeria.

Today, I am introducing you to 14 board games made in Nigeria. 

This campaign is a dream come true because growing up, I only played 7 board games as there where no other. However, my team and I have been able to change all of that. We have introduced new board games by designing new ones, organizing free tabletop gaming activities and introducing new boardgames through donations by amazing gamers worldwide. And the excitement when people play these games are beyond expression.

Getting these games to you will give us the opportunity to introduce African and Nigerian gaming story to you as well as understanding your perspective to our game story, mechanics, designs and production, it will also encourage us to continue improving the Tabletop gaming community in Nigeria.

We are hoping to get 100 of each of the games to the global Tabletop gaming community and the profit made from the games will help us open the first Tabletop Game Café in Nigeria. 

If we don’t reach our goal, we will persevere till we achieve it. However, we will continue to be grateful to people who will be getting our games or supporting in sharing our story.

The impact of your contribution can never be measured. Helping us reach this goal will:

  1. Enable us open a Tabletop board game café.
  2. Encourage us to continue building the tabletop gaming community in Nigeria.

Allow us understand your reaction to Nigerian board game design and production.

In the past, we have organized 2 yearly free board game conventions known as AB Con In 2016, it was termed “arguably the first board gaming convention in West Africa” by the Nigerian Television Authority (NTA). We have also organized free board gaming workshop for children since 2016, created and published weekly game puzzles in a National Dailies (best daily newspaper in Nigeria since 2015). Our work has received international and local publicity from news agencies such as Kenyan TV, Thomas Reuters, France 24 (french), NTA, Daily Trust Newspaper and a host of online blogs and magazine.

We have distributed over 6000 games that we have designed and produced in Nigeria; this has given us the avenue to change perception and introduce people to board gaming. This campaign will now help reach you too especially as we have been able to secure a ‘value for money’ shipping deal.

Our PERKS are designed carefully to give as much option depending on your budget. We have designed it to enable you get value for money for shipping price. Each shipping price can take up to 2KG of the games. 

  1. Big Games
  2. Medium Games
  3. Small Games
  4. Educational Games

BIG GAMES

MEDIUM GAMES

SMALL GAMES

EDUCATIONAL GAMES

 

Please see more about our games and what we are doing in Nigeria in this brochure.

Breakdown Budget of Setting up a TableTop Cafe in Abuja, Nigeria:

Exchange Rate: $1 to N359 

  • Renting a Space for one year: $1,949.8
  • 10 Playing Tables: $417.8
  • Interior Decoration: $278.6
  • Game Shelves: $222.8
  • Games (Through game donation, we have acquired 47 different games): $279
  • 30 Chairs: $585
  • Branding materials & Publicity: $279
  • 2 Volunteers allowance (for the period of 3 months): $501.4

Total cost of setting up the first Tabletop Cafe in Abuja, Nigeria is $4,513.4.

Each perk will donate the following to the the total cost.

  • $3 from 1 Educational Game Perk
  • $4 from 1 of any game perk 
  • $6 from 2 medium games + 1 small games
  • $7 from 1 medium game + 2 small games in perk
  • $8 from 2 big games perk
  • $10 from 1 big, 1 medium & 1 small game
  • $12 from 2 big games + 1 small game
  • $50 from All Games perk

What happens if target is not reached

If we are not able to secure the fund we need, we will look for a march funding however, if that also is not achieved, we will secure an agreement with with a hotel to use their space until we can get our own space. As this is limited especially with Nigeria environment, it is because it is really important and urgent to get a gaming cafe to give people who are already showing interest in boardgaming a safe environment to play and talk about games.

What happens if the target is exceeded?

We will be extremely excited. Then we get back to work. If it's enough to open another cafe in a new state, we will be able to do that. If it is not, we will host a regional boardgame competition for secondary schools.

Shipping Cost:

We have enquired and reached an agreement with DHL to deliver the games to doorsteps Worldwide. They are as follows:

For 0KG - 2kg worth of games:

  1. Europe: $27
  2. USA:$25
  3. UK:$21
  4. Africa: $15
  5. Nigeria:$3
  6. Rest of the World: $30

The perks have been designed to include quantity of games that is not more than 2KG at a time. This is value for money because the price of shipping o.1KG is the same for shipping 2KG

Please note:

  1. 5 Games perk:  (UK:$41, USA:$50, Euro:$53, Rest of the World:$60)
  2. All of the game perk: (UK:$79, USA:$97, Euro:$110, Rest of the World:$150)

This is because they are more than 2KG and the length, width, height and weight of the carton (for packaging) were taken into consideration.

Risks we would face are not beyond our control with adequate team and planning which we have. They include:

  1. Shipping problems: This has been ensured not to happen as we have given enough timeline to allow games get to you. Also, we have discussed the project with a senior member staff and have been assured of corporation.
  2. High expectation of our games: We are a growing gaming company in a region that has very little knowledge about Tabletop gaming community; this means there may be a difference due to your exposure on board games. Please do have an open mind.

We have never planned to do this alone. Your words about us does mean a lot. Please help us get the word out. We are grateful and thankful.

story:
TLG 8368 Of the Horned Gods Winter will be a perfect bound adventure for your Castles & Crusades game. Estimated at 70 pages.

STRETCH REWARD!

Of the Horned Gods Winter FUNDED in the first day and is on to final proofing and layout! IF we make it to $2000 and you've pledged $10 or more you'll receive a digital copy of the Codex of Aihrde Expansion: Gottland-Ne source book. This book will open a world of information for adventures in and around Of a Horned Gods Winter (though it only covers about the setting material for half the adventures)! Read more HERE! IF we make it to $3,000 Steve Chenault will pin the infomration for Codex of Aihrde Expansion: The Holmgrads!

Beyond the Inner Sea lie the high mountains of the Holmgard, the Roof of the World. Here the country is wild, and dangerous, sparsely settled by barbarians, dwarves and the occasional mad wizard. It is a hard land of narrow paths, deep canyons, cliffs without purchase; a land of snow and ice, that offers little comfort for those who risk her high walks. It is a land of giants, where giants once roosted, where dwarves built homes and dungeons. It is a land wholly forgotten but rich in lost treasures that echo a world long gone. It is one rich in adventure, filled with wealth beyond imagining and glory for those who do not fall.

Beyond the mountains lies the Gottland, the land without gods. This too is a land of imagined treasures, where giants, trolls and gods with cloven feet have walked for countless years. Many venture here, but only a few realize the dream of wealth everlasting for it is a hard place of primordial violence, ancient magics and one of the last vestiges of the Horned God’s Winter.

 Of the Horned Gods Winter is a series of loosely connected adventures that take the characters from the sea town of Capistria, through the mountains and down to the Plains of Doost. Along its path the characters may, at the CK’s discretion, encounter rune magic, either for their Rune Mark or for the character wishing to become one. The 15 adventures are designed to play alone, or as part of a broader campaign arc. Each adventure is written such that the enterprising CK can add their own adventures to the mix.

Of the Horned God’s Winter is designed for a party of 4-6 characters of 4th-7th level. It includes overland adventures, sea adventures, dungeon and castle.

The Adventurers Backpack (ABP): Available with the highest perk, this hardcover full color book brings 13 additional classes to the C&C game table as well as new equipment, rules on mounts, combat, plane travel and so much more. Follow the link to learn more.

New to Castles & Crusades? Download the PHB for free here!

What We Need & What You Get

We need about $1000 to have a new cover created and to get these printed and released. We want to keep this very focused and are offering the adventure in the following format:

  • 70 (est) page adventure with accompanying maps
  • Digital PDF with enhanced books marks
  • Print copy with UV Coated Covers
  • Perfect bound in our own shop
  • Ships anywhere
  • Priced for your budget

Risks & Challenges

Publishing is always a risky business, print costs and distribution are always hurdles that must be overcome. With your help we can navigate these with our own print shop and over 20 years in the business.

Visit us at www.trolllord.com
