story:
Artwork in progress:

For any game designer, the opportunity to work with Hasbro is a dream come true.  When told that Trash Pandas was one of the five finalists, we pretty much felt like Charlie with his "golden ticket."  This isn't just because of the cash prize, but if Trash Pandas is selected as the winner, we get to tour the Hasbro headquarters!  However, we can't do this alone.  We need your help to make this a reality, so please join us on this crazy ride and let's have some fun!

Hi! I'm Michael Eskue, designer of Council of Verona, Darkrock Ventures, For The Win, and some other games coming out soon. My wife, Lisa, and I have been working on Trash Pandas for a while and are excited to finally make it available. Lisa and I have enjoyed board and card games since before we met in 1999. Our love for games has grown, and is now a regular part of our lives. We use games for teaching our three children and enjoy playing with family and friends. Board gaming has opened up so many doors for us and we have met some truly amazing people along the way.

As the game developed, Lisa and I were in the process of moving from Tucson to the White Mountains, which led to our first encounters with raccoons, skunks, and other forest wildlife. We were discussing possible themes and the idea of raccoons collecting trash/treasure suddenly clicked – possibly due to the late-night trashcan rummaging which we've finally encountered in our own back yard.

 

Overview:

Roll the die:

 

 

 

 

 

Take the token that matches the die result:

 

 

 

 

 

Decide to stop, or continue rolling.  As long as you stop before rolling a duplicate result, you don't "bust" and may then activate all the tokens you have collected. 

With each successful roll, your options increase, but so do your chances of failure on subsequent rolls.

For each token you activate, you gain more cards, or stash cards from your hand.  During your turn, you may use cards for their action, or stash them for points at the end of the game. 

When the deck runs out, players count the cards in their stash and score points based on majority.  The player with the most points wins!

 

 

Game rules found HERE

Rules overview:

 
 
Tabletop Simulator session with Andrew Christopher Enriquez (Ace from DFWNN):
 

 

 
(Images not final)

More final card images coming soon...

Trash Pandas is one of five finalists in Hasbro's Gaming Lab Contest!  The Grand Prize winner receives $25,000, a trip to the Hasbro headquarters, and the possibility of working with Hasbro to produce the game on a larger scale.  With your help, we have a real shot of making all that come true for Trash Pandas! 

 

NOTE - When backing the project, please be sure to select the related Perk.  Otherwise, it will just show up as a donation with no shipping address and you won't be on the list to receive the game(s).  If that happens, please request a refund to re-submit the contribution.  Sorry for any inconvenience.

 

To make Trash Pandas a reality, we need enough funding for a small (2000-3000 units) print run.  This includes all the costs required to get it in your hands.  We've already invested in artwork, prototypes, and other various expenses so we just need your help to put everything in motion. 

We'd like to get the game to anyone and everyone who wants to play it and have done everything we can to make it as affordable as possible.  This means we've streamlined the components, while keeping the quality high.  With more backers, we can increase the component quality even further since the printer gives price breaks at higher quantities.

The main perk is a copy of the game, but Trash Pandas was meant to be shared with friends and family.  Multi-copy tiers make it possible to grab a few (or more) extras so give to your gaming buddies for their birthday.  It also makes a great stocking stuffer so stock up and start stuffing!

Game contents:

53 cards

1 custom die

6 cardboard tokens

1 player aid

Rules

PLUS:  Any stretch goals from this campaign

 

Bearded Rogue (Tony Miller) checks out Trash Pandas

 

Ryan Sanders

http://www.theindiegamereport.com/michael-eskue-on-trash-pandas-and-the-fun-of-collecting-trash/

 

Christopher Richter - Boardgaming For the Win

https://boardgamingftw.wordpress.com/2017/01/11/indiegogo-trash-pandas/

 

Here's the episode of the DFW Nerd Nighters where we give more background on the game and the Hasbro contest:

 
"Lots of interesting choices that are easy enough for a younger/newer gamer to understand, yet deep enough for experienced gamers to really enjoy as a push your luck/take that filler." 
- Andrew Christopher Enriquez (Ace) from DFWNN
 
Glory Houndd
 
Review HERE
 
 
Cloak and Meeple checks out Trash Pandas (and shows off a tasty recipe)
 

 
Interview with Breaking Into Boardgames

 

More to come...

 
 

The perks of this campaign are pretty straight forward.  All backers, no matter the amount, will have our sincere gratitude.  Every supporter counts!  If you see me at a convention or anywhere out in the wild, just say "hey SQ, I backed your game on IndieGoGo" and bring it in for a high five, hug, or both.    All backers are included in updates, so you also get the prototype print and play files, and prototype Tabletop Simulator link.  Each copy of the game includes all stretch goals.  This means that everyone benefits as we cram more content in the box and upgrade the quality. 

 

We are super stoked to showcase the massive talents of Kwanchai Moriya! 

http://www.kwanchaimoriya.com/

We've been huge fans of Kwanchai's work since we first encountered it in the game Zombie in my Pocket.  Kwanchai has a distinct style that is immediately recognizable.  When looking for an artist for the game, we made a list of possible artist and decided to dream big.  Not only did Kwanchai agree to illustrate the game, he was excited about it and has been amazing to work with.

Kwanchai Moriya is an illustrator and painter. He was born in New York and grew up in the suburbs of Chicago. He completed his education with a degree in History from the University of California and a degree in Illustration from the Art Center College of Design. Kwanchai lives and works in Los Angeles, California with his lovely lady and pet tortoise.

He has a passion for making fun illustrations, and has worked primarily in board games, card games, and children's books. Kwanchai is also an avid painter, working mostly in acrylics with science fiction and fantasy themes. His other hobbies include making wood toys, playing board games, and backpacking.

Kwanchai has illustrated quite a few board games, including: Kodama, Prospectus, Loop Inc., Days of Ire, Capital Lux, and the Catacombs family of games.

 

Enjoying a prototype version of Trash Pandas at Flying Rook Games

When backing a crowd-funding campaign, there are generally three motivating factors:

Faster:  Backers of Trash Pandas will get their copies before the game is available elsewhere.  You also get access to print-and-play files as well as the digital version on Tabletop Simulator (separate purchase of the Tabletop Simulator application itself is required).

Better:  To keep things simple, this campaign doesn't have any "IndieGoGo exclusives."  However, by backing the game now, you allow us to make a larger print run, which lowers the overall cost and allows us to include more content in the final game.

Cheaper:  The MSRP of the final product hasn't been fully determined yet, but it should be around $20.  Backers of the game will get it at a significant discount.

Availability:  We are committed to a small print run of Trash Pandas.  However, the availability beyond this campaign is unknown.  It is not yet known if the game will make it into distribution or where you might find it once the campaign ends.  Backing this campaign is the best way to ensure Trash Pandas will make it into your collection.

 

Our journey to the Arizona Game Fair:

 

Our goal is to cram as much value in to the Trash Pandas box as possible.  With more funding, we can make a larger print run, which makes it possible to add more stuff.  The micro games listed here are super compact, but don't let their size fool you.  There are no "deluxe" versions of Trash Pandas, each game will include ALL of these stretch goals.  i.e. - With each goal met, everyone gets a MORE stuff in the box.

 

$3000 - Upgraded card quality

300g C2S upgraded to 300g Chinese black core

 

$5000 - Bonus game:  MicroBin

Rules found HERE

4 cards included (one for each player).  Bring your own D6, tokens, and pen/paper to keep score.  Press your luck micro game that is perfect for restaurants or other situations where you need a small, quick game.  MicroBin takes Trash Pandas and boils it down to the basic essence of the game so it gives a similar feel.  (Artwork not final)

 

$7,000 - Mmm... Pie!  Trash Panda Pizza Party

Date and exact location are TBA, but we'd love to meet up with our backers to celebrate.  We'll bring the pizza and drinks.  The location will likely be in the White Mountain area, but there is also the possibility of having it in Tucson, AZ.  Given the nature of this event, we realize it's not possible for everyone to join in, unfortunately.  However, if you are in the area, we certainly welcome you to join us as we scarf some pie and hopefully play some games.

 

 

$8,000 - Bonus game:  microulette

Rules found HERE

1 card included.  Bring your own D6 dice (3), three tokens, and pen/paper to keep score.  Another press your luck micro game that is perfect for restaurants or other situations where you need a small, quick game.  Microulette is the precursor to Darkrock Ventures, which developed into a full blown board game.  (Artwork not final)

 

 

$10,000 - Bonus game:  Trash Pandas Duel

Rules found HERE 

2 players - 9 cards (rules included).  Head-to-head game of charging up your lasers to blow up your opponents trash cans.  You know, just like real raccoons do when no one is watching.  (Artwork not final)

 

$20,000 - ????

 

 

 

$30,000 - ????

 

The artwork, prototypes, and other expenses have already been taken care of.  The funds from this campaign (after fees) go to the production and delivery of the game.  i.e. - getting Trash Pandas to your gaming table.

 

Currently, the plan for manufacturing is to go with LongPack Games.  They have been great to work with and through our communication, I'm confident that the process will be very smooth.

 

Currently, the plan for fulfillment (getting the game to your door) is to go with Quartermaster Logistics.  They also have been great to work with and very helpful in planning for the fulfillment process.  Quartermaster is associated with CoolStuffInc, which is where a huge chunk of our gaming library has come from and we have always had a great experience with CSI.

Shipping estimates:

This is an estimate of the shipping costs to various locations for the different quantities.  The exact weight will depend on the component quality and how many stretch goals are unlocked.  I apologize for the higher rates for some locations.  Unfortunately that is the nature of international shipping for a small project like this.  There should not be any extra customs charges for USA, EU, or Canada backers.  The items shipped are under $500 so this should not be an issue, but of course there are elements that we cannot fully control.

1 copy - 15 oz; 0.42 kg
US  $5
EU  $ 12
Canada  $14
Brazil  $40
Russian Federation $27
Rest of the world  $22

4 copies - 3.75 lbs; 1.68 kg
US  $10
EU  $14
Canada  $16
Brazil  $45
Russian Federation $30
Rest of the world  $35

8 copies - 7.5 lbs; 3.36 kgs
US  $12
EU  $15
Canada  $18
Brazil  $52
Russian Federation $32
Rest of the world  $54

12 copies - 11.25 lbs; 5.04 kgs
US  $14
EU  $16
Canada  $20
Brazil  $60
Russian Federation $35
Rest of the world  $70

 

By backing Trash Pandas, you not only get a great game, but you get to make dreams come true.  Every backer counts.  Even if you can't back at the higher perk levels, simply being here means the world to us!

Some of our previous game designs have been published, which has given us experience, insight, and great connections to the board gaming industry:

For The Win (Tasty Minstrel Games)

Council of Verona (Crash Games)

Darkrock Ventures (Gamelyn Games/Magic Meeple Games)

Coming soon:  Titan Dice (Eagle-Gryphon Games), Ballistic Reign (Level 99 Games), and Oracles (Talon Strikes Studios).

 

We've been designing and developing games for a while, but this is our first real attempt to publish a game. 

This campaign will definitely be a growing experience and we are confident that we have the support and resources to make it a success.  Trash Pandas is a relatively small game, so the production and delivery should be fairly straight forward.

One of the biggest challenges of producing a game is managing the production costs, shipping, and estimating the time it takes to get the game to the backers.  We have been closely involved with several other crowdfunding campaigns and learned quite a bit from their success and mistakes.  Though we are new to this particular arena, we have thoroughly researched these aspects to ensure our goals are attainable. 

Even if you can't support financially, we'd love to have you join this campaign.  Please help us get the word out by sharing on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Google+, Myspace, YouTwitFace, or whatever all the cool kids are using these days.   

 

Thanks to everyone who has helped us get this far and to everyone who will join us along the way!

 

 

Also, best of luck to the other four finalists.  They've all worked hard to put together great campaigns so please take a look if you have a few minutes.  Yes, we are all technically competing for the same prize, but these are some cool people and we wish them all the very best:

Aardvark’s Runaway Railroad

Aardvark’s Runaway Railroad is a fun cooperative train-themed game created by Steve Ehrensperger of Mission Viejo, California. The breaks on Aardvark’s train engine have failed and players must slow down and stop the Aardvark’s train by strategically adding tracks.

Chibi Quest!

Chibi Quest! is a fantasy adventure game created by Kelly North Adams of Windermere, Florida. Players customize their own Chibi character with cool armor and special items to defeat monsters and save the world. The player with the most defeated monsters win!

Cloud Control

Created by Eugene Bryant from Suwanee, Georgia, Cloud Control is a game of creative imagination where players try to score the most points by overlapping, turning, and twisting playing cards to form cloud shapes into recognizable objects before time runs out.

Monsters in The Elevator

Monsters in The Elevator is a cooperative early math game created by Jason Wiser of Somerville, Massachusetts. Players are collectively operating an elevator full of Monsters trying to go to work. If the Elevator gets too heavy, it breaks and everyone loses. If the Elevator gets to the 20th Floor without breaking, everyone wins!
story_txt:
Artwork in progress:




For any game designer, the opportunity to work with Hasbro is a dream come true.  When told that Trash Pandas was one of the five finalists, we pretty much felt like Charlie with his "golden ticket."  This isn't just because of the cash prize, but if Trash Pandas is selected as the winner, we get to tour the Hasbro headquarters!  However, we can't do this alone.  We need your help to make this a reality, so please join us on this crazy ride and let's have some fun!
Hi! I'm Michael Eskue, designer of Council of Verona, Darkrock Ventures, For The Win, and some other games coming out soon. My wife, Lisa, and I have been working on Trash Pandas for a while and are excited to finally make it available. Lisa and I have enjoyed board and card games since before we met in 1999. Our love for games has grown, and is now a regular part of our lives. We use games for teaching our three children and enjoy playing with family and friends. Board gaming has opened up so many doors for us and we have met some truly amazing people along the way.
As the game developed, Lisa and I were in the process of moving from Tucson to the White Mountains, which led to our first encounters with raccoons, skunks, and other forest wildlife. We were discussing possible themes and the idea of raccoons collecting trash/treasure suddenly clicked – possibly due to the late-night trashcan rummaging which we've finally encountered in our own back yard.


 

Overview:
Roll the die:

 
 
 
 
 
Take the token that matches the die result:

 
 
 
 
 
Decide to stop, or continue rolling.  As long as you stop before rolling a duplicate result, you don't "bust" and may then activate all the tokens you have collected. 

With each successful roll, your options increase, but so do your chances of failure on subsequent rolls.

For each token you activate, you gain more cards, or stash cards from your hand.  During your turn, you may use cards for their action, or stash them for points at the end of the game. 

When the deck runs out, players count the cards in their stash and score points based on majority.  The player with the most points wins!

 
 
Game rules found HERE
Rules overview:

 
 
Tabletop Simulator session with Andrew Christopher Enriquez (Ace from DFWNN):
 



 

 


(Images not final)

More final card images coming soon...


Trash Pandas is one of five finalists in Hasbro's Gaming Lab Contest!  The Grand Prize winner receives $25,000, a trip to the Hasbro headquarters, and the possibility of working with Hasbro to produce the game on a larger scale.  With your help, we have a real shot of making all that come true for Trash Pandas! 
 

NOTE - When backing the project, please be sure to select the related Perk.  Otherwise, it will just show up as a donation with no shipping address and you won't be on the list to receive the game(s).  If that happens, please request a refund to re-submit the contribution.  Sorry for any inconvenience.
 
To make Trash Pandas a reality, we need enough funding for a small (2000-3000 units) print run.  This includes all the costs required to get it in your hands.  We've already invested in artwork, prototypes, and other various expenses so we just need your help to put everything in motion. 
We'd like to get the game to anyone and everyone who wants to play it and have done everything we can to make it as affordable as possible.  This means we've streamlined the components, while keeping the quality high.  With more backers, we can increase the component quality even further since the printer gives price breaks at higher quantities.
The main perk is a copy of the game, but Trash Pandas was meant to be shared with friends and family.  Multi-copy tiers make it possible to grab a few (or more) extras so give to your gaming buddies for their birthday.  It also makes a great stocking stuffer so stock up and start stuffing!

Game contents:
53 cards
1 custom die
6 cardboard tokens
1 player aid
Rules
PLUS:  Any stretch goals from this campaign
 

Bearded Rogue (Tony Miller) checks out Trash Pandas

 
Ryan Sanders
http://www.theindiegamereport.com/michael-eskue-on-trash-pandas-and-the-fun-of-collecting-trash/

 
Christopher Richter - Boardgaming For the Win
https://boardgamingftw.wordpress.com/2017/01/11/indiegogo-trash-pandas/
 
Here's the episode of the DFW Nerd Nighters where we give more background on the game and the Hasbro contest:

 
"Lots of interesting choices that are easy enough for a younger/newer gamer to understand, yet deep enough for experienced gamers to really enjoy as a push your luck/take that filler." 
- Andrew Christopher Enriquez (Ace) from DFWNN

 
Glory Houndd

 
Review HERE


 
 
Cloak and Meeple checks out Trash Pandas (and shows off a tasty recipe)

 




 
Interview with Breaking Into Boardgames

 

More to come...
 
 

The perks of this campaign are pretty straight forward.  All backers, no matter the amount, will have our sincere gratitude.  Every supporter counts!  If you see me at a convention or anywhere out in the wild, just say "hey SQ, I backed your game on IndieGoGo" and bring it in for a high five, hug, or both.    All backers are included in updates, so you also get the prototype print and play files, and prototype Tabletop Simulator link.  Each copy of the game includes all stretch goals.  This means that everyone benefits as we cram more content in the box and upgrade the quality. 
 

We are super stoked to showcase the massive talents of Kwanchai Moriya! 

http://www.kwanchaimoriya.com/
We've been huge fans of Kwanchai's work since we first encountered it in the game Zombie in my Pocket.  Kwanchai has a distinct style that is immediately recognizable.  When looking for an artist for the game, we made a list of possible artist and decided to dream big.  Not only did Kwanchai agree to illustrate the game, he was excited about it and has been amazing to work with.
Kwanchai Moriya is an illustrator and painter. He was born in New York and grew up in the suburbs of Chicago. He completed his education with a degree in History from the University of California and a degree in Illustration from the Art Center College of Design. Kwanchai lives and works in Los Angeles, California with his lovely lady and pet tortoise.
He has a passion for making fun illustrations, and has worked primarily in board games, card games, and children's books. Kwanchai is also an avid painter, working mostly in acrylics with science fiction and fantasy themes. His other hobbies include making wood toys, playing board games, and backpacking.
Kwanchai has illustrated quite a few board games, including: Kodama, Prospectus, Loop Inc., Days of Ire, Capital Lux, and the Catacombs family of games.

 

Enjoying a prototype version of Trash Pandas at Flying Rook Games

When backing a crowd-funding campaign, there are generally three motivating factors:
Faster:  Backers of Trash Pandas will get their copies before the game is available elsewhere.  You also get access to print-and-play files as well as the digital version on Tabletop Simulator (separate purchase of the Tabletop Simulator application itself is required).
Better:  To keep things simple, this campaign doesn't have any "IndieGoGo exclusives."  However, by backing the game now, you allow us to make a larger print run, which lowers the overall cost and allows us to include more content in the final game.
Cheaper:  The MSRP of the final product hasn't been fully determined yet, but it should be around $20.  Backers of the game will get it at a significant discount.
Availability:  We are committed to a small print run of Trash Pandas.  However, the availability beyond this campaign is unknown.  It is not yet known if the game will make it into distribution or where you might find it once the campaign ends.  Backing this campaign is the best way to ensure Trash Pandas will make it into your collection.

 
Our journey to the Arizona Game Fair:

 



Our goal is to cram as much value in to the Trash Pandas box as possible.  With more funding, we can make a larger print run, which makes it possible to add more stuff.  The micro games listed here are super compact, but don't let their size fool you.  There are no "deluxe" versions of Trash Pandas, each game will include ALL of these stretch goals.  i.e. - With each goal met, everyone gets a MORE stuff in the box.
 

$3000 - Upgraded card quality
300g C2S upgraded to 300g Chinese black core
 

$5000 - Bonus game:  MicroBin
Rules found HERE
4 cards included (one for each player).  Bring your own D6, tokens, and pen/paper to keep score.  Press your luck micro game that is perfect for restaurants or other situations where you need a small, quick game.  MicroBin takes Trash Pandas and boils it down to the basic essence of the game so it gives a similar feel.  (Artwork not final)

 
$7,000 - Mmm... Pie!  Trash Panda Pizza Party
Date and exact location are TBA, but we'd love to meet up with our backers to celebrate.  We'll bring the pizza and drinks.  The location will likely be in the White Mountain area, but there is also the possibility of having it in Tucson, AZ.  Given the nature of this event, we realize it's not possible for everyone to join in, unfortunately.  However, if you are in the area, we certainly welcome you to join us as we scarf some pie and hopefully play some games. 
 

$8,000 - Bonus game:  microulette
Rules found HERE
1 card included.  Bring your own D6 dice (3), three tokens, and pen/paper to keep score.  Another press your luck micro game that is perfect for restaurants or other situations where you need a small, quick game.  Microulette is the precursor to Darkrock Ventures, which developed into a full blown board game.  (Artwork not final)

 
 

$10,000 - Bonus game:  Trash Pandas Duel
Rules found HERE 
2 players - 9 cards (rules included).  Head-to-head game of charging up your lasers to blow up your opponents trash cans.  You know, just like real raccoons do when no one is watching.  (Artwork not final)


 

$20,000 - ????
 
 
 

$30,000 - ????
 


The artwork, prototypes, and other expenses have already been taken care of.  The funds from this campaign (after fees) go to the production and delivery of the game.  i.e. - getting Trash Pandas to your gaming table.

 


Currently, the plan for manufacturing is to go with LongPack Games.  They have been great to work with and through our communication, I'm confident that the process will be very smooth.
 


Currently, the plan for fulfillment (getting the game to your door) is to go with Quartermaster Logistics.  They also have been great to work with and very helpful in planning for the fulfillment process.  Quartermaster is associated with CoolStuffInc, which is where a huge chunk of our gaming library has come from and we have always had a great experience with CSI.
Shipping estimates:
This is an estimate of the shipping costs to various locations for the different quantities.  The exact weight will depend on the component quality and how many stretch goals are unlocked.  I apologize for the higher rates for some locations.  Unfortunately that is the nature of international shipping for a small project like this.  There should not be any extra customs charges for USA, EU, or Canada backers.  The items shipped are under $500 so this should not be an issue, but of course there are elements that we cannot fully control.
1 copy - 15 oz; 0.42 kgUS  $5EU  $ 12Canada  $14Brazil  $40Russian Federation $27Rest of the world  $22
4 copies - 3.75 lbs; 1.68 kgUS  $10EU  $14Canada  $16Brazil  $45Russian Federation $30Rest of the world  $35
8 copies - 7.5 lbs; 3.36 kgsUS  $12EU  $15Canada  $18Brazil  $52Russian Federation $32Rest of the world  $54
12 copies - 11.25 lbs; 5.04 kgsUS  $14EU  $16Canada  $20Brazil  $60Russian Federation $35Rest of the world  $70
 

By backing Trash Pandas, you not only get a great game, but you get to make dreams come true.  Every backer counts.  Even if you can't back at the higher perk levels, simply being here means the world to us!
Some of our previous game designs have been published, which has given us experience, insight, and great connections to the board gaming industry:
For The Win (Tasty Minstrel Games)

Council of Verona (Crash Games)

Darkrock Ventures (Gamelyn Games/Magic Meeple Games)

Coming soon:  Titan Dice (Eagle-Gryphon Games), Ballistic Reign (Level 99 Games), and Oracles (Talon Strikes Studios).



 


We've been designing and developing games for a while, but this is our first real attempt to publish a game. 
This campaign will definitely be a growing experience and we are confident that we have the support and resources to make it a success.  Trash Pandas is a relatively small game, so the production and delivery should be fairly straight forward.
One of the biggest challenges of producing a game is managing the production costs, shipping, and estimating the time it takes to get the game to the backers.  We have been closely involved with several other crowdfunding campaigns and learned quite a bit from their success and mistakes.  Though we are new to this particular arena, we have thoroughly researched these aspects to ensure our goals are attainable. 



Even if you can't support financially, we'd love to have you join this campaign.  Please help us get the word out by sharing on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Google+, Myspace, YouTwitFace, or whatever all the cool kids are using these days.   



 



Thanks to everyone who has helped us get this far and to everyone who will join us along the way!


 

 Also, best of luck to the other four finalists.  They've all worked hard to put together great campaigns so please take a look if you have a few minutes.  Yes, we are all technically competing for the same prize, but these are some cool people and we wish them all the very best:Aardvark’s Runaway RailroadAardvark’s Runaway Railroad is a fun cooperative train-themed game created by Steve Ehrensperger of Mission Viejo, California. The breaks on Aardvark’s train engine have failed and players must slow down and stop the Aardvark’s train by strategically adding tracks.Chibi Quest!Chibi Quest! is a fantasy adventure game created by Kelly North Adams of Windermere, Florida. Players customize their own Chibi character with cool armor and special items to defeat monsters and save the world. The player with the most defeated monsters win!Cloud ControlCreated by Eugene Bryant from Suwanee, Georgia, Cloud Control is a game of creative imagination where players try to score the most points by overlapping, turning, and twisting playing cards to form cloud shapes into recognizable objects before time runs out.Monsters in The ElevatorMonsters in The Elevator is a cooperative early math game created by Jason Wiser of Somerville, Massachusetts. Players are collectively operating an elevator full of Monsters trying to go to work. If the Elevator gets too heavy, it breaks and everyone loses. If the Elevator gets to the 20th Floor without breaking, everyone wins!

story:
Pitch, Swing, and Hit TOWERING home runs with realistic players on a massive 5x5 feet tabletop diamond.

 

Play 1-on-1 in a head-to-head garage competition or divide your friends into two teams of All-Stars for a backyard World Series you'll never forget. There's no limits to how, when or where you can play baseball with StrikeZone.

And to keep things fair, you can use the free mobile app to keep score, track record-breaking stats, and share results with friends and rivals on your favorite social media platform.

 

Put the pen and paper away! We're bringing 21st century digital technology to baseball (not with robot umps...yet) so you can easily keep score in real-time.

Through nine innings of strikeouts, diving catches, and epic grand slams, you and your fellow players are in for countless hours of baseball fun! 

Having a big party? Turn the night into a StrikeZone Tournament.

Just tap the StrikeZone App after every in-game action and over time you can even track your records to share your Hall of Fame performances on social media.

From strikes and balls to outs, runs, and innings, the StrikeZone App has all your bases covered.

The StrikeZone App is free for all players.

 

 

Roll out the field and place your players on the diamond.

 

Flip a coin to see who bats or pitches first.

 

Load the StrikeZone baseball into the Pitcher's hand. Pull back on the spring-loaded lever and release to fire the plunger into the back of the ball - sending it towards home plate. 

 

With your left-hand, pull on the Batter's Line to raise and lower his arms and the bat. With your right-hand, pull back on the home plate lever to rotate your Batter's hips and swing through the ball.

 

  • If you hit the ball to a Fielder, or Pitcher before it hits the ground - you're out!
  • If you ground hit the ball to a Fielder, or Pitcher - you hit a single. (StrikeZone uses ghost runners to run the bases).
  • If you ground hit a ball past everyone - you hit a double or a triple based on where it rolled off the edge of the field (as marked by a 2 or a 3 on the field).
  • If you hit a fair ball in the air past everyone and above The Blue Monster - you hit a homer!
  • For an extra fun rule twist, we recommend giving human players (whoever's pitching or on defense) the ability to catch a ball in mid-air. Catch the ball before it hits the ground or the basement wall and save a run!
  • Strikes, balls, foul balls, outs and hitting the Batter with a pitch all follow traditional baseball scoring rules.

 

  • 5 x 5 Feet Massive Tabletop Baseball Diamond.
  • Made of durable, high-quality Polyester Printed Fabric.

 

  • Pitch the ball up to 6 feet across the diamond.
  • 10 inches tall, 3 inches wide, 10 inches long, high quality realistic pitcher figure.
  • Made of very high-quality plastic material.
  • Features built-in, spring-loaded pitcher's arm and balanced baseplate.
  • Painted with non-toxic inks and substances.
  • Throw fast balls as well as breaking balls by maneuvering the Pitcher Dock at different angles.

 

  • 10 inches tall high quality realistic batter figure with human-powered shoulder, hips, and neck rotation.
  • Swing the bat and hit the ball out of mid-air in real-time.
  • Made of very high-quality plastic material.
  • Features built-in steel Hitter's Line with rubber-coated trigger grip.
  • Features built-in torso swivel that connects and locks into Home Plate.
  • Painted with non-toxic inks and substances.

Note: Miniature trash cans for sign stealing not included.

 

  • Contains holders for Batter and the strike zone stand.
  • 12 inch diameter realistic Home Plate.
  • Features Batter Lever that connects to Batter's built-in torso swivel for swinging through the ball.

  • Designed to withstand the heat from your best fastball!
  •  6 inches tall, 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, high-quality realistic catcher figure, and painted with non-toxic inks and substances. 

 

  • The fielders are trained to withstand the hardest hitting line drives!
  •  7 inches tall, 3 inches wide, 4 inches long, high-quality realistic figure, and painted with non-toxic inks and substances. 
  • Features balanced baseplate.

 

  • Try busting the seams on our signature StrikeZone Baseballs that are custom-made specifically for StrikeZone gameplay.
  • Since we don't want you to pickle The Beast, we've included 3 backup balls with every StrikeZone. You're welcome Smalls.
  • 40 MM in diameter.
  • Made of high-quality ABS material.

Take the game notch up a level with The Blue Monster wall to challenge the batter to hit towering home runs. 

 

Take your game to the next level by pitching a fast ball or change up ball making it hard for the batter to guess the speed and arc of the ball.

 

 

 

Are you ready to take your StrikeZone experience to the Big League? Then the Collector's Edition is for you. The Collector's Edition levels up your StrikeZone experience by providing:

  • The Blue Monster outfield wall
  • The Mound for full pitching control
  • Three additional mini Baseballs (4 total)
  • StrikeZone Catcher Net to stop the Ball when its a strike
  • All players are 3D figures (fielders, pitcher, batter, and catcher)
  • Convenient hard body (with soft-top) carrying case
  • All-Star Coin for tosses and challenges

The Collector's Edition is the most realistic StrikeZone experience that also includes a commemorative coin (for coin tosses + challenges).

Conveniently stowed in a portable protective case, StrikeZone Collector's Edition is the most realistic way to play baseball at home or on the road. We'll even throw in 3 extra StrikeZone Balls for when you knock one out of the park (or your backyard).

 

Please note, the Dec 2020 shipping date is an estimate that we will try our best to meet but cannot guarantee due to any unforeseen circumstances that might occur beyond our control.

 

 

Whether you make a pledge or not, you're invited to follow us on our social channels so you can not only keep up with the progress of our campaign and delivery, but you'll be the first to know about future sales, gameplay add-ons, StrikeZone events, and the newest tabletop game launches at KoolBots. You can find us below on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and YouTube. 

You can also reach us at https://www.koolbots.com  or email us at support@koolbots.com

 

Risks and challenges

Our prototype has already generated significant buzz, but we know that we have our work cut out for us as we proceed into mass production.

From molding and testing to production and fulfillment, there is a long road ahead, but we have already identified and agreed to terms with our end-to-end partners, subject to the final volume of pre-orders generated by this campaign.

They are all industry leaders in their particular areas of expertise and collectively will contribute to an epic tabletop experience for you, our backers.

As experienced engineers and programmers, we are fully confident in our ability to deliver StrikeZone to you and we are personally invested in its success with plans for future tabletop iterations. But, if the start to this year has taught us anything, it's that we can never be 100% sure of what logistical challenges will arise. We pledge to you that we will communicate frequently and consistently with detailed updates with a priority on maintaining transparency.

Once successfully funded, our only goal will be to deliver a StrikeZone experience that exceeds expectations and lays the foundation of our KoolBots dream.

story:
About

This is a super useful graphic designers reference sheet to get the creative juices flowing, it is a uniquely designed deck which functions both as a graphic tool as well as an aesthetic deck for cardistry!

Ever get stuck in a design rut and just not sure how to get past it? Our pocket-sized cheatsheets can help you out! This is a purposely designed deck of cards which has a fresh take on the integrating design tools into playing cards. 

It began as design challenge itself, thinking of ideas about how can we create a deck that solves a problem, rather than just being a pretty face. We needed inspiration, and how we usually go about it is to do some online research - this can quickly become distracting as one thing can lead to another and you're stuck back at stage one again.

We started by jotting down a bunch of words to get inspiration and wrote them down on some paper (one idea per paper). We thought it would be fun to combine what we came up with, mix it up in a hat and randomly pick a few then only focussed on those parameters to see what we could come up with. The moment we started to combine the pieces of paper together, it hit us. Can this actually be integrated into a deck of cards? The Graphic Cheatsheet was born, the activity of idea generation became the outcome itself. Have a look to see what we came up with! 

Features

  •  Brainstorm Cards | 12x custom court cards for idea generation. [J/Q/K]
  •  Dual Colored Cards | 36x CMYK & RGB coded cards for a colour generation and colour matching. [2-10]
  •  Assist Cards | 4x Aces with various comm graphic design guidelines. [Aces]
  •  Grid | 2x Rulers in Imperial & Metric for scaling [Wild Cards]
  •  Swatches | 2x Color swatches for colour selection [Extra Cards]
  •  Seamless Display | Pixelated gradient coloured tuck box which seamlessly joins when next to each other. 
  •  Custom Printed Seal | Each tuck box has a custom-designed seal.

Face Design

Front Edge Dual Color Bleed | This was an intentional approach so designers will be able to directly check colours against an existing surface and compare directly with other colours to see how they'd work, without a separating border.

Aside from making the face design vibrant and looking fresh, there are actually 4 super useful functions to them.

  •  Function 1 - Colored Cards (Number Cards: 2-10): 36 CMYK & RGB coded cards for a colour generation and colour matching. [2-10]
  •  Function 2 - Design Assistant Cards  (ACEs): 4x Aces with various common graphic design guidelines.
  •  Function 3 - Brainstorm Cards  (Court Card): Determine which of the"Brainstorm" cards (Court Cards) are relevant and discard the irrelevant ones.
  •  Function 4 - Measuring Cards  (Jokers): 2x Rulers in Imperial & Metric for scaling.

Function 1 - Colored Cards (Number Cards: 2-10) 

  •  36 CMYK & RGB coded cards for colour matching. 
  • Each colour is also identified with its very own name, helping you describe the colour to your client. Details matter!

Function 2 - Design Assistant Cards  (ACEs) 

4x Aces with various common graphic design guidelines.

  • Ace of Spades = Font Size
  • Ace of Hearts = Golden Ratio
  • Ace of Clubs = Typical Paper Sizes
  • Ace of Diamonds = Line Weights

Function 3 - Brainstorm Cards (Court Cards)

Brainstorm Cards | 12x custom court cards for idea generation.

Often you get stuck when coming up with design ideas. The Brainstorm cards (All the court cards) will help you generate random ideas on the fly, helping you get out of a brain freeze!

Function 4 - Measuring Cards (Jokers)

2x Rulers in Imperial & Metric for scaling.

Back Design 

Back Face Pixel-Gradient Bleed | This creates a continuous coloured fan which makes great for cardistry. To keep this consistent, we have also implemented this language to the face of the card.

Pips

Each of the pip is custom-designed.

Pixelated gradient | Is specifically implemented which creates a connection with the rest back design of the deck. This helps tie the coloured theme together to give this a consistent aesthetic appeal. 

Collect a set | As a bonus, if you purchase 2 or more decks you'll be able to create a continuous gradient flow effect which would like great on displays.

HOW WILL IT BE MADE? 

  • Production | Cartamundi (world-renowned experts in manufacturing playing cards). Printed on True Linen B9 Finish with SlimLine paper stock.
  • Fulfilment | Murphy's Magic (most reliable fulfilment centre to make sure you receive your order in time)

WHY BACK US?

  • Motivation | Helping us get this funded will provide us a stepping stone to explore more purposely design decks like this one for the community.
  • Expertise | We have the digital skill of fine tuning the design with an eye for detail to catch any errors and ensure the final deck is picture perfect.
  • Teamwork | We have a strong foundation having work together on projects in the past few years, putting our strengths to output a top quality product.
story_txt:
About
This is a super useful graphic designers reference sheet to get the creative juices flowing, it is a uniquely designed deck which functions both as a graphic tool as well as an aesthetic deck for cardistry!
Ever get stuck in a design rut and just not sure how to get past it? Our pocket-sized cheatsheets can help you out! This is a purposely designed deck of cards which has a fresh take on the integrating design tools into playing cards. 

It began as design challenge itself, thinking of ideas about how can we create a deck that solves a problem, rather than just being a pretty face. We needed inspiration, and how we usually go about it is to do some online research - this can quickly become distracting as one thing can lead to another and you're stuck back at stage one again.


We started by jotting down a bunch of words to get inspiration and wrote them down on some paper (one idea per paper). We thought it would be fun to combine what we came up with, mix it up in a hat and randomly pick a few then only focussed on those parameters to see what we could come up with. The moment we started to combine the pieces of paper together, it hit us. Can this actually be integrated into a deck of cards? The Graphic Cheatsheet was born, the activity of idea generation became the outcome itself. Have a look to see what we came up with! 



Features


 Brainstorm Cards | 12x custom court cards for idea generation. [J/Q/K]
 Dual Colored Cards | 36x CMYK & RGB coded cards for a colour generation and colour matching. [2-10]

 Assist Cards | 4x Aces with various comm graphic design guidelines. [Aces]
 Grid | 2x Rulers in Imperial & Metric for scaling [Wild Cards]
 Swatches | 2x Color swatches for colour selection [Extra Cards]

 Seamless Display | Pixelated gradient coloured tuck box which seamlessly joins when next to each other. 
 Custom Printed Seal | Each tuck box has a custom-designed seal.


Face Design
Front Edge Dual Color Bleed | This was an intentional approach so designers will be able to directly check colours against an existing surface and compare directly with other colours to see how they'd work, without a separating border.
Aside from making the face design vibrant and looking fresh, there are actually 4 super useful functions to them.

 Function 1 - Colored Cards (Number Cards: 2-10): 36 CMYK & RGB coded cards for a colour generation and colour matching. [2-10]

 Function 2 - Design Assistant Cards  (ACEs): 4x Aces with various common graphic design guidelines.

 Function 3 - Brainstorm Cards  (Court Card): Determine which of the"Brainstorm" cards (Court Cards) are relevant and discard the irrelevant ones.
 Function 4 - Measuring Cards  (Jokers): 2x Rulers in Imperial & Metric for scaling.

 36 CMYK & RGB coded cards for colour matching. 
Each colour is also identified with its very own name, helping you describe the colour to your client. Details matter!





Function 2 - Design Assistant Cards  (ACEs) 
4x Aces with various common graphic design guidelines.

Ace of Spades = Font Size
Ace of Hearts = Golden Ratio
Ace of Clubs = Typical Paper Sizes
Ace of Diamonds = Line Weights







Function 3 - Brainstorm Cards (Court Cards)
Brainstorm Cards | 12x custom court cards for idea generation.
Often you get stuck when coming up with design ideas. The Brainstorm cards (All the court cards) will help you generate random ideas on the fly, helping you get out of a brain freeze!



Function 4 - Measuring Cards (Jokers)
2x Rulers in Imperial & Metric for scaling.


Back Design 
Back Face Pixel-Gradient Bleed | This creates a continuous coloured fan which makes great for cardistry. To keep this consistent, we have also implemented this language to the face of the card.


Pips
Each of the pip is custom-designed.



Pixelated gradient | Is specifically implemented which creates a connection with the rest back design of the deck. This helps tie the coloured theme together to give this a consistent aesthetic appeal. 
Collect a set | As a bonus, if you purchase 2 or more decks you'll be able to create a continuous gradient flow effect which would like great on displays.




HOW WILL IT BE MADE? 


Production | Cartamundi (world-renowned experts in manufacturing playing cards). Printed on True Linen B9 Finish with SlimLine paper stock.

Fulfilment | Murphy's Magic (most reliable fulfilment centre to make sure you receive your order in time)

WHY BACK US?


Motivation | Helping us get this funded will provide us a stepping stone to explore more purposely design decks like this one for the community.

Expertise | We have the digital skill of fine tuning the design with an eye for detail to catch any errors and ensure the final deck is picture perfect.

Teamwork | We have a strong foundation having work together on projects in the past few years, putting our strengths to output a top quality product.

story:
Key Enigma is an escape box that mixes puzzles, narrative, and technology to immerse you in a challenging experience so carefully designed that it may be impossible for you to distinguish reality from fiction.

A box full of mysteries and enigmas will reach your hands. With the materials, codes, and clues hidden inside, you must use your ingenuity and match the objects to solve the case.

With this model, we want to expand the possibilities of traditional Escape Rooms. By not being dependent on a physical space we have greater freedom to: create complex, different and surprising puzzles, a more sophisticated story and we can make the game reach all over the world.

Key Enigma: Hack Forward is an experience as much as a game. Face the challenge by yourself or with a trustworthy group.

The box is the heart of the project where you will find the material that serves as a bridge to connect the physical and digital world to live an immersive experience.

Here you’ll find some examples of the puzzles and materials you will find in the box to solve the challenges that the adventure requires:

Traditional puzzles

Similar to those found in the traditional Escape Rooms: Logic puzzles, reveal messages, interact with objects, use pencil and paper… 

Immersive / Digital puzzles 

Puzzles that will make you doubt the limits between reality and fiction; exploring websites, news, videos or spying on security cameras. Even in some cases, you will have to use everyday tools such as your email, social networks, chats or mobile phone… 

Codes 

Find keys to decrypt secret ciphers, Morse codes, strange runes, braille, binary code or use the everyday objects like the periodic table or a chessboard to unravel a secret message.

 

Advanced Puzzles

If we manage to reach certain objectives we can add more complex puzzles which could include magnets, embarking on missions in the real world, receiving phone calls, among other amazing surprises. 

Some of the puzzles shown above are examples. We don't want to show you the final puzzles of Hack Forward to not spoil your experience. 

To make progress on the story, you must investigate and solve a series of puzzles. The enigmatic objects in the box will help you solve the mysteries online and vice versa. Therefore it will be necessary to have a device with a good internet connection and the box.

The game can be played solo or with a group of friends, is recommended for people over 14 years old and is available in English, Spanish, German, French, and Portuguese. 

It is not necessary to be an expert at any particular subject, you just need to accept the challenge and get involved and understand that your decisions can alter the course of the story.

The game is primarily a one-time use game like the real Escape Rooms but it can be resettable, to add replay-ability, so you can see the different ramifications of the story or just lend it to someone else to experience.

The digital puzzles can be reset with a button on our website. The physical objects in the box won’t suffer damage playing, but some papers will suffer damage, so at the end of each chapter, you will find the PDF files so you can print them again at home.

More than 8 hours of investigation and fun, divided into 8 chapters. Like traditional Escape Rooms, the clock is ticking and your time will be registered at the end of each chapter, although this is optional. For those up to the competition, this is the ultimate ranking. Time will not run between chapters, so you can take a break and continue later. 

If you get stuck, do not worry, you can interact with the characters in the story and ask for advice. They will give you clues and hints to help you move forward.

If you want to get a taste of the immersion of the game here you have the chance for free. The DEMO can be completed totally online without the box but it’s nothing compared to the whole experience with the box. 

https://keyenigma.com/hackforward/chapterone

More than 5000 people have already played the first chapter and only 30% of participants have successfully completed it on time. The average time is 1 hour. Can you beat that record? 

 

In our first adventure, titled Hack Forward, there has been a worldwide cyberattack. Massive data filtration has affected from Nuclear power plants to ordinary citizens. Anyone with a smart device can be a target.

You will put yourself in the shoes of an investigator whose predecessor has disappeared under strange circumstances. You must continue with the investigation and find those responsible for the massive leaks that threaten the security of the world. 

But soon you’ll discover that those leaks are a smokescreen for something much more dangerous. Who is behind all this? What could be so important? We can’t tell you any more without spoilers, but if you like conspiracy theories, science fiction and plot twists you will love this one.

Dive into this immersive experience that will make you question a real problem. Our personal data is on the Internet and any camera device may be recording you at this time. The idea of ​​this story is based on how vulnerable we are to it. Is technology getting too powerful that it will overrule us?

The story will be divided into 8 chapters. Each one has its own objective and different challenges that can be completed in 1 hour, like a traditional Escape Room. You can play them all in a row or you can take a break and play another day. 

Chapters

  1. The Job
  2. Meet your team
  3. Finding leaks
  4. The Key
  5. Expose the enemy
  6. Hacking Battle
  7. Double agent
  8. The Final plan

 

By not depending on spatial and temporal limitations like other Escape Rooms, we are able to have greater freedom to improve.  

 

 

 

 

Shipping is charged as part of this Indiegogo campaign. You just have to select your shipping address and the shipping price is automatically added to the pledge.

When we are close to the delivery date we will send a confirmation of the shipping address.

The European Union, USA and Canada will be “Shipping Friendly”. Backers from these countries will not pay import taxes. We will be using fulfillment center partners to ship locally for each country.

Outside of the EU, USA and Canada we cannot guarantee customs friendly shipping in these areas. There may be additional duties and/or fees charged by your country's governmental agencies and/or shipping partners that will be your responsibility.

 For Retail shops buying packs of 6 or more boxes send us an email at contact@keyenigma.com

 

We are a startup that aims to launch different Escape Games themes (Terror, Adventure, Detective,...) that resemble the Escape Room experience but right in your home.

Or even explore the possibilities of launching a subscription box with bi-monthly shippings.

Why do we do it? 

As big fans of Escape Rooms and Escape Games sometimes we encountered limitations for playing as often as we wished. Such restrictions encouraged us to embark on this project:

  • Location: Most of the time we are limited to playing in our city or surroundings, and assembling a group of friends to go to a faraway Escape Room seems impossible.  Key Enigma box is at the best location: your home.
  •  Variety & Innovation: Once you have played many traditional Escape Rooms they all start feeling the same. Our game is a breath of fresh air that will surprise you.
  •  Cost: Escape Rooms are expensive! Our game is a fraction of the price.

 Main Inspirations

The night of October 30th, 1938 gave us the most famous radio broadcast in history: "War of the Worlds" by Orson Welles.

Orson Welles certainly understood all the possibilities radio could offer and knew how to use it to carry out a very different entertainment experience from what people were used to. What we want to do now is to present a similar experience using the multiple communication options we have available nowadays.

story:
Follow Us: Facebook  Instagram  Twitter  Boardgamegeek

We are using fulfillment companies around the world to deliver the most efficient shipping experience possible.  Additionally, we are subsidizing a portion of the shipping costs to be at a decent price for each backer.

  • All backers get the best product we can offer. After making a game, we learned keeping things simple is ideal. That is why we are not offering add-ons or complex pledge levels.  Instead, we've gone the extra mile on enhancing the quality of the components of Hermetica (rubber playmat, magnetic hinge box, custom resin/metal units, quick reference cards, etc.), while keeping the overall cost low.
  • You will be heard. We read every comment and message sent to us. All input is valuable to us, as we are always looking to improve the experience Hermetica provides. We will always be honest and transparent with you.
  • Be apart of the community. The more players, the more opportunities for someone to find a game online or at a FLGS to challenge! 
  • We need you. Without your help, we won't be able to print this game and share it with the world. The game is completed and ready to go, but in order to make it at such high quality, mass production is required.
  • Limited Availability. It may not be in your local store and if there are any future printings, they may not contain all of the stretch goal components.

We love FLGS. If you are a retailer and would like to pledge at distributor pricing, please contact Chris at chris.modica@iffstudios.com

Hermetica started when Chris proposed to make a simple yet complex game to Charlie and Lucas back in 2015. After failing to enjoy a tabletop game Charlie attempted to share, Chris decided to design a board game that actually utilizes mechanics centered around spatial awareness, tactical movement and replayablity. 

Things were going well after some initial play-testing but it was by no means balanced. The three of them agreed to create a "perfect information game" where there would be no luck (dice) or hidden information (cards). As a result, the biggest challenge would be making Hermetica well rounded and not imbalanced. 

So, there were a handful of failed attempts that went too far and became overly complicated, including one iteration where there was a "rock paper scissors" mechanic when a player moved a game piece differently based on what color the unit was and what color it was standing on.

After many months of refining, fixing, balancing and adhering to the K.I.S.S. principle - the game transformed into a state that looks familiar to what it is today - with a focused on the game pieces archetypes and a touch of "rock paper scissors" paradigm.

Then after a year of countless play-testing of the latest iteration, Chris, Charlie and Lucas couldn't find any loopholes or imbalances to the game. In fact, all three of them rarely felt like losing a game was "cheap" and no one could find a particular playing style that had a overall higher win rate. That was the sign to take Hermetica to the next stage of its life.

Once the mechanics, rules and terminology were solidified the three creators had to take off their game designer hats and put on the countless other hats to start a business. 

For information about the creators and why they called it Hermetica, feel free to visit Hermetica's About page

story:
About the Game:

Finally, the board game we all have been waiting for is here!

Business Mania is a highly strategic and fun board game where everyone can experience opening their businesses, crushing the competition, stealing businesses, getting bankrupt, getting fined and taking your competitors down in many different ways. The goal of the game is to open profitable businesses and make more money than your competition. The game is fun not only for adults but also for kids. Kids learn to think like business owners. The game can inspire you to open your own business.

There are 72 cards in the box. The game is for 2-8 players. 

The box includes:

72 cards (8 role cards and 64 playing cards)

70 playing coins

The Rules sheet 

Here is how the game works:

You put the cards on the table and create the Mania Bank pile with coins. There are 8 characters in the game. Each character has a special ability:     

Stock Broker, for example, can steal 1 coin from any player he chooses.  Players can exercise their special ability only once during their turn.

 

After using your special ability, take 2 cards from the deck and 1 coin from the Mania Bank. Each player can open 1 business during their turn. Some businesses cost a few coins:

and other businesses are free to open.

  Once you paid for a business, you own it. If the business is free, just put it on the table face up. Now, you can sell it or keep it. If you choose to keep the business, keep the card on the table face up in front of you. If you sell the business, take the number of coins indicated on the card under “sells for” from the Mania Bank and discard the card.

There are other events that might happen. You might become bankrupt, lose money, lose your business, steal your opponent’s business or fine other players and get coins.

     The game goes on until all the cards have been drawn from the deck. After you need to calculate the score and see who won.

We can’t build this without you. If you’re into fun card games or business or growth through games, please help us make this game a reality.  

We are going to bring laughter, fun and an unforgettable time to every get together and family party and I invite you to be a part of it.

 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

We want to make sure that you get your perks as soon as humanly possible. Our team has very high integrity and we are here to serve our backers and we will make sure that you get your product with the light speed.

This is why we're not offering complicated reward tiers that would make the distribution process take a lot longer. We're keeping it as simple as possible: support our project and in return we'll send you the playable game.

The Rules sheet 
Here is how the game works:
You put the cards on the table and create the Mania Bank pile with coins. There are 8 characters in the game. Each character has a special ability:     

Stock Broker, for example, can steal 1 coin from any player he chooses.  Players can exercise their special ability only once during their turn.

 
After using your special ability, take 2 cards from the deck and 1 coin from the Mania Bank. Each player can open 1 business during their turn. Some businesses cost a few coins:
and other businesses are free to open.
  Once you paid for a business, you own it. If the business is free, just put it on the table face up. Now, you can sell it or keep it. If you choose to keep the business, keep the card on the table face up in front of you. If you sell the business, take the number of coins indicated on the card under “sells for” from the Mania Bank and discard the card.
There are other events that might happen. You might become bankrupt, lose money, lose your business, steal your opponent’s business or fine other players and get coins.
     The game goes on until all the cards have been drawn from the deck. After you need to calculate the score and see who won.
We can’t build this without you. If you’re into fun card games or business or growth through games, please help us make this game a reality.  
We are going to bring laughter, fun and an unforgettable time to every get together and family party and I invite you to be a part of it.

 

 
 

Risks & Challenges
We want to make sure that you get your perks as soon as humanly possible. Our team has very high integrity and we are here to serve our backers and we will make sure that you get your product with the light speed.
This is why we're not offering complicated reward tiers that would make the distribution process take a lot longer. We're keeping it as simple as possible: support our project and in return we'll send you the playable game.

story:
Horror Out of Hagsjaw

Hearkening back to the original days of Necromancer Games™ with adventures like What Evil Lurks, and Aberrations, comes a brand new fantasy-horror adventure by acclaimed RPG designer Levi Combs. Exclusively available in print for a short time in Swords & Wizardry, Classic Pathfinder and 5th edition, this adventure is a must have for fans of Mythos and the sort of First Edition Feel adventures that put Necromancer Games™ on the map!


Travelers have long considered Hagsjaw a place best avoided, haunted by whispered tales of witches and strange doings in the old days. Once terrorized by a wretched coven of witches known as the Karnley Hags, the town was held in a grip of fear that saw its citizens oppressed, its children stolen and anyone who dared oppose them viscously murdered. Though the witches were eventually overthrown and hung in the town square, they muttered a unified curse with their last breaths, promising nothing less than misery and doom for all who remained.

That was a century ago, and now Hagsjaw is little more than a forgotten watering hole on the way to bigger and better places. Time has not treated the decaying town or it’s folk kindly, as it seems to die out more and more as each generation passes. The farms at the edge of town are empty of cattle and crop, the town’s buildings are crumbling and even the sagging roofs of the abandoned, twin steeple church don’t look like they’ll hold up much longer. There’s little left to suggest that the town hadn’t withered away completely… until recently.

To everyone’s surprise, Hagsjaw seems to be awakening from its century-long slumber. The old sawmill has fired back up again and the townsfolk have inexplicably started to go back out into the forests to log, hunt and trap. Talk of renewed industry is circulating and some say that the town’s cursed days might finally be over.

For all this talk of prosperity, a sinister undertone ripples throughout the town. The locals remain more suspicious than ever and many whisper that the Karnley Hags have returned to make good on their promise to bring their ageless curse of doom full circle. Folk have begun to act strangely. Some have even turned on each other. Paranoia and mistrust run rampant. Has witchery and the depraved worship of strange old gods returned to the land? Do the whispers of ancient curses ring true? What nameless dread has spread its wings over the terrified folk of Hagsjaw? 

Can the characters uncover what lies beneath the surface and, if so, will they survive it?

Horror out of Hagsjaw is an exciting Necromancer Games™ Adventure featuring the following perks:

  • For characters of 5th-10th level
  • Written by Levi Combs, Author of An Occurrence at Howling Crater, and Jungle Tomb of the Mummy Bride
  • Cover and interior Art by Quentin Soubrouillard and Casey W. Christofferson
  • Maps by Robert Altbaur

 

 

The Tiny Print Run

Why Indiegogo?

Necromancer Games™ is continuing the use of this Indiegogo crowdfunding method for The Horror Out of Hagsjaw. This method is almost the inverse of how we design our crowdfunding projects on Kickstarter. We call it the 'Tiny Print Run'.

Thus, Indiegogo projects by Necromancer Games™ will-

  • Be short in duration
  • Be limited to a single title
  • Have options priced between $5-$30
  • Design all stretch goals and project bonus' affect the principle reward only (usually both the PDF and the softcover).
  • Be the only guaranteed method to get the premium* print copy 
  • Have simple fulfillment process that does not use Backerkit

*Premium means 100 pound glossy interior pages with a thick, glossy cardstock cover. These are the nicest softcover books we have ever sold.

 

Why the Tiny Print Run?

Since 2012 our crowdfunding approach has been extravagant in every way. Ambitious with massive page counts, plus numerous add-on options and stretch goals. All supporting a primary title itself as many as 990 pages.

This has resulted in Kickstarter's with memorable pledge rewards that include top-quality hardcover books with sometimes dozens of stretch goal bonuses and add-on extras. These are awesome AND they are expensive to buy for customers like you because they are very expensive to make for publishers like us.

Why not use Kickstarter?

We will still be using Kickstarter, frequently, for our large-scale projects. These smaller projects are happening in response to the feedback we have heard from both fans and 'almost' fans alike. We hear the request for less expensive options for our projects and products all the time. A second frequent desire expressed to us, whether at conventions, on social media or in email, is for a larger selection of smaller, faster-paced adventures that can be completed in 2-3 sessions and not necessitate a full two year campaign.

Additionally, Necromancer Games™ is growing in both sales and brand awareness.  This opportunity will give us the additional resources to invest in the very best books in all of our formats. 

 

Project Reward

With the wishes of the fans in mind, this and future Indiegogo projects will fund standalone projects that are both affordable and fun. This project, as well future Tiny Print Run projects, is narrowly focused with all stretch goals adding resources to the principle reward which traditionally would not be feasible for a publisher our size. 

Examples of Enhancements from Higher Funding

During the 14 day primary project period for The Horror Out of Hagsjaw and after the $1000 goal is met the focus will be to improve the delivered product. There are no special tiered collectors editions or add-on purchase extras. Thus, as total project funding increases the better the final product will be for everybody.

Examples of the planned extras that increased funding would bring to The Horror Out of Hagsjaw -

Additional commissions for interior color art specific to the adventure. 

  • The previous Indiegogo project, Mystery at Ravenrock, added 2 interior art pieces and 3 extra creature illustrations for its appendix.
  • Printed Player map(s)/Insert. This is one we would love to do but it would require a substantial increase in overall project funding.
  • Downloadable Options designed for popular virtual table-top software (The rewards for both How Orcus Stole Christmas! and In Vino Gigantus included the new creature/NPC tokens and player maps). 
  • High-resolution files of illustrations to share with players at the table.

 

Project Delivery

PDF Perks

We will email the instructions to all eligible supporters with instructions on accessing PDF items. The PDF files are distributed using Constant Contact service and our web store. You will need to have a customer account on the Frog God Games website to get your PDF; it's how we keep track of everything and grants unlimited access by you to your reward.

The Indiegogo perk PDF files are 'purchased' at zero cost by supporters (as they are paid for during the Indiegogo promotion) at the Frog God Games web store using a coupon code. That code we will be sent via Constant Contact to the address provided by Indiegogo. Please contact us with any questions/requests about this.

Softcover Perks

Softcover perks will be mailed to the address provided by us via Indiegogo. 

 

Overseas Shipping

NOTE TO INTERNATIONAL BACKERS: Shipping international has become very expensive. We understand this. Likewise, some countries charge VAT tax or other fees to our customers on receipt. We cannot fraudulently lie about the value of materials we mail out. We are happy to ship you anything regardless of where you live, but we have to stay in business at the same time thus even our lightest books are affected. In the near future we expect to have a print on demand system in place for everyone overseas, It is not ideal, as the final book is not printed at the highest-quality when compared to the ones we fulfill in Indiegogo.

To explain what we mean, please see the shipping calculator for UPS

story:
You might see your mom become a “Highly Successful Pimp” and answer “What's your New Year's resolution?” Or you could see your best friend channel their “Reddest Neck Trailer Trash” and answer “If you had one wish, what would it be?”

Sing, dance, lunge, scream, or spank your way to the highest score. Not happy with your ratings? Make your case with the judges for why you deserve a better score.

We’ve had a blast with the game and believe you will, too. Now we’re asking you to make Bad Actors a reality.

ALTERNATE GAMEPLAY STYLES  

The mechanics of Bad Actors allows for many different styles of game play. You and your friends will undoubtedly come up with your own. The crowd favorites are:

  • Voteless: Vote and don't keep track. Or don't vote. Just laugh at how funny and witty your friends are.
  • Team Play: Partner up for team play and draw a character. 
  • Same Character Different Question: Everyone plays the same character and the Director draws a different question for each player. 
  • Pick Your Own Question: Pick your own question from the three that you draw. 
  • Guessing Game: Don’t disclose the character. You get a question and the other players guess your character.
  • Secrets!: Make the voting secret by doing an anonymous ballot. Use the voting cards to make your vote anonymous.

 

 

 

SHIPPING 

We are happy to ship worldwide through our global shipping partners on each continent. We've subsidized a portion of the shipping/taxes in many cases. Our US backers will pay $5 flat shipping and receive free shipping $99 and up. 

International backers in the Canada, Australia and New Zealand pay $15 shipping for one game and $20 shipping for two. International backers in the UK will pay $14 flat shipping for one or two games. Specific shipping charges for the rest of the EU have been calculated. The rest of the world pays $25 shipping.

REVIEWS

Note: Bad Actors is now in a larger box to accommodate the additional game contents versus the prototype these fine folks played with.

"There's quite a bit of replayability. You have the ability to be as perverse or as friendly and funny in nature - you have that whole spectrum. Personally, I really enjoyed playing this game. It was a lot of fun, we got a whole bunch of different combinations. There is a lot of thought put into this game...for me this is a big get." - Michael, Unfiltered Gamer

Beer & Board Games played with famous Youtubers John Green, Hank Green, Wheezy Waiter, Greg Benson, Kevin Lieber from Vsauce, and Vidcon director Colin Hickey. They said "it's a party game that was comedy fun with funny friends and good times at Vidcon 2017."  - Beer & Board Games

"This game is not appropriate for your little brother." -Your Mom

ORIGIN STORY

We are two energetic gamers who love to talk to strangers, hurdle past limitations, and laugh until we cry. Larry has the creative mind that constantly sparks ideas. On any given day you can find him nursing a pint of Pinkberry Frozen Yogurt. Evan is the make shit happen guy who could steamroll any project in front of him. And when the rhythm jives just right, he'll bust out in a freestyle rap. We are both successful in business and have decades of business experience between us that ensures we'll get this project right. 

“Bad Actors” started as a game called “Crowned.” Players pretended to be in a variety of weird pageants, answered questions, and were rated on their performance. Because pageants are typically associated with over-enthusiastic mothers and glitter-coated daughters, we dropped the Pageant and the voting paddles. We decided on the name “Bad Actors” and got the game down to the base mechanics - character, question, and rating. We knew there was serious potential when we saw our friend Gary hump a banister.

We’ve played the game with more than 100 people and created more than a dozen versions.  

The more we've played, the more we heard “this is unbelievably fun!” We’ve spent weekend after weekend playing the game. We’ve had a riot playing (even though we almost always get beat at our own game) and want you to get in on the action, too.

We think Indiegogo is the best way to get the game to the masses as quickly as possible. There’s no time to waste when we’re in the business of liberating inhibitions.

 Special thanks first and foremost to the amazing women in our lives, Lori and Paula, whose constant support has helped make this possible. Many thanks to the dozens of play testers and guinea pigs who enthusiastically let us perfect the game with their time, and whose honest feedback shaped the game.         

        

Credits

Video by Thought Culture Productions

Graphic design by E. Stark

Once you successfully fund our campaign, the money will go directly to manufacturing and fulfillment. Back this project and let's get this party started!
