story:
The Tarot

The Tarot surfaced, apparently out of the blue, at the mid-15th century in Northern Italy. The first documented Tarot decks were recorded between 1440 and 1450. It is still disputed between scholars if the Tarot was a local invention, respectively a further development of the ordinary deck of playing cards or if it has an unknown, yet to be revealed origin.

Tarot is a trick-taking game, commonly played by four players. However, it is also possible for two, three, five or six to play.

The earliest evidence of the Tarot deck used for cartomancy comes from an anonymous manuscript from around 1750. We owe the popularisation of the use of the Tarot deck for divination and fortune-telling to the French occultist and cartomancer Jean-Baptiste Alliette, better known as Etteilla.

The Golden Hermetic and Fortune Telling Tarot deck can be used both for playing the game or esoteric purpose. However, I would recommend keeping a separate deck for divination and fortune-telling.

The so-called Papus deck

Papus was the pseudonym used by Gerard Encausse, a Spanish born French occultist.

Papus was born on July 13, 1865, in Spain and moved with his family to Paris when he was four years old.

As a young man, Papus spent a great deal of time at the Bibliothèque Nationale in Paris studying the Kabbalah, Alchemy and Natural Magic. He was especially influenced by the writings of Éliphas Lévi.

Papus was a member of many esoteric organisations including the Hermetic Brotherhood of Light, the Hermetic Order of the Golden Dawn, the Rosicrucian Kabbalistic Order of the Rose-Croix and founded the modern Martinist Order. He also joined the French Theosophical Society shortly after it was founded by Madame Blavatsky.

The written works of Papus include “L’Occultisme Contemporain” (1887), “Le Tarot Des Bohemiens” (1889), “Traité méthodique de Science Occulte” (1891), “Anarchie, Indolence et Synarchie” (1894), “La Kabbale” (1903) and “Le Tarot Divinataire” (1909).

“Le Tarot Divinatoire: Clef du tirage des Caries et des sorts” was Papus last major work. The book has received scant attention in the English speaking world. However, A.E. Waite lists it in the bibliography of his “Pictorial Key to the Tarot.”

Not much is know about the artist, Gabriel Goulinat, whom Papus commissioned to create the twenty-two cards of the Major Arcana that illustrate the book. For illustrating the Minor Arcana in the book, they used the cards of the Etteilla Tarot deck.

Why this Tarot deck?

- This is the perfect holidays' gift for the Tarot enthusiast loved ones! A classic Tarot deck in a cute, shiny tin box!

- You can have the deck at a nice price with a 10% discount on both the regular and the embossed edition. Both are limited editions. The regular will be printed in only 780 copies, while the special, embossed, raised high gloss edition in only 78 copies. 

After the end of the current campaign, the full price of the regular deck will be about 74 USD (including tin box, printed mini-booklet and shipping), and the full price of the embossed edition will be about 154 USD (including tin box, printed mini-booklet and shipping).

- Black and Gold, elegant design. The easily distinguishable design and artwork facilitate identifying the cards at first glance. Black is the colour of darkness, it represents our fears and the unknown. Gold represents the Sun, the source of light and the strength originated from knowledge. Can't cast a shadow without a light.

- The regular and raised high gloss cards look absolutely identical and both versions are varnished and basically matte. Only turning the raised high gloss cards in the light the raised high gloss elements are standing out shinning. The real difference is in the touch feel.

- Has high-quality cardstock and special varnish for endurance, easy shuffling and handling. The cards are flexible and resistant.

- Handy and classy size 2.75” x 4.75” (70mm x 121mm ).

- It is an excellent learning and study Tarot deck. Everything someone wants to know, including upright and reversed interpretation, timing details, astrological, cabalistic and numerological attributions, is all featured directly on each card!

- It is a traditional Tarot deck based on the teachings of Éliphas Lévi, S. L. MacGregor Mathers founder and head of the Hermetic Order of Golden Dawn (and mentor of Aleister Crowley), Arthur Edward Waite, Oswald Wirth, Etteilla and Papus.

- The Tarot is also a highly entertaining social game. The Tarot game is known as Le Tarot, Jeux de Tarot, Tarocchi, Trumps, Tarock, etc. and it is popular in continental Europe, especially in Italy, Austria and France. It is a trick-taking game that can be played with two to six players. Hands move quickly, it is easy and a lot of fun.

- However, the Tarot is not only a fun game to play but an excellent opportunity to get off from your electronic devices and reconnect with the real world, your loved ones, family, children and friends. The GHaFT Tarot deck was designed both for entertainment and divination and fortune-telling.

- The printed mini- booklet includes both esoteric and game playing instructions. Parental guidance is advised.

- The cards will be printed and delivered directly by a world famous, experienced American manufacturer company.

- Not at least, it is an exclusive collector's item. A modern and exclusive version of a historical deck.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Reading with the Golden Hermetic and Fortune Telling Tarot

Reading the Tarot cards never been easier. On the one hand, all the information someone needs to interpret the cards are available directly on the cards. On the other hand, the design of the cards and the recognisable patterns facilitate the reading.

Let’s take an example with eight random cards.

To begin with, someone can notice that there are three cards of Three; the Three of Wands, the Three of Swords, and the Three of Disks.

There are also three Cups cards plus another watery card, The Temperance, representing the Zodiac sign Scorpio. It means, there are some highly emotional issues at stake.

Another significant clue is that three of these cards are in Scorpio, respectively the Eight House, the House of Transformation. Changes at the emotional level are expected.

Mercury may also play an important role here while three of the cards represent Mercury in three different signs: Taurus, Cancer and Sagittarius. Mercury is the planet of communication but also of decisions and self-awareness.

From the numerological perspective, Mercury represents number five. Traditionally, five is a number associated with the Man. There are five senses in man: sight, hearing, smelling, tasting, and feeling; five fingers on each hand; and five powers in the soul.

And all these information pop-ups just at first glance. At a closer look, a lot more useful information will be revealed.

On the one hand, all the information someone needs to interpret the cards are available directly on the cards. On the other hand, the design of the cards and the recognisable patterns facilitate the reading.Let’s take an example with eight random cards.To begin with, someone can notice that there are three cards of Three; the Three of Wands, the Three of Swords, and the Three of Disks.There are also three Cups cards plus another watery card, The Temperance, representing the Zodiac sign Scorpio. It means, there are some highly emotional issues at stake.Another significant clue is that three of these cards are in Scorpio, respectively the Eight House, the House of Transformation. Changes at the emotional level are expected.Mercury may also play an important role here while three of the cards represent Mercury in three different signs: Taurus, Cancer and Sagittarius. Mercury is the planet of communication but also of decisions and self-awareness.From the numerological perspective, Mercury represents number five. Traditionally, five is a number associated with the Man. There are five senses in man: sight, hearing, smelling, tasting, and feeling; five fingers on each hand; and five powers in the soul.And all these information pop-ups just at first glance. At a closer look, a lot more useful information will be revealed.

story:
Short Summary

  • Hello!  We're Rockabilly Soaps, a family-owned and operated soap company located on Route 66.  We have been making cold-processed soaps by hand for the last 12 years, and we'd like to join our two of our loves: gaming and hot baths together for the tabletop RPG community.
  • We wish to provide a unique product to our friends in the tabletop RPG community, and we plan on doing this by offering a bar of soap that has dice inside of it, while at the same time reducing the waste on the world by providing this product wrapped up in bio-degradable plastics to help the environment out. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • In order to produce this line of soap and make it available on our website year-round, we need about $500 in supplies. Then we can make these soaps in batches of dozens not in sets of 3-5 bars at a time.  Since each bar is made by hand multiple molds increase efficiency making it sustainable to offer these designs and expand the line in the future.
  • We are the only company that offers a dice soap using traditional cold-processed methods, which results in a smoother soap experience.
  • We are able to fulfill all the orders received within the campaign length, but we're unsure if we'll be able to offer this year-round if we do not reach the goal.
  • We are able to offer handmade dice in your order.  These are not 100% perfect, but they roll fairly and have a wider variety of finishes and colors.  If you would perfer factory made dice, please note in the order form.

Stretch Goals

  • Life Begins - 1K stretch goal - Our creepy fey baby in a blossom soap -Scent green apple peels
  • Death Ends? - 5K stretch goal - a clear skull with a dice "brain" atop a ruffled deep purple and black leaves bar - Scent cemetery bouquet
  • Secret Design - 10K Want to see what other demented things I can make into soap? Good.

 

The Impact

  • When we make our soups we use only sustainably-sourced oils including RSPO certified palm oils, in our soaps.  
  • The average person uses 6 bottles of body wash per year, which can easily be replaced with 6 bars of soap.

Risks & Challenges

  • If we reach partial funding, we will still be able to fulfill orders on time, but unable to do more than a handful of bars a month in these designs.  These bars are time intensive and having multiple sets of molds leads to an increased availability of orders after the campaign.

story:
Short Summary

Over the past several months, the Eidolon Council has been looking at the next custom item to introduce as a group buy and outfit fundraiser. In the past, we've done t-shirts, sweatshirts, and dog tags. As Ghosts of the Revolution has grown beyond just PlanetSide to become a multi-gaming community, we wanted to produce something that would appeal to everyone: FPS gamers, RPG gamers, table-top, and even families. And we wanted it to be something useful, rather than ornamental like the dog tags.

Thus, GOTR Dice were born. Working with dice elves and crafting professionals at customdice.com, we've settled on these beautiful 19mm casino-quality precision dice, engraved with the GOTR logo on the 1 side and the GOTR initials on the 6 side.

What We Need & What You Get

For the prices listed on the right hand side:

  • You receive 1 or more gorgeous GOTR dice
  • GOTR receives $1 or more in donations that go to fund our website, software, and our TeamSpeak and gaming servers.
  • If we do not hit the preorder limit, your money will be refunded. This project will not happen without the Ghosts' support!

Caveats, Risks & Challenges

  1. Note: The main photo has been colour corrected from the red blank that was used for the prototype die. The final die will be properly casino finished, with white (not silver) paint, looking more like the image below. The factory may be able to tint the dice more purple, for a real "Auraxium Crystal" look.


  2. GOTR is not a for-profit organization. Every single dollar goes back into running our community. As a result, if we do not receive the full amount of funding, we won't be able to place the order for the dice and the project will fail. We simply don't have the cash reserves to place the die order "on spec" and wait for orders to roll in. Obviously no one wants to see this happen.

  3. Because the pre-cut blanks must be custom made at the casino die factory, lead time on the die delivery is 3-4 months. Assuming we are funded on June 1st, we expect to place the order right away. Dice will arrive at robocpf1's for approximately the end of summer, and will be shipped out to everyone as school starts back up again.

FAQ

Why 19mm precision casino dice?

The Eidolon Council, in cooperation with leaders in PS2 and Tera, reviewed a number of dice options from customization houses, including 16mm and 19mm black dice, as well as 16mm and 19mm casino dice. We also looked at regular "crystal" dice from other manufacturers that can be customized.

After many months of back and forth, and finally after receiving prototype dice (for which we paid), we settled on two designs: the 19mm casino dice, and 19mm black dice painted in a 2-colour purple-and-grey pattern.

We shared these designs in the April 30th Ghost Generals meeting, at which 15 people were in attendance. 75% of those polled said they would buy dice, and of those, there was universal acclaim for the translucent purple casino die. We also ran an open poll on the gotr.us forum the week of May 1, and the results were about the same: 75% in favour of the purple casino dice. The message is clear!

You can see pictures of our 16mm and 19mm prototypes (the 19mm are in white, no black dice were available at the time of prototyping) in this gallery, gotr.us login required: Album: GOTR Dice

Why not also another die type or size?

GOTR must up-front purchase at least 200 of these one-of-a-kind custom dice, costing about $1200. We have to start somewhere. If these sell well - and we think they will - there is absolutely nothing stopping us from placing another order in the future for the other die design(s).

How is the project being funded?

By you, our members! GOTR will be covering a small quantity of the dice to keep in reserve for our web store, to be launched later in 2015. This way, even new members can self-serve buy dice in the future and have them delivered any time of year, not just during our outfit fundraiser.

What am I getting for my money?

Each die costs GOTR $6. You're in addition paying $1 for shipping, and making a mandatory $1 donation to GOTR to cover the costs associated with running our website, the commercial software we use to do so, and the TeamSpeak and game servers. Some of the higher tiers have a reduced donation to GOTR. Remember, not one penny goes into any individual's pocket at the end of the day - everything goes back into operating everything that keeps GOTR what it is today. GOTR is not a money-making business for anyone in the outfit.

What if I just want to donate to GOTR and not get any dice?

We're thrilled you love us that much! Along with supporting our website and servers, we'll use part of your donation to offset the cost of dice for other members. Your donation may also go to purchase dice for people that cannot afford them, or as awards for exceptional service to the outfit.

What about the yearly raffle?

We're still going to hold a raffle this year! Prizes include a Star Citizen account pack, another 1 pound of teal-and-purple M&Ms, GOTR dice, a blank GOTR dog tag and more. If you have something to donate to the raffle, please contact robocpf1 by PM on our website.

Is what I see in the picture exactly what I will receive?

No. We are making some changes to the prototype to make the finished product cheaper and more well finished. The photograph in the header was colour corrected from the red casino die blank the custom dice company had on hand to more closely resemble the final colour. The ink will also be in white, not silver, as this keeps the cost further down and matches the factory finish of the 2-3-4-5 sides.

The Casino dice will resemble the sample serial-numbered 19mm casino dice in colour and finish. On the 6 side, instead of a serial number, the letters "GOTR" will be engraved and painted to match the pips. On the 1 side, instead of the single pip, the GOTR shield (as designed by TallonHunter/Mitri) will be engraved and painted to match the pips. The 2-3-4-5 sides will look exactly as they do in the above picture.

(For the curious, the cost to engrave all 6 sides on a blank purple die raises the cost per die by $2. Leadership felt this would make the dice too expensive for some, and the result does not look as professional.)

Are the dice balanced?

For the precision casino dice, all 6 sides are flush and machined to 0.0002" / 0.005mm accuracy by US law and general international agreement. Our dice will have the 2-3-4-5-6 sides finished as regular casino dice, but the 1 side will be blank, then etched with the logo. The 6 side is further etched with the letters GOTR.

Informal testing of a fully 6-side cut die (as you see in the pictures) gave the following results:

# rolls  Side #

 100 1
  99 2
 107 3
 106 4
  86 5
 102 6

As you can see, the distribution is pretty regular, and all rolls are within 2 standard deviations even at this small sample size (1 sdev = 11.09955, variance = 123.2). With the 2-3-4-5 sides in the production die being guaranteed completely even, and with the logo/logotype cutting on both the 6 and the 1 side, our dice cutting contractor feels that the balance of this die will be better than your average die shipped with any board game. He further agrees that the dice will likely exceed the quality of most that you would buy from a gaming or RPG supply company.

In the interest of full disclosure, should this assertion prove false, GOTR will not be able refund your purchase price due to the nature of group buys and the up-front purchase of dice required.

story:
The Mythroll Armory Perplexing Puzzle Experience is a collection of physical puzzles, immersive soundscapes, and enticing narratives for tabletop games.  It is made for any skill level and any TTRPG. No matter the experience of the Game Master or player, the puzzles can be customized by difficulty, used individually as single-solution challenges, or intricately woven together to form a full campaign.

In order to create an immersive experience for Tabletop RPG players we've combined:

  • Several physical puzzles including a 5-piece custom encoder/decoder
  • A campaign and instruction booklet that lets you customize the puzzles for your own campaigns
  • A custom Syrinscape sound set with cues written into the book
  • An expanding world that lets you re-use the puzzle, adding to their value

The Mythroll Armory Perplexing Puzzle Experience 

 

The physical items in the box:

Although most items in the box are unique custom creations by the Mythroll team, The Mythroll Armory Perplexing Puzzle Experience is about much more than just the physical items in the box. Together we can bring your tabletop gaming to the next level with an immersive experience including downloadable sound sets from Syrinscape. 

  • 10-page narrative and instruction booklet for Garand Phalenau 
  • Expansion booklet with Krrag Farrlun setting
  • 5 custom oversized Mythroll Armory treasure dice
  • 9" block puzzle terrain
  • 22" Map of Phelaneau region
  • 22" Map of Krrag Farrlun region
  • 3-piece Krrag Farrlun map puzzle
  • 2 Interlocked keys puzzle
  • 2-piece Caged Prism puzzle
  • 5-piece cryptographic decoder puzzle 
  • 2-piece Encrypted Parchment puzzle 
  • And several other pieces we can't show to preserve some mystery!


The guidebook clearly explains how to integrate and solve each puzzle.  It even includes instructions on using the decrypter component to create your own riddles.

A sample page from inside the puzzle guide:

An excerpt from Garand Phelaneau:

 

We've built an expanding world.

For every $10,000 raised we will release a new region of the world, a new campaign setting, and show you new ways to present the puzzles to your group:

  • ✅ Upper Garand Phalenau Included in-box
  • ✅ $10,000 - Krrag Farrlun Included in-box
  • ☑️ $20,000 - Rylz-Ytten-Kyl (download)
  • ☑️ $30,000 - Vritz-Kylar (download)
  • ☑️ $40,000 more unlocked!

 

Help release new regions.

 

Our Past Successes

In March of 2020 we launched the Mythroll Armory Dice Spinners which was fully funded within 9 hours and reached 1,000% funding by the end of 30 days.  We also recently completed the Mythroll Armory Tin 20 which was funded in 18 minutes and hit 2,600% funding in 14 days!  We are confident in our ability to successfully fund and fulfill this Kickstarter as well.

Brandon Perkins has created his own worlds and lore, and both acted as Dungeon Master as well as player-character on RealmsmithTV which is featured on twitch.tv/dnd and twitch.tv/realmsmith.

 

Project Progress

  • ✅ Prototypes sourced and built
  • ✅ Distribution solved
  • ✅ Game mechanics tested
  • ☑️ Raise Funds (this is it!)
  • ☑️ Production (ready to go)
  • ☑️ Fulfillment
  • ☑️ Sell publically (price goes up!)

story:
Someone is coming to town for the holidays

You better watch out..

Available for Fifth Edition, Swords & Wizardry, and the Pathfinder role playing system. "How Orcus Stole Christmas!" has the characters begins at a happy village's beloved holiday feast. The joy-filled townsfolk spotted an scary stranger arrive in his unusual sleigh. With a deep belly laugh the pillaging began... 

Can your party save the children from the mysterious visitor's clutches by Christmas?

 

How Orcus Stole Christmas!

Frog God Games wants your support for our first holiday adventure in over a decade -"How Orcus Stole Christmas!". Written by James M. Spahn, this, our third Indiegogo project, will warm your heart this winter. 

A detailed description of our process and goals fulfillment process can be found in the FAQ.

 

O, Come All Ye Faithful....to Newville!

This low-level adventure introduces the players to a contained wilderness environment known as Newville. It is designed to fit into most traditional fantasy campaigns, The open nature and local environment can extend the adventure across multiple sessions. So beware the danger behind the joyful cruelty of the enemies and their pathetic holiday slaves!

It’s up to a small band of brave heroes to save Christmas this year, and without their unwavering Christmas spirit and willingness to face the cruelties of both winter and a twisted aspect of the great Demon Prince, they’ll never discover How Orcus Stole Christmas...

Can the player characters discover why Orcus Claws is waylaying the town of Newville?  Will they survive the climb up cruel Mount Strumpet with its cannibal reindeer and treacherous avalanches? And for the love of Christmas, why are all these damn News singing all the time?!

 

A Classic 'News' Song

All the News down in Newville were nestled snug in their bed.
But come Christmas Day they might end up dead.
For Orcus Claws is coming, bringing more than jingles and bells
Armed with the wicked contraptions of his Crueltide Elves
No metal in sight, not a pin or a nail
|Now to Mount Strumpet, the heroes asail
With Orcus empowered, he’s laid such a trap
That even mighty warriors might never come back
But without noble aid no one will get away
And it’ll Newville’s last Christmas today
Slaughtered beneath a brutal Crueltide device
Because Orcus Claws knows who’s been naughty or nice

What's in the book?

How Orcus Stole Christmas! can be used for any holiday themed adventure in a  session that includes low-level characters (though admittedly it is pretty easy to scale up). 

Inside the finished release you will find the following-

  • An adventure which can be integrated into an existing campaign as a brief (yet twisted) celebration of the season.
  • New and festive creatures which have a tendency to kill and/or feast on itinerant characters that are not prepared for danger amidst all the dark humor. 
  • Joyful magic items with heartwarming powers.
  • An description of the village of Newville, the demeanor of the News, plus exciting rumors about the surrounding valley. The valley is thought to be full of adventure.
  • The author's manuscript was  bursting with bloody sarcasm and holiday humor.
  • A visitor who arrives in the night upon a magical sleigh.

Yes that is one of the merry Crueltide Elves  on his way for another day at the plant. Notice the motivational pointy shoes...a sure sign of management.

What is missing from this holiday extravaganza?

  • A miserly old Englishman and his ghosts.
  • The Great Pumpkin
  • Bruce Willis

For those of you new to our Indiegogo campaigns, welcome!  Their is some information below explaining this smaller, faster and more frequent option!

The Tiny Print Run

Why Indiegogo?

Frog God Games is continues to evaluate Indiegogo as a platform this project- so far it has been successful with a very modest goal.

We call this approach the 'Tiny Print Run'

Thus, Indiegogo projects by Frog God Games will-

  • Be short in duration
  • Be limited to a single title
  • Have options priced between $5-$30
  • Design all stretch goals and project bonus' affect the principle reward only (usually both the PDF and the softcover).
  • Be the only guaranteed method to get the premium print copy (NOTE: the softcover versions  in this printing will not be sold on our website: see FAQ for explanation).
  • Have a simple fulfillment process that does not use Backerkit.

Why the Tiny Print Run?

Since 2012 our crowdfunding approach has been extravagant in every way. Ambitious with massive page counts, plus numerous add-on options and stretch goals. All supporting a primary title itself as many as 990 pages.

This has resulted in Kickstarter's with memorable pledge rewards that include top-quality hardcover books with sometimes dozens of stretch goal bonuses and add-on extras. These are awesome AND they are expensive purchases for customers like you. They are also  very expensive to make for publishers like us.

Is Frog God Games giving up on Kickstarter?

No. Far from it, in fact these smaller projects are happening in response to the feedback we have heard from both fans and 'almost' fans alike. We hear the request for less expensive options for our projects and products all the time. A second frequent desire expressed to us, whether at conventions, on social media or in email, is for a larger selection of smaller, faster-paced adventures that can be completed in 2-3 sessions and not necessitate a full two year campaign.

Additionally, Frog God Games has grown in both sales and brand awareness.  This opportunity will give us the additional resources to invest in the very best books in all of our formats. This will be the second project we have launched on Indiegogo for the purpose. The first, the City the Dripped Blood arrived 2 months earlier than planned. The second In Vino Gigantus is looking to be completed on time as well.

Project Reward 

With the wishes of the fans in mind, this and future Indiegogo projects will fund standalone projects that are both affordable and fun. This project, as well future Tiny Print Run projects, is narrowly focused with all stretch goals adding resources to the principle reward which traditionally would not be feasible for a publisher our size. 

The Incentives and Enhancements resulting from Higher Funding Levels

During the 7 day primary project period for How Orcus Stole Christmas! and after the $750 goal is met the focus will be to improve the delivered product. There are not special tiered collectors editions or add-on purchase extras. Thus as total project funding increases the better we will make the final product. All goals and extras will benefit everybody who pledged.

Examples of the potential extras unleashed for How Orcus Stole Christmas! include the following-

  • Additional commissions for interior color art specific to the adventure
  • Extra written content from the author (he assures us he can add content to meet our tight deadline)
  • Printed Player Maps tucked inside the print module (downloadable as well).
  • Media Options designed for popular virtual tabletop software (New creature/NPC tokens etc). 
  • Digital extras (player handouts etc) that are focused on quality table-top play
  • Even more holiday magic where demons, fey, and frosty constructs heap abuse on the cheerful and the jubilant that dare wish for peace and joy.

Project Delivery

PDF Perks

We will email the instructions to all eligible supporters with instructions on accessing PDF items. The PDF files are distributed using Constant Contact service and our web store. You will need to have a customer account on the Frog God Games website to get your PDF; it's how we keep track of everything and grants unlimited access by you to your reward.

The Indiegogo perk PDF files are 'purchased' at zero cost by supporters (as they are paid for during the Indiegogo promotion) at the Frog God Games web store using a coupon code. That code we will be sent via Constant Contact to the address provided by Indiegogo. Please contact us with any questions/requests about this.

Softcover Perks

Softcover perks will be mailed to the address provided by us via Indiegogo. 

NOTE TO INTERNATIONAL BACKERS: Shipping international has become very expensive we understand this and are not able to ship How the Orcus Stole Christmas! for less than US$25 to Canada or US$35 worldwide. To explain what we mean, please see the shipping calculator for UPS by clicking here- 

https://wwwapps.ups.com/ctc/request?loc=en_US.

Overseas Shipping

We continue to see cost increases and damage increases on overseas shipping. We cannot do anything about this. Likewise, some countries charge VAT tax or other fees to our customers on receipt. We cannot fraudulently lie about the value of materials we mail out. 

We are happy to ship you anything regardless of where you live, but we have to stay in business at the same time thus even our lightest books are affected. In the near future we expect to have a print on demand system in place for everyone overseas.

About the Author

James M. Spahn is a prolific author whose credits include the White Box Omnibus, the Three Castles Award nominated The Hero’s Journey Fantasy Roleplaying , White Star: White Box Science Fiction Roleplaying, and several products in the Star Wars and The One Ring roleplaying game product lines. He has been a passionate freelance writer and independent creator within the roleplaying game community for over a decade and brings over thirty years of gaming experience to this product. He served as a contributing author on several Frog God Games products, including In Vino Gigantus, Bard’s Gate, The Riot Act: A Bard’s Gate Adventure, and Predator’s Oath: A Northlands Saga Adventure. James’s twisted sense of humor and decades of experience in game design ensure that How Orcus Stole Christmas is a holiday treat twice as tough as grandma’s fruitcake that will become an equally repugnant tradition for you and your friends for years to come.
story_txt:
Someone is coming to town for the holidaysYou better watch out..Available for Fifth Edition, Swords & Wizardry, and the Pathfinder role playing system. "How Orcus Stole Christmas!" has the characters begins at a happy village's beloved holiday feast. The joy-filled townsfolk spotted an scary stranger arrive in his unusual sleigh. With a deep belly laugh the pillaging began... Can your party save the children from the mysterious visitor's clutches by Christmas? How Orcus Stole Christmas!Frog God Games wants your support for our first holiday adventure in over a decade -"How Orcus Stole Christmas!". Written by James M. Spahn, this, our third Indiegogo project, will warm your heart this winter. A detailed description of our process and goals fulfillment process can be found in the FAQ. O, Come All Ye Faithful....to Newville!This low-level adventure introduces the players to a contained wilderness environment known as Newville. It is designed to fit into most traditional fantasy campaigns, The open nature and local environment can extend the adventure across multiple sessions. So beware the danger behind the joyful cruelty of the enemies and their pathetic holiday slaves!It’s up to a small band of brave heroes to save Christmas this year, and without their unwavering Christmas spirit and willingness to face the cruelties of both winter and a twisted aspect of the great Demon Prince, they’ll never discover How Orcus Stole Christmas...Can the player characters discover why Orcus Claws is waylaying the town of Newville?  Will they survive the climb up cruel Mount Strumpet with its cannibal reindeer and treacherous avalanches? And for the love of Christmas, why are all these damn News singing all the time?! A Classic 'News' SongAll the News down in Newville were nestled snug in their bed.But come Christmas Day they might end up dead.For Orcus Claws is coming, bringing more than jingles and bellsArmed with the wicked contraptions of his Crueltide ElvesNo metal in sight, not a pin or a nail|Now to Mount Strumpet, the heroes asailWith Orcus empowered, he’s laid such a trapThat even mighty warriors might never come backBut without noble aid no one will get awayAnd it’ll Newville’s last Christmas todaySlaughtered beneath a brutal Crueltide deviceBecause Orcus Claws knows who’s been naughty or niceWhat's in the book?How Orcus Stole Christmas! can be used for any holiday themed adventure in a  session that includes low-level characters (though admittedly it is pretty easy to scale up). Inside the finished release you will find the following-
An adventure which can be integrated into an existing campaign as a brief (yet twisted) celebration of the season.
New and festive creatures which have a tendency to kill and/or feast on itinerant characters that are not prepared for danger amidst all the dark humor. 
Joyful magic items with heartwarming powers.
An description of the village of Newville, the demeanor of the News, plus exciting rumors about the surrounding valley. The valley is thought to be full of adventure.
The author's manuscript was  bursting with bloody sarcasm and holiday humor.
A visitor who arrives in the night upon a magical sleigh.
Yes that is one of the merry Crueltide Elves  on his way for another day at the plant. Notice the motivational pointy shoes...a sure sign of management.What is missing from this holiday extravaganza?
A miserly old Englishman and his ghosts.
The Great Pumpkin
Bruce Willis

story:
What if 35 minutes could save your son or daughter from serving 3 - 5 years in prison?

I am April Preyar, a criminal defense attorney in Chicago, known as the JustUs Junkie. For 19 years, I've represented people charged with crimes from petty offenses to serious felonies. Over the course of my career, I've grown frustrated with standing before a judge or jury with one client at a time. What if I could reach thousands to prevent them from ever entering a courtroom? Millions?

I started with workshops. I gained an online following with videos and blog posts. Now, I'm introducing a boardgame which combines all of the videos, articles and seminars into an interactive boardgame. Teens quickly learn the pitfalls that take them out of the "World of Possibilities" and land them in a "World of Trouble."

The Process: Tried and True.

Before bringing this game to your kitchen table, to your family, I wanted to get it right.  I play-tested a prototype of the game on dozens of teens and adults ages 13 to 23. The players were from different socioeconomic backgrounds, from public and private schools.

They played one 35 minute session. Afterwards, they are surveyed about what they liked, what they didn't like, what they would improve and most importantly, what they learned.

Based on their feedback, I tweaked, revised and improved the game -- all before delivering it to you.

 

The Impact: Save A Life.

An old African proverb says, "If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together." 

The bottomline is, I cannot reach as many teens, adults, schools, teachers, pastors, mentors by myself as we can reach together. Trying to finance this myself has gotten the project this far (my parents even kicked in a few bucks.  Gotta love them!) but it will not carry it to all of the places it deserves to go, to all of the people it is destined to touch.

This game will save someone's life. Period. It will stop someone from acting out of haste or panic when they interact with police. It will stop someone from succumbing to peer pressure and joining in a group crime that ruins countless lives. I don't know whose life, but it will save at least one. 

It's all fun & games until someone asks for money.

Many hands have helped and continue to lend their time and talents to this labor of love. Below is a pie chart of what the funds are needed for production, advertising and distribution of the game. The cost of perks is included in the calculation:

 

Risks & Challenges

The greatest challenges are color printing costs and distribution.

The cost of color printing is high, from flyers to the gameboard to the box that houses it. My goal is a sleek, professional product that teens and adults enjoy playing.

I need help getting the word out to schools, churches, mosques, Boys and Girls Clubs, scouting troops and families.  Getting it in the hands of teens before they ever have any police contact is critical. 

Sharing is Caring!

Share this campaign with friends, co-workers, bosses, pastors, workout buddies, your students, the lady at the cleaners, the man who drives the school bus -- you get the picture. Share. Like. Pre-order!

story:
Boogie Dice are the world’s first self-rolling, sound activated, programmable, gaming dice. Clap your hands, snap yours fingers or bang the table, and they will start to Boogie:

 

 

100% smile guarantee: having the dice magically roll on your command makes everyone who sees it smile, and that's what we're here for!

Designed to be a universal gaming accessory, Boogie Dice can replace any standard ‘static’ dice in any and all of your favorite games. But Boogie Dice are jam-packed with unique features and abilities that transform them from simple dice into the coolest gaming accessory.

 

 

 

 

Bots Battleground is a fast-paced, real-time card game that was designed specifically to utilize the novel properties of Boogie Dice. In the game (3-6 players, ages 8 and up), players battle each other with bot cards, while the Boogie Dice dictate the duration and special rules of each round, and power tokens keep track of the score.

 

 

Each game includes 1 specially designed Boogie Dice, 1 charger/arena, a deck of 60 unique bot cards, 40 power tokens and a rulebook. See below for more details.

For this campaign, we are offering additional special Boogie Dice and the first Bots Battleground expansion. You can play the game with any number of expansions and up to 4 different special Boogie Dice at a time!

 

 

Boogie Dice can be programmed to utilize the following features:

 

 

Boogie Dice are packed with features that add layers of fun, excitement, chaos, strategy and interactivity to gaming, and this is just the beginning...

 

 

Inside each Boogie Dice there is a vibration motor, a tiny microphone, a microprocessor, a rechargeable battery and 3 LED lights. When the microphone detects a short and loud sound, such as a hand clap or a finger snap, the motor starts rotating, causing the dice bounce and roll.

 

 

Different behaviors can be programmed into the dice, such as to "stop listening" during random periods of time, or activating the red LED while a turn is in progress, so countless new games can be designed for it. One such game is Bots Battleground...

 

 

 

 

 

Bots Battleground is a quick and slick player vs. player match game with tons of intense tactics and tenuous treaties. Each of your bots has special specs and you must know when to deploy it for maximum effect. You should also be aware of other players' bots in order to know who to attack and who to solicit for cooperation.

 

 

The game can be played with one or more special "iconized" and pre-programmed Boogie Dice, which “decide” whether a player attacks or not, and determines special rules for each round. It also sets up, randomly, how long a round lasts. So players must always pay attention to the dice in order to choose the right tactic of the moment, who to ally with, and how much risk they should take.

 

 

Are you fast, cunning and daring enough to win? Click, snap or clap your way to victory!

 

 

 

 

 

Check out the rules here:

 

 

 

 

 

On a full charge, Boogie Dice can roll up to 30 minutes continuously. That’s about 500 activations!

Each die is equipped with a powerful 100 mAh rechargeable lithium battery. To charge the dice, place them on the 3 metal charging pins on the charging station. The dice glow red throughout the charging period (approx. 40 min).

 

 

 

 

By default, a Boogie Dice rolls for 2-4 seconds, displaying a blue light, then stops and glows purple for 1 second. After 1 minute without being activated, the dice goes to sleep.

Changing these settings is super easy. Boogie Dice are programmable with sound, so you can pick from a list of different settings on our app or website and use them to communicate with the dice and reprogram it to suit any game you want.

 

 

When programming the dice, they start to blink with red and blue lights, then a blue steady light will indicate that the programming succeeded.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Nimrod (CEO) is an inventor, app developer and crowd-funding rock-star. His first creation,Pressy, was a breakthrough success, and Nimrod has plenty more great ideas up his sleeve.

Saar (Game Designer) is an inventor, game designer (The Agents, King Down), product developer and patent writer. Saar not only comes up with great ideas, but has the energy, imagination and enthusiasm to make them happen.

 

 

Alicia (Marketing) is a London-raised, international communications expert. She loves writing, story-telling, building brands and communities and making great ideas grab you by the nose.

Nir (CTO) is an expert in all things tech, with a specialism in sound recognition. As a seasoned CEO and CTO of Verbal Machines, he knows how to power both people and computers.

 

 

During the last six months we have designed and created more than 100 (!) different models and prototypes.

 

 

While the concept of Boogie Dice is simple, bouncing the dice using strong vibration and finding the right power-speed-size-weight ratio was really challenging, but we were determined to make it work.

Luckily, we were able to fully develop Boogie Dice, ready for manufacturing. But this is only the beginning... Boogie Dice offers enormous potential to build new, innovative games based on the dice’s unique features and abilities. We already have a couple more games in the pipeline, and the ideas are endless. Feel free to take part in the comments section during the campaign to share your own ideas of how Boogie Dice can add flavor and fun to both existing games as well as brand new games!

Balance

We have taken several steps to make sure Boogie Dice will be perfectly balanced: the components are spread equally (weight distribution is even) and the motor is positioned diagonally (maximizing bounce).

 

Formal optimization will be conducted during final production but we have extensively tested our prototypes and the results have been very encouraging, coming extremely close to perfect balance.

Help us roll

 

 

 

 

 

 

Boogie Dice is definitely the most fun product we have ever worked on and we are excited to share the magic with you. We hope you join us on this journey. Thank you. Nimrod & Saar.

But this is only the beginning... Boogie Dice offers enormous potential to build new, innovative games based on the dice’s unique features and abilities. We already have a couple more games in the pipeline, and the ideas are endless. Feel free to take part in the comments section during the campaign to share your own ideas of how Boogie Dice can add flavor and fun to both existing games as well as brand new games!BalanceWe have taken several steps to make sure Boogie Dice will be perfectly balanced: the components are spread equally (weight distribution is even) and the motor is positioned diagonally (maximizing bounce). 

 PLAY 

Formal optimization will be conducted during final production but we have extensively tested our prototypes and the results have been very encouraging, coming extremely close to perfect balance.Help us roll      Boogie Dice is definitely the most fun product we have ever worked on and we are excited to share the magic with you. We hope you join us on this journey. Thank you. Nimrod & Saar.

story:
Hey, y'all! It's us again...

We'll keep it short and sweet.

 

What we want to do:

- Bring back FEROX for a 3rd printing/2nd edition of (at least) 100 copies.

- Bring back TRASH LORDS for a 2nd printing/2nd edition of (at least) 70 copies with the brand new built-in expansion GUTTER SCUM.

- Make (at least) 30 standalone copies of the GUTTER SCUM expansion for people who already own a copy of TRASH LORDS.

 

THE GAMES:

 

FEROX 

[ BOARDGAMEGEEK PAGE]

 

 

What's new for the 2nd Edition:

  • - Purple Rage cubes (rather than orange) for easier differentiation between colors
  • - Revised "Starter Decks" to improve gameplay for first-time players

 

TRASH LORDS // GUTTER SCUM

[ BOARDGAMEGEEK PAGE]

 

What's new for the 2nd Edition:

  • The brand-new built-in expansion, GUTTER SCUM!
    • 6 new Crusties
    • 2 new Venues
    • A whole lot of "A.I." enemies to take-down
    • A completely new gameplay experience that gives you the option to turn TRASH LORDS into a cooperative game in which players fight side-by-side to stop the evil Scum from taking over their town.

 

PROMO VIDEO:

     

    Cards in the 2nd Edition of TRASH LORDS have been revised to feature both the game's original rules and the expansion's new rules, so you can easily play whichever version you want.

    If you already have a copy of TRASH LORDS:

    The GUTTER SCUM expansion is also available separately so you can play it with your 1st Edition copy of the game.  

    NOTE: The "Expansion Only" bag only comes with the new cards/bits needed to play the expansion. Since your 1st Edition's "thing" cards don't have the Gutter Scum rules printed on them, we'll include a Quick Reference card in each bag to help you keep track of the new effects. 

     

    GUTTER SCUM Includes:

    • 3 circles // 8 squares
    • 5 big cards // 16 little cards
    • 1 Gutter Snipe
    • 1 Quick Reference card

     


    What we need:

    $2200 will cover the cost of:

    • - Materials/components for the games
    • - Shipping (hopefully...)
    • - A case or two of Miller Lite (to help us get through the assembly process)

    That's pretty much it.

     

    What happens next:

    If we reach our goal, we'll order everything we need and immediately get to work making/shipping the games. 

    If we exceed out goal, any extra funds will be used to make additional copies of the games which we'll make available on our website.

     

    Other Important Stuff:

    We're a fully-independent DIY publisher and every copy of every game we sell is handmade by the two of us in our kitchen for only enough profit to buy the beers we drink while we're doing it. We have no retail distribution, no overseas manufacturers or shipping deals, and no idea what the term "business acumen" means. Our profit margin doesn't exist, we have no employees, and we don't pay ourselves. This is truly a punk rock labor of love and--like any DIY project--we can't do it without the help and support of the community.

     

    SPREAD THE WORD!

    This is a fixed-funding campaign, which means we won't get the funds unless we reach our goal. Help us get the word out and annoy your friends until they buy a copy of their own. Without you, we're just a couple of dorks with a handful of dice and a dream. And without us, you're probably doing just fine, but you won't have any copies of our silly games.

    XOXO,
    Brad & Ryan
    Co-Dudes of Craft Fair Games

story:
The Game

Have you been looking for a game that takes you to the edge of your comfort zone? A game which creates hilarious moments to share with a group of friends?

We have a perfect adult party game for those willing to grab the spotlight for a laugh. Gather your friends to explore fun beyond restrictions to win the title of Jackwagon!

This party game is played with up to 10 people ready to be fearless showoffs and laugh their asses off. Jackwagon is a timed game where players take turns drawing a card from the Jackwagon deck. Each player reads the challenge card to the group and performs the challenge to earn Badonka dollars.  If a player is not fearless enough for the challenge, the player presents a Jack-offer to the group by laying the challenge card and badonka dollars on the table. The other players can then choose the Jack-offer card and money or draw a new challenge card from the JW deck and perform the challenge.

At the end of 90 minutes, each player gets one final turn! The player who is shameless enough to collect the most Badonka dollars is the winner and claims the cash jackpot and title of Jackwagon!

Game Delivery

The game of Jackwagon is complete and is in production now.  The games are currently being printed and will be totally complete by mid-May, and ready for delivery in mid-to-late-June.

Special Thanks

Special thanks to David’s boys Michael, Mark and Jack, as well as their friends Justin, Reid, Dylan, Christian, Trey, Josh and Lexi for being the first to test our game and share their experience on video.  

Special thanks to our friends who contributed to our project: 
Cindy Baxter, first and foremost, of Artgigs.com. Without her graphic artistry and creativity, the game design would not have been possible. 

Doug Baxter, Cindy’s husband, who took the raw footage of our video shoot and created an amazing promotional video. 

Sean Daylor, our webmaster who put together the foundation of our website and community. 

Katie Cantu, our wordsmith, who drafted the voiceover script and simplified our rules. 

The Team

David Swearingen, Owner, Co-Founder
Justin Spain, Owner, Co-Founder
Tyler Vanstory, VP- Marketing

story:
The Cascadia Tarot Project

Scandinavian Dinner Party Photography has spent the last few years creating a tarot deck that utilizes the symbolism of the traditional Rider-Waite Tarot paired along with the artist's own imaginative twist to make your spreads easy to read and creatively interpreted. 

Along with the 78-card deck, there will be a beautifully depicted description booklet with a glimpse into the symbolism of each photograph used, written by Seattle's own Kaylani Perisho. Kaylani's artistry spans from her painting of words to the alluring design of The Cascadia Tarot's boxset.  

Siri Rose, photographer of deck, wants to thank the talented models, writers, and artists that have come together to create this truly breathtaking piece of camaraderie! On behalf of all of us, we are proud to announce the delivery of The Cascadia Tarot into the world! 
 

What We Need & What You Get

The Cascadia Tarot is working on printing 1,000 decks, booklets and custom boxes to get to the people, as well as custom stickers!

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge thus far has been getting the deck finished and printed in time for the holidays, and making sure we have enough for everyone from beginners to tarot masters the ability to try out the Cascadia Tarot!

Other Ways You Can Help

Cash doesn't have to rule everything around you, teamwork is an even bigger benefactor!
If none of the tiers suit your  pocketbook, spreading our campaign around and sharing with your friends and family will help us more than you know!
 
With all of the love in this world and beyond!
-The Cascadia Tarot Dream Team

story:
​Build groves to expand your realm, manage your pool of spirits, and optimize your resource production to become the ruler of Idyllon!​

Read the full Gameosity Preview

 Read Mike's take on the use of bag-building in Groves

 *Multiplayer and solo variant both included on Tabletopia!

 OUR SINCEREST APPRECIATION TO THE MANY WHO HAVE HELPED US ALONG THE WAY!  

We would like to thank (in no particular order) Cassie Friedman, Dustin Schwartz, Mike Wokasch (Fairway3 Games), Andrew and Jessica Fisher (Gameosity), Ryan Sanders (Inquisitive Meeple), Tom Gurganus (Go Forth and Game), James Hudson (Druid City Games), Richard Ham (Rahdo), Dane Trimble (Everything Board Games), Thomas Covert (Board Game Revolution), George Jaros (GJJ Games), Chris Anderson (Blue Cube Games), Ryan Leininger (One Wolf Creative), and Chris and Joe at Cardboard Architects.

Lastly, we would like to give a shout out to our official playtesters: Teresa Aramini, Janice Baker, Aaron Cloutier, Carly Cook, Danny Devine, Deni Kassan, Joseph Kisenwether, Paul Kluka, Michael Letzring, Stephanie Letzring, Rick LouAllen, Brian Povio, Simon Reid, Tim Smith, Jeff Wallace, Tyler Wilson, Mike Wokasch, Nicholas Yu, Rochester Crashtest group, Rochester Unpub Group, and San Jose Protospiel.

Risks and challenges

Letiman Games, LLC has now successfully fulfilled 4 different campaigns, all of which were fulfilled on time! We have forged numerous relationships in the industry that will help insure we stay on track and succeed in fulfillment even if issues arise.

We have a proven track record that we believe in open and honest communication by posting consistent updates and images of production in process. We also have proven that we deliver great games full of quality components at a reasonable price. We guarantee we will succeed in delivering a high quality game and we will do everything in our power to make sure that happens in our expected timeline.

story:
Stars from the world of Broadway (Alex Boniello, Andrew Barth Feldman, and Will Roland from Dear Evan Hansen) and from the world of Dungeons and Dragons (Travis McElroy from The Adventure Zone as Dungeon Master, Matthew Mercer from Critical Role, Erika Ishii of LA By Night, and Satine Phoenix of Gilding Light)  are coming together to play a game for a good cause! Two good causes in fact! Money raised by this Indiegogo will be split between the Actors Fund and Feeding America!

So, donate now! Then, tune into our Twitch stream on June 6th at 1pm ET/10am PT! Also, we'll have some donation options during the game to benefit the players or the DM! It's gonna be a blast!

story:
alphaTUB is your child’s best friend. 

The patented and award-winning alphabet peg tool brings the letters of the alphabet to life unlike any tool the world has seen. Designed for more than just your preschooler in mind, each letter is represented with a range of symbols that are printed on interchangeable content sheets that slide into alphaTUB’s letter template. The more your child learns, the more content sheets you can customize for them to build on their knowledge.

Stimulating, delightful and educational, alphaTUB gives an upgrade to the previous static pegboard we’ve used for generations and allows preschoolers to learn faster and better, while expanding their creativity.

alphaTUB comes in two variations: 
The alphaTUB is made with child safe ABS-grade plastic and the alphaTUB Classic is made with the finest quality wood.

 

 
 

On average, a typical two year old knows around 100 words, but present-day wooden peg boards limit them to just 26. With alphaTUB, your child is immersed in a world of dynamic learning where they can create what the letters stand for as their vocabulary broadens and their creativity is unboxed.

Simply insert any original alphaTUB sheet into the TUB slot, and watch your child’s creativity take them in new directions. Traditional wooden peg boards can hold back the potential your child has, but alphaTUB is the only one that can truly bring color into their world and their imagination to life.

 

alphaTUB is the world’s first and only alphabet peg board with a one-of-a-kind design that empowers your child to associate symbols with anything they can imagine. It even allows parents to dynamically change the content so that “A” also represents ant, alligator, avocado, or even atom! We’ve taken a proven learning tool and created a toy that invites open-ended play and faster, better development for your child.

 

Our kids’ learning progress is a top priority, but sometimes life’s troubles get the better of us and it becomes hard to keep track. With the alphaTUB mobile app, you can not only keep track and share the learning progress of your child, but you can also create and download new graphics or sheets, and even share or sell your content on the TUB marketplace.

Your kids can even draw their own content sheets to learn and share with others. With the alphaTUB mobile app, the opportunities for creation are limitless for both you and your child.

 

 

The very foundation of life and love fosters discovery, creativity and progress. alphaTUB is a story of love. The seeds of alphaTUB were sewn by the love of two sisters. It is a story of love, play and learning in the family. It is the story of two fearless fathers who became passionately in love with the dream of alphaTUB and made it come true. It's a story of the love of a patient wife and an ever-challenging beloved who inspired and marshaled to make alphaTUB a reality.
 
It's a story of the love of friends and family connecting. The refreshing, engaging and immersive world of alphaTUB is a ticket for everyone to relive their childhood. With alphaTUB, take a flight back to the wonderful fun filled days of your childhood. It’s another chance for you to revisit where it all began. Love. Play. Learn.
 

We know not everyone will be able to support us with a pledge, so even if you can’t purchase an alphaTUB, if you’re a supporter of alphaTUB, you can help us spread the word on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and anywhere else you can think of! Remember, every child deserves freedom & creativity and alphaTUB can help.

We can’t thank you enough for checking out our project, helping us unbox creativity, and contributing to the success of alphaTUB.

With the alphaTUB mobile app, the opportunities for creation are limitless for both you and your child. 
  
 
 
 
  
 

 
 
  
    
 
 
  
 
 
Founded in May 2016, alphaTUB is made up of people dedicated to developing and producing children’s learning products. These products are designed to help children find new ways to learn throughout their growing cycle and create an everlasting bond with parents and teachers alike. After six years of extensive research, and winning the 2017 Edison Award for Innovation in The United States, the team is excited to introduce this dynamic and personalized language learning tool to children.  alphaTUB  is the winner of the Red Herring Asia 2017 Award in Manila and Red Herring Global 2017 Awards in Los Angeles.  alphaTUB  was chosen as a Jury Finalist in 2016 and again in 2017 for the CII Industrial Innovation Awards in India. The very foundation of life and love fosters discovery, creativity and progress. alphaTUB is a story of love. The seeds of alphaTUB were sewn by the love of two sisters. It is a story of love, play and learning in the family. It is the story of two fearless fathers who became passionately in love with the dream of alphaTUB and made it come true. It's a story of the love of a patient wife and an ever-challenging beloved who inspired and marshaled to make alphaTUB a reality. It's a story of the love of friends and family connecting. The refreshing, engaging and immersive world of alphaTUB is a ticket for everyone to relive their childhood. With alphaTUB, take a flight back to the wonderful fun filled days of your childhood. It’s another chance for you to revisit where it all began. Love. Play. Learn.  
  
 

 
We know not everyone will be able to support us with a pledge, so even if you can’t purchase an alphaTUB, if you’re a supporter of alphaTUB, you can help us spread the word on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and anywhere else you can think of! Remember, every child deserves freedom & creativity and alphaTUB can help.
We can’t thank you enough for checking out our project, helping us unbox creativity, and contributing to the success of alphaTUB.

story:
POTATO PIRATES: 10 HOURS OF PROGRAMMING IN 30 MINUTES

 

Potato Pirates combines potatoes, programming, and piracy into a carbo-loaded card game perfect for the classroom, family day, or even game night with friends. It teaches anyone age 6 & up, 10 hours worth of programming concepts in 30 minutes, all without a computer!  

  

There are 7 Potato King cards hidden at random in the deck. Be the first to collect all 7 Potato King cards by roasting, mashing and frying other potato pirates. Power up your attacks with programming concepts such as loops and conditionals. Alternatively, eliminate all enemies and be the last Potato Pirate sailing to win the game.

 

 

Don't read the manual ya landlubber! Watch these bite-sized episodes of our instructional videos instead!

  

 

 

 

 

 

  

 

 

The Potato Pirates card game is created by Codomo - a Singapore-based education technology company that nurtures children's creativity through empathy, technology, and design education. Our vision is to cultivate every child’s love for learning by offering learners an environment that fosters their confidence and mindset for them to pursue their passion and attain holistic growth - in both academic and non-academic aspects. 

Cultivating a love for learning in every child should be one of the primary goals of any education body or institute. We achieve this by helping them discover their superpowers through our interdisciplinary curriculum that emphasizes real-world application, human-centric design, and inquiry-based learning. Part of what we do is to make students future ready, empowering them to create real-world impact through curricular experiences which amalgamate design thinking, computational thinking, and maker culture.Computer programming is becoming an essential 21st-century skill and we want everyone to learn this invaluable skill in an enjoyable manner. Having been through a near-traumatic experience in learning programming where we were forced to sit through painfully boring lectures with an exponentially steep learning curve, we started brainstorming ways to make learning fun, sociable, and impactful. We did not want the game to become another mobile application where kids (or anyone for that matter) would have to stare at their iPads to play, we already have enough of that. Additionally, computers may not be as easily accessible to children in other parts of the world. A substantial number of schools lack the resources to give students access to these computers to learn to program. 

Our desire to include human connection and elicit emotions was decisive in the creation of a tabletop card game which could be interactive and thrilling and, at the same time, while allowing anyone above age 6 to grasp fundamental programming concepts - without the need for a computer.

There was never an accessible and universal activity as a first-step into programming, regardless of age - until now! Have we mentioned that it's also lots of fun to play? So much so that the development of the game has severely reduced our productivity as we spend too much time playing it under the pretense of testing the game mechanics.

Potato Pirates brings teachers and students, parents and kids, friends and strangers together to learn abstract computational thinking concepts from one another in a simpler, better, and more visual manner.

Join our swash-buckling movement to make the love for and learning of programming universal!

It teaches anyone age 6 & up, 10 hours worth of programming concepts in 30 minutes, all without a computer!    There are 7 Potato King cards hidden at random in the deck. Be the first to collect all 7 Potato King cards by roasting, mashing and frying other potato pirates. Power up your attacks with programming concepts such as loops and conditionals. Alternatively, eliminate all enemies and be the last Potato Pirate sailing to win the game.  Don't read the manual ya landlubber! Watch these bite-sized episodes of our instructional videos instead!             The Potato Pirates card game is created by Codomo - a Singapore-based education technology company that nurtures children's creativity through empathy, technology, and design education. Our vision is to cultivate every child’s love for learning by offering learners an environment that fosters their confidence and mindset for them to pursue their passion and attain holistic growth - in both academic and non-academic aspects. Cultivating a love for learning in every child should be one of the primary goals of any education body or institute. We achieve this by helping them discover their superpowers through our interdisciplinary curriculum that emphasizes real-world application, human-centric design, and inquiry-based learning. Part of what we do is to make students future ready, empowering them to create real-world impact through curricular experiences which amalgamate design thinking, computational thinking, and maker culture.Computer programming is becoming an essential 21st-century skill and we want everyone to learn this invaluable skill in an enjoyable manner. Having been through a near-traumatic experience in learning programming where we were forced to sit through painfully boring lectures with an exponentially steep learning curve, we started brainstorming ways to make learning fun, sociable, and impactful. We did not want the game to become another mobile application where kids (or anyone for that matter) would have to stare at their iPads to play, we already have enough of that. Additionally, computers may not be as easily accessible to children in other parts of the world. A substantial number of schools lack the resources to give students access to these computers to learn to program. Our desire to include human connection and elicit emotions was decisive in the creation of a tabletop card game which could be interactive and thrilling and, at the same time, while allowing anyone above age 6 to grasp fundamental programming concepts - without the need for a computer.There was never an accessible and universal activity as a first-step into programming, regardless of age - until now! Have we mentioned that it's also lots of fun to play? So much so that the development of the game has severely reduced our productivity as we spend too much time playing it under the pretense of testing the game mechanics.Potato Pirates brings teachers and students, parents and kids, friends and strangers together to learn abstract computational thinking concepts from one another in a simpler, better, and more visual manner.Join our swash-buckling movement to make the love for and learning of programming universal!

story:
Hi all,

Welcome! This campaign is an extension of our recent FIRST-EVER crowdfunding campaign. We owe so much to our backers, so while production of the miniatures has yet to begin, we are still taking orders to anyone that is interested. All rewards for this campaign can be found below. 

-Ryan and Wildspire Team

 

Wildspire Heroic Townsfolk - 28mm Miniatures  

 The Heroic Townsfolk are a set of 18 unique, diverse, multi-race, character-rich townsfolk. The name "Heroic" distinguishes these from generic townsfolk.  Each of the 18 Heroic Townsfolk are worthy of building deep storylines around and many can be played as player-characters or non-player characters (NPC). They can become the heroes (or villains), too. Either way, they are able to help carry stories. Diverse races, genders and occupations that are not the normal "filler" peasants too often seen around town. 

Special Thanks!

All designs are by the legendary and prolific 3D designer, Miguel Zavala.  Miguel has a Patreon account, mz4250, where he interacts with fans and even will produce designs per request. I encourage all of you to support him. His work will no doubt live on for many, many years to come, and I am happy to be able to spread his designs through this set of miniatures.  ( https://www.patreon.com/mz4250/posts) 

 

   All pledges that include the "Core Set" contain the following 18 Heroic Townsfolk high-quality plastic miniatures.  

The Core Set : Set of 18 Heroic Townsfolk

 

Bonus Content! 

All backers of the Core Sets will also receive the following bonus content:

 

BONUS Illustrations of each Townsfolk by ArtLovesPaper

Each of the above 18 Townsfolk character Sheets will include an original portrait. For this, we commissioned our friend and much-respected fellow creator, ArtLovesPaper (find her Etsy here) . She specializes in fantasy art, especially for roleplaying games like Dungeons and Dragons. Below are examples of her art.

 

 The Core Set of 18 high-quality plastic miniatures are made per 28mm scale are suitable for Dungeons and Dragons, Pathfinder and other tabletop fantasy role-playing games.    

  

 These Miniatures all come unpainted and are made from high-quality PVC plastic. They will be injection-molded to ensure the highest possible detail.  

 

 

Why do you call them "Heroic"?

I use the term "Heroic" to illustrate the fact that, compared to most other townsfolk miniatures, these Heroic Townsfolk are brimming with personality and hint that a tale or two lies just beneath the surface. With enough depth to take the role as heroes (or villains), they help build memorable stories. In diverse races, genders and occupations, the Heroic Townsfolk are the antithesis of the generic, anonymous peasants too often seen around town.    

  These Heroic Townsfolk help to color and flesh out the truly engaging characters we all strive to create. Less bland human peasants, and more excitingly unique characters from varied backgrounds.     

    

Story telling in RPGs strives to be memorable and moving. We need unique characters that can support these stories. So, I am excited to present this set of diverse races and genders, highly-unique, and AFFORDABLE minis. I hope you are excited about them as I am.      

  

 

 

3D-Printed Prototypes 

In preparation for mass production and to ensure feasibility of the designs, I have 3D printed all 18 designs. The detail is superb compared to the original 3D designs.      

 

How are the minis so affordable? 

We have NOT in any way sacrificed quality to make these more affordable. You can expect the same or better quality than you are accustomed to in miniatures.  The more people that play with my miniatures and get excited about them, the more I feel like I've accomplished my goal. We want to provide these to broadest community possible and make a name for ourselves. Sure, a lower price means that it will take longer to reach profitability, but I am confident in my product in the long-run.     

 

  

Driven by my passion for all things fantasy, I set out to create a range of fantasy miniatures that are under-represented and fill a need in the community. The tabletop RPG gaming community has so far been amazing to me, and I want anything I create to be something they really get excited about.     

 I created WildSpire Miniatures as the vehicle for this dream of bringing truly unique miniatures to the community.  No miniature I produce will be just filler on a map or decoration, but will exist to spark curiosity, intrigue and richer story-telling. Many of these Heroic Townsfolk characters are unique characters and can be played as both player-characters or non-player characters.  

 

Special Thanks 

Sculpt Designs: All designs are by the legendary and prolific 3D designer, Miguel Zavala.  Miguel has a Patreon account, mz4250, where he interacts with fans and even will produce designs per request. I encourage all of you to support him. His work will no doubt live on for many, many years to come, and I am happy to be able to spread his designs through this set of miniatures.  ( https://www.patreon.com/mz4250/posts)

Music: Deep Woods by Peritune.

 

Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

 

Risks and challenges

Production and Fulfillment

Non-completion

Prior to this project, I have lived and worked in China for over 12 years. During part of this time I began designing, sourcing and fulfilling products to the USA market. Therefore, I am experienced in dealing with the manufacturers, managing production quality, deadlines, and the overall logistics of packing and shipping physical products. I also plan to visit China and the factory in order to be hands-on during the crucial steps of quality inspection and preparation before shipping.

Of course, there are still forces that could cause he non-completion of this campaign, including: loss of cargo during shipping, due to natural or man-made disasters. However, the products will be fully insured against loss and damage.

Delays

Delays in production or shipping could be caused by the aforementioned natural and man-made disasters, or by US Customs and Border Protection and Consumer Product Safety Commission inspections and delays. We will of course make every precaution necessary to avoid any delay and will always update our backers as soon as possible.

We reserve the right to modify pieces shown to meet production requirements.
