story:
At the beginning of time, there was the Island. It existed in balance with all things. One by one Mythical Beings arose from the depths, created from one of the four Elements of Fire, Air, Earth or Water. The Mythical Beings prospered, in harmony with the Elements and each other. After eons, the Elements themselves became restless and chaotic, breaking the fine balance of the Island as each Element tried to conquer the others.  The Mythical Beings were forced into hiding and elemental chaos reigned.

The very essence of the Island struggled against this violent chaos and as the Elements destroyed more and more of the Island and each other, it summoned its ancient power. In doing so the four Protectors were created to restore the balance of the Elements, so that chaos could never return. Their task was to calm and rearrange the Elements, enabling the Mythical Beings to return to Island and restoring the balance of all things. Each Protector was also tasked with becoming the lord of its Element and in the end only the most successful Elemental lord could become the ultimate Guardian of the Island.

 

Mythical Island is a quick, compact and surprisingly strategic tile laying game for 2 – 4 players, age 8 and older. Through out the game, players draw Mythical cards that show a certain landscape pattern.

Players’ aim is to arrange the Landscape tiles so they match the pattern and element shown on the Mythical card. Then players need to move their pawn on this pattern to activate the Mythical card, the points gained will be received at the end of the game.

The game ends when any player activates a certain number of Mythical beings, according to number of players.

GAME OVERVIEW

All Mythical Beings in the game are based on Icelandic & Nordic folklore. Descriptions and stories of each Being can be found in the separate Mythiopedia booklet. We also included some other information about the landscape, Northern Lights and other components, so it also has educational merit.

We were using a lot of sources to be able to find Mythical beings, Protectors and their stories related to all 4 elements - water, air, earth and fire. Before we started the main game development, we did a lot of background research to make sure that the information we are mentioning are as correct as possible, but as these are based on various stories one can never be absolutely sure.

Four of the Protectors are the legendary Protectors of Iceland (Vaettir) as seen on Iceland’s Coat of Arms. On the other side of each of the player tiles is another known legendary creature, from the folklore or the Viking sagas.

"Surprisingly strategic! It reminds me of Tetris! I actually like it!”
Computer game player, not so found of board games, Iceland

"Not as simple as it seems. You actually have to consider what you are doing so the other player might not benefit more than you from it. Love the different abilities. A great filler game!”
Experienced board game player, Iceland

“This is really interesting! I think this is actually the first game we have ever finished and we want to play again for sure! It is also quick!”
Couple from Spain not used to play board games

“We played the game with the kids and they love the pictures on the cards! I think it is really cool that there are so many variants how to play the game and adjust that also for kids! They actually could not wait to do their next "Master Move" while playing! ”
Mother of 8 and 11 years old kids from Iceland

“We love Iceland and Nordic mythology and this is really fun for us even if we are not used to play games, because there is a lot of very interesting information included!”
Couple from The Czech republic, Icelandic and Nordic Mythology enthusiasts

We are 2 friends, Monika, a Czech living in Iceland and Svavar, an Icelandic board game designer with pure roots to the first Icelandic Viking settlers. Our story began in March 2018, when Monika moved to Iceland and met me at work. But the story of Mythical Island began even earlier, in June 2016 when Monika came to Iceland for the first time. She came back several times as she had already fallen in love with the country. She wanted to buy some souvenir and because she likes board games, she was looking for some games with Icelandic folktales theme, but she wasn't successful. 

And then, one day in May 2018 we were talking in the office and found out that we were both familiar with the motto “Life is a game, never stop playing!“. I had already his head full of clear game concept ideas, but lacking the theme on many of them. Inspired by that, we thought it could be a very interesting project to join Monika´s love to Iceland and my love for board games. So we started to work on this idea where stories and Icelandic heritage could be combined into something that could be interesting for both visitors coming to Iceland as well as some informative game for board game lovers. One of the game ideas that I had and was lacking theme for seemed to be perfect for this task, so work on Mythical Island begun in September 2018. We immediately started to dig into all the books and media we could find related to Icelandic mythical beings and folk stories, but soon we found out that many of the stories actually had the same origins. In order to spice up the mix and add more flavor to the game, beings from Nordic Mythology were added to the concept.

It hasn't always been an easy journey, for example when we lost all the game documentation because both the PC and backup disk crashed within a few days apart, or when we lost our brand-new built web page due to a different backup failure. But we never gave up and thanks to our will and strong belief in the game, the game is getting to the final stages. We have done several prototypes and tested them with different groups. Then we made improvements just to test it again to find out that the improvements needed some improvement. Sure, sometimes a frustrating process, but extremely rewarding and fun.

In order to get over the final threshold, we would need some support to fund the production of Mythical Island. We are doing the game in our spare time as we both have other full time job. If you would like to support Mythical Island in seeing the light of the day, kindly participate in Mythical Island’s Indiegogo campaign. Thank you!

The above are estimates for the shipping costs per region. The costs are for the copies shown. Please, keep in mind that these costs may rise depending on the evolution of the campaign (unlocked stretch goals which will increase the weight of the parcel), and due to industry-wide fluctuations in shipping costs between now and the time of fulfillment. We are using companies from the US and UK for shipping.

Note that the Icelandic games bundle is shipped from Iceland and will take slightly longer time, as we first have to wait for Mythical Island to get to us before sending it out.

We aim to offer the game as a Pick Up at Essen option, but we have to see the manufacturing and delivery schedule before we can offer that.

Backers in Iceland do not add any freight cost as long as they can pick up the game in Nexus store, Glæsibæ in Reykjavík OR in SPILAVINIR store. If that is not possible, we will be in touch with you to arrange local freight via the postal service. 

There are not so many direct risk factors involved in our project. The design for Mythical Island is 98% complete and ready to be sent to print. The graphic design shown here may change slightly in the final version of the game. We will need a small amount of time for preparing the game for print and manage some potential stretch goals.  We will be ready to proceed with production soon after the Kickstarter ends. 

We aim to send the game out to backers in October, the time they will receive the game depends on the carrier service in each given area. We aim to offer the game as a Pick Up in Essen option, but we have to see the manufacturing and delivery schedule before we can offer that.

The estimated delivery time has been set as a 'reasonable' scenario, in case something should happen. If we can deliver the games early to our backers (and we hope we can), it will be a bonus.

The people behind the game have developed and published 4 board games since 2009, one of them Bardagi - The Claim for Gold was successfully funded trough Kickstarter within 24 hours in 2015, ending in 200% of the initial goal. 

For the past months, we have been working with our manufacturer to ensure that you will receive a high quality game. Everyone who has tested our prototypes has helped us make the game good and playable. We are confident that you will be pleased with the final version of the game.

The biggest risks to this project are the things beyond our control: Production and shipping delays.

story:
Sly Foxes is a super fun and highly strategic card game in which you have to outsmart the other players… ughm… I mean foxes! 

You can do that with the help of a hedgehog hug, nosy weasels, pouring vodka instead of water, giving long-forgotten cookies and many more!  

We don't have unicorns, explosions or kittens, but if you're into foxes, turtles, NINJA-DEER, rabbits, squirrels and other cute animals, then try this game! 

Game mechanics: take that, player elimination, hand management, partnerships 

Tags: #fun #strategic #casual #social #family 

Currently available in English and Bulgarian

 

Who is it for? 

Sly Foxes is suitable for:  

  • Grown-ups and kids aged 8+ 
  • 2 to 6 players (8 players with expansion) 
  • Solo players 
  • Team players 
  • Fox lovers <3
  • Funny jokes fans 
  • Birthday present 
  • Beginner/intermediate players 
  • Board game fans (with expansion) 
  • Both right-handed and left-handed people* 

* we made sure the cards are ambidextrous. 

 

How to play 

The cards get separated into 2 decks - attack and defence cards. There are special cards too, like ‘I don't care’ which protects you against attacks and nosey weasels, who in turn interfere during other players' turns. In the beginning each player has 3 lives, gets 3 cards from each deck and a secret character that helps them in certain situations.  

When it's your turn you either draw a card or attack a player of your choice. The player who eliminates everyone else wins the game and gets proclaimed the slyest fox in the woods. You can also play the game in teams and this makes it even more fun! 

In the video below you can find out how to play the base version of the game. Note that this doesn't include team play version or the expansion.

 

What’s included in the base version 

  • 8 types of cards 
  • 82 unique cards creating a fun dialogue 
  • 6 secret characters (2 types) 
  • 32 life tokens 
  • Rule book 
  • Set of stickers (stretch goal) 

Indiegogo exclusive version 

With this version you get the expansion pack which rises the strategy level and makes the game more dynamic and fun. It includes: 

  • Everything from the base version 
  • 4 NEW types of cards 
  • 16 NEW unique illustrations 
  • 4 secret characters (2 NEW types) 
  • Set of stickers 
  • Expansion rules 
  • Small bag to easily carry around the game (stretch goal) 

 

Which version should I get? 

If you don’t play that many board games, then probably you should get the base version. 

If you’re a board games fan OR you’re already fascinated by the game, then get the exclusive version with the expansion pack!  

 

What people say about Sly Foxes

Read more reviews on our Facebook page >

 

The story 

How it all began... 

We all want to be treated nicely. And we do treat others the way we want to be treated. But... when we play board games together, it's a different story... often our competitive side takes over and stands in full glory of the spotlight. You try to outsmart and beat the rest of the gang with sneaky tactics and strategy. That's what inspired us to create Sly Foxes - this wonderfully devious dynamic that results from playing games with friends.   

You know that moment when you have an idea and think about it while brushing your teeth? Then you rush to find a notebook and write it down before it vanishes. 

After many scribbles, notes and calculations (because inventing a game often includes a lot of combinations) we started slowly materialising the game by cutting cardboard and playing with the cards all by ourselves. 

Then came the time to create the first prototype and the moment of truth - play the game with real people. After watching initial reactions and listening to feedback you iterate and then iterate again. Feedback was more than great and that gave us enthusiasm and energy to continue working on Sly Foxes. 

Now we have real high-quality cards and you almost can’t see the difference between the unfinished product and an all polished tabletop game. It’s exciting to watch how people have fun while playing and how the idea is slowly coming to life. 

 

Why support Sly Foxes? 

We love board games because they help us get together and connect. They also improve our logical thinking and social skills. That is why we wanted to create a board game that is fun and strategic at the same time. We have already played the game with more than 300 people from 6 countries. They’ve described the game as fun, fresh, creating a good mood, interesting, tactical, dynamic and even surprising. 

The great feedback and overall reception made us want to make the game affordable, but at the same time ensure it’s high quality and make it available to a wide audience. In order to do that we need your help! 

To help us achieve our goal, please support our crowdfunding campaign, follow us on social media and share the game with your friends! 

 

We are eco-conscious 

We are proud to say that the cards are printed on recycled paper.  

We’ll also reduce the CO2 emissions by printing the game in the same city from where we’ll be shipping it, in Plovdiv – European Capital of Culture 2019. This is the home town of the creator of Sly Foxes.  

 

About the game designer 

Hi, I’m Lazar Bosakov (a.k.a. Laz), a designer with many years of experience. In my current job I design products and test them with real people to make sure they are useful, intuitive and serve the needs of real human beings. This experience helped me create a game that is already loved by many people.   

 

Stretch goals 

Sly Foxes has a lot of wording so it requires a lot of work and research by professional translators. Following our mission to make the game available in more languages we’re committed to localize Sly Foxes in German if we gather more than €15000. 

If we get more than €30000 then we’ll consider translating into another language. The 4th language will be determined once we run a survey. 

 

Risks and challenges 

We’ve already negotiated printing and delivery so there shouldn’t be significant delays. We’ll use your contributions to financially support the production. We have an ambitious goal to start shipping Sly Foxes in December. However we've selected February as estimated shipping date in order to avoid any unexpected delays.

story:
This is a game about the world ending, but...

WE MADE IT BEFORE THE WORLD ACTUALLY STARTED TO END.

So, please don't be mad at us.

It's not our fault that we created a FLAME•INGO that can burn through a FORCE FIELD, or a camouflaged CAMO (camel) that can disappear from a HUNT. Actually, that is our fault. But still, we all need something that we can laugh about right now, and DOOM ON YOU can help.

Even if that means that a river of lava floods your neighborhood.

As far as we know, that isn't a current event for most people;* but, in the game, it's probably going to happen to you. Plus, you might also get hit by a meteorite, or struck by lightning, or swept away by a tsunami. But,

SINCE IT'S JUST A GAME, IT'S OKAY!

At least, we think it is...

*Note: If lava destroys your home, we'll probably give you a discount on your purchase.

SO, SAVE THE PANDAS ALREADY AND BUY THIS GAME

Actually, the pandas die in the game...BUT STILL, you should buy it.

WHY?

Because we're a small business that just wants to bring laughter and fun to kids and adults everywhere. We hope that our games help make the world a better place. That's right...

We don't actually wish for doom on you or the planet.

See? You can tell that we want world peace because we're smiling.

So, please, wash your hands, cough into your elbow, and back our campaign.

We'll then get our game printed and sent your way!

SETUP

Each player draws cards and receives food tokens at setup. After that, the game alternates between PREP ROUNDS and ATTACK ROUNDS until only one player has food.

In the PREP ROUND, you draw cards and get your animals ready for battle. In the ATTACK ROUND, players take turns being attacked; so, on your turn, all of the other players will choose whether or not to attack you (and your face up animals).

HOW TO BATTLE AND STEAL FOOD TOKENS 

Each animal has different abilities. A KLAW•LA, for example, can battle/kill 2 animals and defend against 1 animal. If the KLAW•LA is successful in its attack (i.e., if it is not blocked/killed by an animal card or a battle card), it gets to steal 1 food token.

BUT, being successful in an attack is not always easy. You never know if your opponent has a battle card - like a DEFLECT or a CAPTURE - in their hand. Your "brilliant" attack might actually backfire.

And, some animals have additional special powers. Your CAMO, for example, disappears from a HUNT (and can't be killed by that card). And, your FLAME•INGO burns through a FORCE FIELD (which otherwise blocks all animal attacks).

TO WIN

You will need strategy, bribery, and a little bit of luck to survive and be the last player with food. Hopefully you can steal enough food and avoid the natural disasters. If not...DOOM ON YOU!
story_txt: This is a game about the world ending, but...WE MADE IT BEFORE THE WORLD ACTUALLY STARTED TO END.So, please don't be mad at us.It's not our fault that we created a FLAME•INGO that can burn through a FORCE FIELD, or a camouflaged CAMO (camel) that can disappear from a HUNT. Actually, that is our fault. But still, we all need something that we can laugh about right now, and DOOM ON YOU can help.Even if that means that a river of lava floods your neighborhood.As far as we know, that isn't a current event for most people;* but, in the game, it's probably going to happen to you. Plus, you might also get hit by a meteorite, or struck by lightning, or swept away by a tsunami. But,SINCE IT'S JUST A GAME, IT'S OKAY!At least, we think it is...*Note: If lava destroys your home, we'll probably give you a discount on your purchase.SO, SAVE THE PANDAS ALREADY AND BUY THIS GAMEActually, the pandas die in the game...BUT STILL, you should buy it.WHY?Because we're a small business that just wants to bring laughter and fun to kids and adults everywhere. We hope that our games help make the world a better place. That's right...We don't actually wish for doom on you or the planet.See? You can tell that we want world peace because we're smiling.So, please, wash your hands, cough into your elbow, and back our campaign.We'll then get our game printed and sent your way!SETUPEach player draws cards and receives food tokens at setup. After that, the game alternates between PREP ROUNDS and ATTACK ROUNDS until only one player has food.In the PREP ROUND, you draw cards and get your animals ready for battle. In the ATTACK ROUND, players take turns being attacked; so, on your turn, all of the other players will choose whether or not to attack you (and your face up animals).HOW TO BATTLE AND STEAL FOOD TOKENS Each animal has different abilities. A KLAW•LA, for example, can battle/kill 2 animals and defend against 1 animal. If the KLAW•LA is successful in its attack (i.e., if it is not blocked/killed by an animal card or a battle card), it gets to steal 1 food token.BUT, being successful in an attack is not always easy. You never know if your opponent has a battle card - like a DEFLECT or a CAPTURE - in their hand. Your "brilliant" attack might actually backfire.And, some animals have additional special powers. Your CAMO, for example, disappears from a HUNT (and can't be killed by that card). And, your FLAME•INGO burns through a FORCE FIELD (which otherwise blocks all animal attacks).TO WINYou will need strategy, bribery, and a little bit of luck to survive and be the last player with food. Hopefully you can steal enough food and avoid the natural disasters. If not...DOOM ON YOU!

story:
In an ancient age, many galaxies away…

The universe is in collapse, as planets and systems struggle for freedom under the rule of sinister despots. Against the malevolent sorcery of the Overlords, stand the few remaining bearers of the legendary Solar Blades.

What will you do when the forces of the Void close in?

 

Solar Blades & Cosmic Spells is a complete Role Playing Game, inspired by the Old School Renaissance, the Pulp Literature and the many Science Fantasy stories brought to us by movies, comics and games. Based on the Sharp Swords & Sinister Spells RPG, this game system provides players and Overlords (that's how we call the GM in this game) a set of flexible and streamlined rules, as well as an array of tools to make gameplay fast and fun, allowing them to have exciting adventures with solar blades and cosmic spells!

The game itself is already written and could be published as is, but I want it to be better. This campaign will help funding the costs of editing, proofreading and will pay for artwork. So the more money it collects, the more money will go towards making the text better and towards filling more and more pages with awesome and inspiring art!

 

But What is Solar Blades & Cosmic Spells?

 

Standard Cover by Bruno Prosaiko

 

Solar Blades & Cosmic Spells is a Rules Light, Star & Sorcery, Role Playing Game with an Old School spirit. But what does this really means?

 

It's Rules Light

 

This means the game has only the essential rules to play, avoiding subsystems to detail every aspect of gameplay, preferring general rules and a referee's rulings to govern the almost endless possibilities. The system has only a few different mechanics, and once those have been mastered, the need to consult the book for rules clarification will hardly come up during play, allowing for a more fluid and exciting game. Essentially, you can learn and teach all that you need to play in a single session.

 

It's Star & Sorcery

 

It’s science fiction, it’s fantasy, it’s space opera, it’s sword and sorcery, it’s post-apocalyptic. It’s all that and more, mixed up and packed together. In this game the party can be composed of knights of a mystical tradition, space pilots, cyber hackers, smugglers running from space authorities, barbarians from a primitive world, engineers and inventors, students of the lost and dangerous art of cosmic spells, or anything in between all this. In this universe, technology is advanced but the great accomplishments of it were lost in a glorious past. Sorcery is real and is wielded by terrible despots. It is also feared by most of the species, being the main reason why the old glorious days are over. Planets and sectors have many different cultures, most of them are now divisive and belligerent, led by these Sorcerer-Emperors. It’s sword and sorcery in space and with some cosmic horror thrown in.

It’s a Role Playing Game

 

In this type of game, participants work together to create and experience a tale of adventure. One of them, called the Overlord, creates a setting with different characters (each with its goals), interesting locations and a set of events about to unfold, usually instigating the other participants to take some action relating to them (opposing it, taking advantage of it, helping it reach its end or even ignoring it in favor of something else). This group, called the Players, creates fictional characters inspired by the Overlord's setting and the fiction they love, and makes the decisions for them. They decide what their characters say and do according to the descriptions of the Overlord. In turn, based on their actions, the rules of the game, and their own judgement, the Overlord describes what happens afterward, instigating the players to take further action, renewing the cycle. Through these interactions, both the Overlord and the players create a tale of adventure together, without any of them really knowing what will actually happen in the end.

 

It has and Old School Spirit

 

Although not directly related to an old game, Solar Blades & Cosmic Spells was designed to be played with the same spirit and style. All the principles of the classic A Quick Primer for Old School Gaming by Matt Finch apply to this game (and if you don't know about A Quick Primer for Old School Gaming, you should google it), although this is not a proper Retroclone. It does take inspirations and is based on many games that are (and some that are not), and other actual Old School games. However, to avoid the controversy of calling itself an Old School Game, Solar Blades & Cosmic Spells calls itself a game with Old School Spirit. But what does that really mean, you ask?

First of all, it relies on the Overlord to make judgement calls for how, when and why rules apply (or don't). This is called rulings over rules, and implies that the system has an abstract set of rules to resolve situations and it's up to the Overlord to determine how those rules apply on each situation, or to come up with a solution based on them when needed. Additionally, this game focus on player skill rather than on character skills and powers. The system is very simple and abstract, providing players with characters with a few iconic abilities and very broad statistics. How to use them to create solutions to the challenges the Overlord comes up with will depend solely on them. Social and intellectual challenges rely mostly on the players' ingenuity than on the roll of the dice.

Also, according to the Old School sensibilities, characters can be heroes, but they risk a lot doing so. It's something they can achieve, but it's not something they can do easily with little concern to their safety. The rules make sure the characters are a little more capable than the average person, but they are not superheroes, capable of facing entire battalions by themselves.

Finally, the game system ignores the modern concept of game balance and “appropriate encounters”, preferring the approach of setting consistency and challenging gameplay. In this way, there might appear obstacles during the game in which players’ characters have no way of resolving. Their better strategy could very well be to run, as well as to negotiate or simply to avoid it completely. That’s the Old School way.

 

 

The Book

 

The book has approximately 168.000 words, which accrue to about 370 pages of text. We estimate that the final product will have around 500 pages, with a lot of black and white illustrations. The book will have enough material to keep a group entertained for years.

 

Why Crowdfunding?

 

My first game, Sharp Swords & Sinister Spells (on which Solar Blades & Cosmic Spells is based), was written with only the most essential rules and tools to allow gameplay. It didn't provide examples of how rules would be applied, nor a setting for the game. In the end, it had only 48 pages, with a lot of illustrations that were either released and Royalty Free images, or images made by me or some of my friends.

With Solar Blades & Cosmic Spells, however, I wanted to provide a game with everything you need to play, and to learn how to play. Even though the game system is a revised version of the one used on SS&SS (with some additions, like Sanity rules, vehicle combat, more spells, and other optional rules), this time the text comes with examples to clarify how the rules are applied and how the Overlord can use their judgment. We even have a complete example of play in the Appendixes!

But that is not all. The game comes with an implied setting and a toolbox to create this setting as you play the game. The book is full of tools to help players and Overlords to generate game elements, such as locations, NPCs, monsters and adventure hooks.

Thus, the book will be bigger (around 450 to 500 pages), and will require a lot of work from editors, proofreaders and artists, and I want to pay them for their effort. I want the book to be as good as it can be. And I need your help to do that.

 

The Costs

 

There are many costs involved in the production of a RPG Book, and in order to make this the best book it can be, we are asking for your help and contribution.

  • Cover Art (two covers): $ 350.00
  • Logo Design: $ 100.00
  • Editing and Proofreading: $ 1,000.00 (Initially, as they will be paid more if we hit stretch goals)
  • Interior Artwork: $ 800.00 (Initially, as we will be buying and commissioning more art as we hit stretch goals).
  • IndieGoGo and Credit Card fees will accrue on about 8% of total funding (plus 25 dollars from raising money in dollars to deposit in a Brazilian bank).

The book will be produced by Print on Demand, and contributors will either receive a PDF or a PDF + Print at Cost Coupon to print the book over DrivethruRPG. So there is no costs associated with printing and shipping the book.

 

 

What Do You Get By Pledging?

 

There are many options to choose from, allowing you to simply get your name on the book as a contributor and a PDF, to a level where you can get coupons for the Standard and Limited Edition Hardcovers and a piece of original artwork made by me. All contributors also get immediate access to the book's draft text (see the first Update of the campaign).

Space Traveler - US$ 10.00

This pledge level gives you the complete PDF of Solar Blades & Cosmic Spells, with all the rules and tools to play the game.

Space Adventurer - US$ 15.00

This pledge level gives you the complete PDF of Solar Blades & Cosmic Spells, with all the rules and tools to play the game; and a Print at Cost coupon to use at DrivethruRPG for the Softcover version (print cost estimated at US$16.09)

Space Knight - US$ 20.00

This pledge level gives you the complete PDF of Solar Blades & Cosmic Spells, with all the rules and tools to play the game; and a Print at Cost coupon to use at DrivethruRPG for the Standard Hardcover version (print cost estimated at US$ 21.70).

Space Sorcerer - US$ 25.00

This pledge level gives you the complete PDF of Solar Blades & Cosmic Spells, with all the rules and tools to play the game; and a Print at Cost coupon to use at DrivethruRPG for the Limited Edition Hardcover version (print cost estimated at US$ 21.70). The Limited Edition Hardcover version has an exclusive cover that will be available only through this IndieGoGo campaign and will not go on sale after it's done.

Limited Edition Cover by Dan Ramos

 

Cosmic Beasts - US$ 40.00

This pledge level gives you the complete PDF of Solar Blades & Cosmic Spells, with all the rules and tools to play the game; a Print at Cost coupon to use at DrivethruRPG for the Limited Edition Hardcover version (print cost estimated at US$ 21.70) and a Print at Cost coupon to use at DrivethruRPG for the Standard Hardcover version (print cost estimated at US$ 21.70), saving you 5 dollars of total cost. The Limited Edition Hardcover version has an exclusive cover that will be available only through this IndieGoGo campaign and will not go on sale after it's done.

Galactic Overlord - US$ 150.00

This pledge level gives you the complete PDF of Solar Blades & Cosmic Spells, with all the rules and tools to play the game; a Print at Cost coupon to use at DrivethruRPG for the Softcover version (print cost estimated at 16.09); a Print at Cost coupon to use at DrivethruRPG for the Limited Edition Hardcover version (print cost estimated at US$ 21.70); and a Print at Cost coupon to use at DrivethruRPG for the Standard Hardcover version (print cost estimated at US$ 21.70). The Limited Edition Hardcover version has an exclusive cover that will be available only through this IndieGoGo campaign and will not go on sale after it's done.

Additionally, the contributor will receive an original piece of artwork made by the author for one of the full page illustrations created for the book. This will be mailed directly to them through mail. The artwork will be black and white, made with ink on paper, roughly the size of a single sheet of 6x9 inches paper.

 

Citizen of the Ghost Sector (Exclusive for people in Brazil) - US$ 45.00

This pledge level is available exclusively for those that live in Brazil (as I do). Contributors will receive the complete PDF of Solar Blades & Cosmic Spells, with all the rules and tools to play the game; and a Softcover copy of the book shipped directly to them with no extra shipping costs.

Lord of the Ghost Sector (Exclusive for people in Brazil) - US$ 55.00

This pledge level is available exclusively for those that live in Brazil (as I do). Contributors will receive the complete PDF of Solar Blades & Cosmic Spells, with all the rules and tools to play the game; and a Standard Hardcover copy of the book shipped directly to them with no extra shipping costs.

Emperor the Ghost Sector (Exclusive for people in Brazil) - US$ 60.00

This pledge level is available exclusively for those that live in Brazil (as I do). Contributors will receive the complete PDF of Solar Blades & Cosmic Spells, with all the rules and tools to play the game; and a Limited Edition Hardcover copy of the book shipped directly to them with no extra shipping costs.

 

 

Fulfilled by DriveThruRPG

 

This project will be fulfilled through DriveThruRPG platform. PDFs will be sent as a coupon to add them freely to each contributors account. Contributors who pledge for print copies will receive a coupon to print their books at cost at DriveThruRPG website. The "at cost" estimate prices are indicated in the descriptions of the pledges above. It's important to notice that contributors will also have to pay for shipping.

For those of you that are in Brazil, I decided to make your lives easier. If you pledge at either the Citizen of the Ghost Sector or the Lord of the Ghost Sector pledge levels, I will order the books myself and ship them directly to you once it arrives in Brazil. This way I can order multiple copies at once, saving on international shipping costs.

 

Stretch Goals

 

As previously explained, the initial funding goal will help pay for editing, proofreading and a small quantity of artwork pieces. If we manage to have a bigger support and more people contribute to the campaign, all the funds will go towards paying those working on the book more money, and to purchase more artwork.

US$ 2,000.00 - Initial funding goal. - ACHIEVED

US$ 3,000.00 - Pay our editor and proofreader more and commission more artwork pieces. - ACHIEVED

US$ 4,000.00 - Pay our editor and proofreader more and commission even more artwork pieces. - ACHIEVED

US$ 5,000.00 - Pay our editor and proofreader the amount they deserve, and we will commission 5 pages of comics to use as an introduction for the game. - ACHIEVED

If, somehow, we actually get more pledges accruing more than US$ 5,000.00, we will work something out, commissioning more artwork, making a art free version of the book available for free, designing archetype specific character sheets or something else that won't delay the production of the actual book.

 

But what will we do after that? How about two new Stretch Goals?

 

US$ 6,500 - We will get even more illustrations commissioned and will make a Reference Booklet with just the rules of the game. This will make looking up rules and results of tables easier and faster. Every backer will get it in PDF, and every backer of print copies will get a coupon to print it “at cost” too. Backers from Brazil who got any of the pledges from the “Ghost Sector” can add 10 dollars if they want the Reference Booklet printed and sent to them too. The delivery date of the Reference Booklet will be a few months after the core book, so around March 2019. That’s just to be safe. - ACHIEVED

 

US$ 7,000 - Andre Novoa, author of The Squid, The Cabal, and The Old Man for Lamentations of the Flame Princess, will write an Adventure Module for SB&CS. All backers will receive a PDF of the adventure, and the ones who are getting print coupons will also receive a “print at cost” coupon for the adventure. Brazilian backers will have the option to pay a little more to receive the adventure with the corebook (but that may delay the delivery of it). The module will be published separately from the Core Book not to delay its release. - ACHIEVED

 

US$ 8,000 - More Illustrations commissioned! Additionally we will make an art free version of the book’s PDF! This way we can make the game more accessible and you can send the art free PDF to players and friends so they can read it and get ready for the game! It will be completely free! - So Close! WTH... ACHIEVED

I have a few more surprises in store for you guys! Let's see if we can make them happen!

 

Risks and Challenges

 

 

Crowdfunding seems a lot more risky than simply buying a ready made book, right? But this also allows creators to make the final product much better than if they just used the funds they have at hand. My first RPG, Sharp Swords & Sinister Spells (and it's Addendum) were published without a crowdfunding campaign. Booth of them had less than 100 pages and could count on a large amount of royalty free or accessible stock art supply.

Solar Blades & Cosmic Spells, however, is a science fantasy RPG with some very specific influences. Finding stock art appropriate to the feeling of the book isn't an easy task. That's why this crowdfunding campaign is important.

All in all, the risk is minimum, since the text is already done and all that we will need to do after the campaign ends is to get the awesome artwork our artists will produce and put it into the book itself, with a clean and easy to read design.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

In addition to contributing money to the campaign, you can help the project by sharing the campaign's URL on social media, telling your friends about the project and playing the game in your local game stores and conventions. The more people know about the project, the better chances we get at producing an even better product in the end! Everyone wins!

Grab your solar blade, ready your cosmic spells and spread the word!

 

Artist Credits

 

In this campaign we used the artwork of the following artists: Bruno Prosaiko, Diogo Nogueira, Dan Ramos, Jeshields, Maciej Zagorski (The Forge Studios), Lucas Bigorenski, Bradley K. McDevitt.

Citizen of the Ghost Sector (Exclusive for people in Brazil) - US$ 45.00
This pledge level is available exclusively for those that live in Brazil (as I do). Contributors will receive the complete PDF of Solar Blades & Cosmic Spells, with all the rules and tools to play the game; and a Softcover copy of the book shipped directly to them with no extra shipping costs.
Lord of the Ghost Sector (Exclusive for people in Brazil) - US$ 55.00
This pledge level is available exclusively for those that live in Brazil (as I do). Contributors will receive the complete PDF of Solar Blades & Cosmic Spells, with all the rules and tools to play the game; and a Standard Hardcover copy of the book shipped directly to them with no extra shipping costs.
Emperor the Ghost Sector (Exclusive for people in Brazil) - US$ 60.00
This pledge level is available exclusively for those that live in Brazil (as I do). Contributors will receive the complete PDF of Solar Blades & Cosmic Spells, with all the rules and tools to play the game; and a Limited Edition Hardcover copy of the book shipped directly to them with no extra shipping costs.
 

 
Fulfilled by DriveThruRPG
 
This project will be fulfilled through DriveThruRPG platform. PDFs will be sent as a coupon to add them freely to each contributors account. Contributors who pledge for print copies will receive a coupon to print their books at cost at DriveThruRPG website. The "at cost" estimate prices are indicated in the descriptions of the pledges above. It's important to notice that contributors will also have to pay for shipping.
For those of you that are in Brazil, I decided to make your lives easier. If you pledge at either the Citizen of the Ghost Sector or the Lord of the Ghost Sector pledge levels, I will order the books myself and ship them directly to you once it arrives in Brazil. This way I can order multiple copies at once, saving on international shipping costs.

 
Stretch Goals
 
As previously explained, the initial funding goal will help pay for editing, proofreading and a small quantity of artwork pieces. If we manage to have a bigger support and more people contribute to the campaign, all the funds will go towards paying those working on the book more money, and to purchase more artwork.
US$ 2,000.00 - Initial funding goal. - ACHIEVED
US$ 3,000.00 - Pay our editor and proofreader more and commission more artwork pieces. - ACHIEVED
US$ 4,000.00 - Pay our editor and proofreader more and commission even more artwork pieces. - ACHIEVED
US$ 5,000.00 - Pay our editor and proofreader the amount they deserve, and we will commission 5 pages of comics to use as an introduction for the game. - ACHIEVED
If, somehow, we actually get more pledges accruing more than US$ 5,000.00, we will work something out, commissioning more artwork, making a art free version of the book available for free, designing archetype specific character sheets or something else that won't delay the production of the actual book.
 
But what will we do after that? How about two new Stretch Goals?
 
US$ 6,500 - We will get even more illustrations commissioned and will make a Reference Booklet with just the rules of the game. This will make looking up rules and results of tables easier and faster. Every backer will get it in PDF, and every backer of print copies will get a coupon to print it “at cost” too. Backers from Brazil who got any of the pledges from the “Ghost Sector” can add 10 dollars if they want the Reference Booklet printed and sent to them too. The delivery date of the Reference Booklet will be a few months after the core book, so around March 2019. That’s just to be safe. - ACHIEVED
 
US$ 7,000 - Andre Novoa, author of The Squid, The Cabal, and The Old Man for Lamentations of the Flame Princess, will write an Adventure Module for SB&CS. All backers will receive a PDF of the adventure, and the ones who are getting print coupons will also receive a “print at cost” coupon for the adventure. Brazilian backers will have the option to pay a little more to receive the adventure with the corebook (but that may delay the delivery of it). The module will be published separately from the Core Book not to delay its release. - ACHIEVED
 
US$ 8,000 - More Illustrations commissioned! Additionally we will make an art free version of the book’s PDF! This way we can make the game more accessible and you can send the art free PDF to players and friends so they can read it and get ready for the game! It will be completely free! - So Close! WTH... ACHIEVEDI have a few more surprises in store for you guys! Let's see if we can make them happen!
 
Risks and Challenges
 

 
Crowdfunding seems a lot more risky than simply buying a ready made book, right? But this also allows creators to make the final product much better than if they just used the funds they have at hand. My first RPG, Sharp Swords & Sinister Spells (and it's Addendum) were published without a crowdfunding campaign. Booth of them had less than 100 pages and could count on a large amount of royalty free or accessible stock art supply.
Solar Blades & Cosmic Spells, however, is a science fantasy RPG with some very specific influences. Finding stock art appropriate to the feeling of the book isn't an easy task. That's why this crowdfunding campaign is important.
All in all, the risk is minimum, since the text is already done and all that we will need to do after the campaign ends is to get the awesome artwork our artists will produce and put it into the book itself, with a clean and easy to read design.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
 
In addition to contributing money to the campaign, you can help the project by sharing the campaign's URL on social media, telling your friends about the project and playing the game in your local game stores and conventions. The more people know about the project, the better chances we get at producing an even better product in the end! Everyone wins!
Grab your solar blade, ready your cosmic spells and spread the word!
 
Artist Credits
 
In this campaign we used the artwork of the following artists: Bruno Prosaiko, Diogo Nogueira, Dan Ramos, Jeshields, Maciej Zagorski (The Forge Studios), Lucas Bigorenski, Bradley K. McDevitt.

story:
French, German and Italian Digital Translations: 

The rulebook will be translated into French, German and Italian and will be available as digital downloads from our website. These digital, translated rulebooks will also have a list of all action cards, restaurants, and any other game components that are necessary for gameplay. Although we will not be printing the translated rulebooks, they will be available as PDFs so you are more than welcome to print them at your convenience 

 

 Thank you to Mark Streed over at Dice Tower for this awesome preview video!

 
 

Full-game playthrough by FunHaus! 

They may not have gotten all the rules right, but they sure had a lot of fun! Fast forward to the 30 minute mark to see where the action really picks up! (Disclaimer: language may not be appropriate for children)

story:
So...

One day we realized all of our dice could no longer fit in our current dice bags and thought "wouldn't it be so cool to have INDG dice bags?" Then we thought that others may feel the same way. A few inquiries later and the community had spoken up in agreement, and asking for patches as well.

Long story short, our community manager can't resist a project so she figured out how to make it happen and voila! This Indiegogo was born.

Perks

  • Dice bags: free-standing when open, cotton fabric, machine washable, fully reversible, drawstring cord to match liner colour, can easily hold over 150 dice.
  • Pin & Pocket dice bags: black vinyl and cotton fabric, free-standing, wipe clean, fully reversible, rainbow drawstring, four pockets on the cotton lining capable of holding IDs, credit cards, minis, or approximately 30 MtG cards (each).
  • Patches: embroidered I Need Diverse Games logo, pin-backing for easy use (and reuse)
  • UNLOCKED!: One custom INDG d6 (various colours, picked at random) will be included with every bag and patch once we hit $600.

Why $2000?

Sadly, because stuff is expensive, y'all. 2000 is the amount that would do the most good, allow us to order enough fabric and patches to continue to create the bags, and help us get pay more for articles, sponsor and attend more conventions, and so many other things. 

Regardless of the amount raised, every order will be fulfilled.

Funding breakdown for dice bags:

  • 42% goes to materials, as long as we sell out of current stock. Custom fabric is more expensive than store bought, even before shipping. For the pin&pocket bags, the mat cost is even higher, as the vinyl is more expensive for the outer layer and it uses twice the amount of the INDG fabric.
  • 8% for Indiegogo and other fees.
  • 50% remaining goes to I Need Diverse Games. Cost of labour and time is waived in favour of generating funds for the charity.

Funding breakdown for patches:

  • 100% goes to manufacturing, shipping, and various fees.

About I Need Diverse Games

We are a nonprofit organisation that is dedicated to bringing awareness to and elevating diversity in gaming. We help underrepresented folks in gaming get to conventions, leverage their voices and games, and foster safe and inclusive spaces for marginalized devs as well as fans. We produce original content, pay contributing writers, speak at conventions, give diversity and inclusion consulting, seek out new ways to connect with the community, and so much more.

Risks & Challenges

As each dice bag is handsewn, it is time-consuming. We are already working on prepping as many bags as possible as to mitigate any unforeseen delays with patch and custom fabric orders, since the patches and dice will be ordered after the campaign ends. We have no control over manufacturing delays nor shipping timeframes, but we will be as transparent as possible as we receive updates.

  • On hand stock allows for over 25 bags to be premade, with easy reordering possible prior to the campaign's end to ensure production is ahead of schedule.
  • We are already communicating with the manufacturers for the patches and dice as to facilitate a quick turn around once the campaign ends.
  • There is a chance we could sell out of specific colours, but we will do our best to communicate in case of any inability to restock (should any of the fabrics be discontinued, for example).
  • Should we reach our goal, the campaign will stay active as long as we can continue to make the bags with any sort of speed.

Timeline*

*barring any complications, hopefully all items will be received by June's end.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't want a dice bag or patch, or don't have the money but still want to help?

  • Share, share, share! Boost our campaign wherever you can.
  • Join our Patreon! Exclusive content, updates, sneak peeks, it has the works.
  • Check out our website and follow us on Twitter and Facebook. 
  • Elevate marginalized voices and support marginalized creators.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Our Game's Story

Recipe Roundup is a card game whose purpose is to learn about the ingredients that make up delicious, healthy meals. Chefs collect the necessary ingredients to complete the perfect recipes. Ingredients are limited so the competition can be dicey. Chefs can strategically stock ingredients in their pantry, while others are left for their friends to “borrow”. If another Chef poaches your key ingredient, you’ll have to scramble or you’ll be in hot water. Chefs can expand their palette with new recipes, but beware of holding too many ingredients or you’ll be left holding the bag (of wasted food).

The origin story of Recipe Roundup begins on a cross-country road trip. Somewhere between the Rocky Mountains and the Great Lakes, amid the license plate games and existential questions, my then-not-yet-future-but-now wife inspired me to make a game about healthy food. It’s no coincidence that traveling inspired us to talk about food, as those are two ways we spend much of our free time. Traveling offers amazing opportunities to meet people, experience their traditions, and get a taste of their culture - especially through food!  Having been able to visit so many different countries shows how much people have in common, and also provides a refreshing new perspective on things close to home. You’ve probably eaten banana and pineapple, but have you seen a banana tree forest or pineapple fields? Did you know there are 7,500+ varieties of tomatoes? While we couldn’t fit all of them into this game, I hope that it sparks your curiosity to learn something new about your favorite foods, and maybe find some inspiration for a new recipe to test out.

Tiny Earth Games was founded by Robert Pierce in 2020 to develop games that use science and reason to instill a sense of wonder and purpose in the tiny Earth we call home. Recipe Roundup was developed in partnership with Amanda Barnes, Registered Dietitian Nutritionist (RDN).

The Cards

The Recipe Roundup box set of cards includes 60 ingredients, 40 recipes, and the rule book. Ingredient cards include the name, type (color coded in sets of 4), rarity/point value, photos (source and/or food), nutritional highlights, origin, and possible recipes. Recipe cards include name, difficulty/point value, photo, required ingredients, and bonus variations.

  

How to Play

Players score points for completed Recipes and lose points for anything unused. Each Ingredient and Recipe is assigned a point value (top right corner of the card) based on the rarity of the required Ingredients, as well as the demand for those Ingredients in the Recipes. Collected Ingredients that aren’t made into a Recipe are wasted in the players’ Kitchens. Points for wasted Ingredients are subtracted: wasting food is bad! The player with the most points at the end of the round (or several rounds) wins.

Recipe Roundup is a card game for two to four players, kids ages 8 and up, and each round takes about 30 to 45 minutes depending on the number of players.

Set-up:

Ingredient cards are shuffled and 6 cards are dealt to each player – their “Kitchen.” Players may keep up to 5 Ingredients in their hand - their “Pantry”, but any excess must be left face up – their “Counter.” The rest of the Ingredient deck is placed face down – the “Store.” The top card is flipped face up next to the Store. The Recipe deck is shuffled and 2 cards are dealt to each player. Players may keep all Recipes in their Pantry. The remaining Recipes are placed face down next to the Ingredients - the “Cookbook”.

Gameplay: 

Play starts to the left of the dealer, going clockwise.

Step 1. Prep: Players begin their turn by choosing to select Ingredients or Recipes. A player may select an Ingredient from the Store,

  • If a player chooses from the Store, they may either draw the 1 face up Ingredient, or 2 face down Ingredients into your Kitchen; or,
  • A player may borrow 1 Ingredient from any friend’s Counter. (Player may choose to place the Ingredient in their Pantry or Counter, but beware your friend borrowing it right back!).

Or, if a player selects Recipes, they draw 2 into their Pantry.

Step 2. Cook: When a player has collected the Ingredients to match the list of Ingredients on their Recipe, they can Cook their Recipe by playing their Ingredients and Recipe face up in front of them. Once Cooked, the Ingredients can’t be moved to any other Recipe or replaced by any other Ingredient.

Step 3. Clean up: Players end their turn by organizing their Kitchen, so that no more than 5 Ingredients are in the Pantry. The rest remain on the Counter for friends to borrow. Players may move Ingredients between the Pantry and the Counter.

Ending:

Play continues until the last Ingredient is selected from the Store. Then each player gets one final turn and last chance to cook.

Other games:

While the Ingredient cards are not a substitute for traditional playing cards, they do offer the opportunity to play other simple games, for example:

“Go Shopping!”: A take on “Go Fish!”, where players try to collect the 4-of-a-kind ingredients (nuts, tree fruits, etc.), rather than 4-of-a-kind numbers.

Spoons: Players pass the ingredient cards until they collect the 4-of-a-kind ingredients and grab a spoon, without being left behind.

Shipping

All shipping & handling costs will be added at checkout in addition to the perks levels. We're partnering with Indiegogo's packaging and fulfillment partner Easyship to provide you the lowest rates. Easyship is the leading crowdfunding shipping platform which allows us take advantage of their global supply chain services & expertise. Please ask about additional shipping information.

Risks and Challenges

The initial print proof served to correct errors in the printing process. The first edition has been printed already. Future editions should not have any issues but there is always potential for longer than normal quality control in mass production of new print runs.

The coronavirus shutdowns and restrictions could cause longer than normal shipping times.

story:
Catch The Letch is a fast and super fun card game that reached its goal on kickstarter in November 2019.  We are proposing this campaign for the ones that didn't manage to "catch" a copy of the game before and want to do now, because we want that as many as people possible can play the game and have fun with it!

The basics are simple: score 10 points and win the game! 

 (prototype deck)

8 friends decide to go on vacation together and challenge each other in a game: attract as many people as possible in a week! The winner will be elected "Queen of the Beach"!

Letches can be charmed by a girl with the characteristics they do like. If a girl has charmed one letch and than she looses a characteristic he likes, he will run away from her and go back to the beach. There are many tipes of letches:

EXAMPLE: 


 

Players will face each other in an epic battle for becoming the queen of the beach, and charm more letches than each other. You will imperson one of the 8 different girls, each with 3 main characteristics (boobies/butt, one-piece swimsuit/two-piece swimsuit and hair colours(red, blonde, brown, black) + suntan(extra one)). The main objective is to "catch" the letches on the board using this characteristics (letch has his own preferences).

But be wise, you can only play/discard one "action" card and charm only one letch using your "charm" ability  during your turn. Action cards make the difference, because they can make you charm more letches in a turn, interrupt other player's actions, make the letches charmed by others run away from them and come back to the beach (the neutral war zone) or simply steal them, enhance yourself, earn new characteristics and more.  As time passes more letches will come to the beach, so basically... The longer you play the greater your odds of winnning... Or loosing. But don't worry, Catch The Letch has been built with the idea of having fun and playing many many games in a short amount of time, with each game lenght of 20 minutes max (8 players), down to 10 minutes (2 players)! We decided to make a game for as many people as possible, because we have a lot of fun when we play toghether with friends, but sometimes we do even like to relax and have a fast game with one or two of them.

Catch The Letch started when Nicolò and Giacomo were driving home one night.  They started talking about having fun with friends, playing games, doing something in their lifes and... Suddenly... The two hamsters that lives in their heads had an idea! They said: 

N Hamster: "Listen, this two guys are game designers, they should create a game for their firends!"

G Hamster: "Nice idea, lets give them a hand!".

Aaaand so... Catch The Letch is born.

When we created the cards design we went along a long process: we tried separate counters for enhacements, additional cards in orther to mark changes into girls' characteristics, and even more. But we came along with the decision to make the game playable just with its own cards, so that you don't have to worry about loosing those little counters, pawns or dices, the ones the cat usually decides to hide from you into his purrfect world. Thats why cards like "Shampoo" or "Push-Up" have an unique icon on the left border, representing the characteristic of the girl that they are changing, so that you can put them directly under your character for clarity. Letchers cards are designed in the same way, so that they can be put one on top of the other with their preferences shown on the left. This is a clarity choice but it also helps you to play in many different places by saving space on the table.

For the love of seagulls, swimsuits and bounces let's gather all together and go to the beach one more time! Even if winter is coming!

- Giacomo and Nicolò (The Catch The Letch Team )
story_txt:
Catch The Letch is a fast and super fun card game that reached its goal on kickstarter in November 2019.  We are proposing this campaign for the ones that didn't manage to "catch" a copy of the game before and want to do now, because we want that as many as people possible can play the game and have fun with it!
The basics are simple: score 10 points and win the game! 

 (prototype deck)


8 friends decide to go on vacation together and challenge each other in a game: attract as many people as possible in a week! The winner will be elected "Queen of the Beach"!











Letches can be charmed by a girl with the characteristics they do like. If a girl has charmed one letch and than she looses a characteristic he likes, he will run away from her and go back to the beach. There are many tipes of letches:






EXAMPLE: 




 
Players will face each other in an epic battle for becoming the queen of the beach, and charm more letches than each other. You will imperson one of the 8 different girls, each with 3 main characteristics (boobies/butt, one-piece swimsuit/two-piece swimsuit and hair colours(red, blonde, brown, black) + suntan(extra one)). The main objective is to "catch" the letches on the board using this characteristics (letch has his own preferences).
But be wise, you can only play/discard one "action" card and charm only one letch using your "charm" ability  during your turn. Action cards make the difference, because they can make you charm more letches in a turn, interrupt other player's actions, make the letches charmed by others run away from them and come back to the beach (the neutral war zone) or simply steal them, enhance yourself, earn new characteristics and more.  As time passes more letches will come to the beach, so basically... The longer you play the greater your odds of winnning... Or loosing. But don't worry, Catch The Letch has been built with the idea of having fun and playing many many games in a short amount of time, with each game lenght of 20 minutes max (8 players), down to 10 minutes (2 players)! We decided to make a game for as many people as possible, because we have a lot of fun when we play toghether with friends, but sometimes we do even like to relax and have a fast game with one or two of them.


Catch The Letch started when Nicolò and Giacomo were driving home one night.  They started talking about having fun with friends, playing games, doing something in their lifes and... Suddenly... The two hamsters that lives in their heads had an idea! They said: 
N Hamster: "Listen, this two guys are game designers, they should create a game for their firends!"
G Hamster: "Nice idea, lets give them a hand!".
Aaaand so... Catch The Letch is born.

When we created the cards design we went along a long process: we tried separate counters for enhacements, additional cards in orther to mark changes into girls' characteristics, and even more. But we came along with the decision to make the game playable just with its own cards, so that you don't have to worry about loosing those little counters, pawns or dices, the ones the cat usually decides to hide from you into his purrfect world. Thats why cards like "Shampoo" or "Push-Up" have an unique icon on the left border, representing the characteristic of the girl that they are changing, so that you can put them directly under your character for clarity. Letchers cards are designed in the same way, so that they can be put one on top of the other with their preferences shown on the left. This is a clarity choice but it also helps you to play in many different places by saving space on the table.
For the love of seagulls, swimsuits and bounces let's gather all together and go to the beach one more time! Even if winter is coming!
- Giacomo and Nicolò (The Catch The Letch Team )

story:
The deluxe edition includes 25 custom made dice with Halfling inspired design illustrated by The Mico and 120 custom shaped wooden components. The custom dice and components will not be available in retail. However, they will be available in limited supply at conventions, through contests, online at the BGG promo store, and directly from our website/pre-order page.

Unlocked content from the previous campaign.

 

 

Rise to Nobility is a worker (dice) placement game set in The Five Realms, the same fantasy world as Cavern Tavern. At the beginning of each round, every player rolls 5 dice that represent their available actions in the game. The locations in the city have requirements for certain dice values. 

What’s Unique  

The challenging thing is that the total value of dice each player can use during the round is determined by their reputation in the city. Players start with 9 reputation and can increase or decrease their reputation by taking certain actions in the city. With numerous options for spending their dice, players will need to carefully plan their strategy and prioritize their actions.

Each player takes on the role of a landowner with a unique ability. Your goal is to rise from anonymity to the rank of lord. At the end of 10 rounds, the player with the most victory points takes over the head seat at the Stone Council and wins the game.

There are many paths for achieving victory.

Housing and Employing Settlers 

You can focus on increasing the population of the new city of Caveborn by housing the incoming Settlers. If you provide them with a house and spend the goods they require, they will pay you with victory points.

Once the Settlers are housed, you can boost the city's economy by employing your Settlers in the Guilds and by purchasing Workshops for them. Ensuring that you have Apprentices and Guild Masters who are loyal to you will earn you money, resources, and victory points.

Negotiating with the Stone Council

Of course you can choose to play politics and try to deal with the members of the Stone Council to gain victory points. Each race has a representative on the Stone Council. You will be rewarded if you fulfill the demands of a Councilor. But the other races will resent your display of favoritism, and your reputation will suffer, hindering your options in the city. 

Other Opportunities

If you’re low on money, you can sell your Goods at the port. And when you find yourself in tight spots, you can visit old reliable Berk the Town Clerk who can help you overcome some of your obstacles. 

And don’t forget the High Queen in the White Castle. You can request an audience with her to improve your reputation in the city.  

But your time to achieve your goals is limited, because representatives from all Five Realms are sailing to Caveborn to cast their vote for the new chairman of the Stone Council.  

So, do you have what it takes to become a respectful lord, help Caveborn flourish and prosper, and take your seat at The Stone Council? Are you ready to Rise to Nobility?

Here is a playthru video from Tantrum House.

 

We are using the Jamey Stegmaier method for fulfillment. We are going to ship the games from four fulfillment centers. One located in the United States, the second in the United Kingdom, third one in Australia and another in Canada. The game is US, EU, AUS and CAN friendly. 

US & UK - Free shipping

EU - $10

Macedonia, Norway and Switzerland - $10

Canada and Australia - $15

Rest of the world - $30

Final Frontier Games is a board game publishing company based in Skopje, Macedonia. Our goal is to bring friends and families closer together in fun and engaging ways. That’s why we make board games. Final Frontier Games was established in 2014 and so far has published two board games in Macedonia and one for international market. Rise to Nobility is our second international project.

Art by Mihajlo Dimitrievski - The Mico  

The beautiful art is done by The Mico, artist of Game of Thrones: Hand of the King, The North Sea Saga Trilogy, the Valeria card games and many more. Awesome human being and great artist!

 

 

Risks & Challenges

Long before we pushed the launch button, we made sure that every single detail had been addressed twice.

We want to assure you that we will handle everything from manufacturing to shipping and fulfilling with the highest level of professionalism. We are using the same manufacturer as we did with our previous game, so we can guarantee you that the final product will have high quality components and it will be manufactured on time as it was the case with Cavern Tavern.

For shipping we will cooperate with the same well proven fulfilling centers, who executed an excellent fulfillment with the previous campaign. With our hard work and dedication together with the professionalism of these manufacturing and fulfillment partners we managed to deliver the product to every home one month earlier than promised. Now that we are even more experienced we feel confident that we can deliver Rise to Nobility in an even shorter period of time.

If an issue do occurs, we promise we'll inform you and be transparent on how we are going to resolve it.

story:
The Charles Dickens Tarot is based on the structures and understandings generally accepted as intrinsic to the Rider/Waite Tarot. The images in the deck are derived from works of art created during the 19th Century. The characters portrayed are based on the most famous and memorable characters from Charles Dickens' numerous novels and stories. Unlike most Tarot decks, the Charles Dickens Tarot is formatted horizontally rather than vertically, to facilitate multiple characters within environs and more in keeping with the shape of an opened book. 

Because Dickens is a thematic writer and not a symbolist, and rather than clutter up the cards needlessly, I have done away with the particular suit symbols, reducing them to their respective elements – Fire, Water, Air, & Earth. The suits are kept separate and made quite clear with thick distinctive colour & motif coded borders all their own.  

  As the old appellations of Knight and Page etc. held little resonance in Dickens' work or era, I have replaced the standard Court card titles with ones far more appropriate: Father, Mother, Son, & Daughter. In this way, the proper balance between male and female is made explicit, whereas it is ambiguous in the R/W. It also underscores Dickens' focus on the family.  

 

 The most popular literary celebrity of all time, Dickens had a unique relationship with the people. What's more, he actively engaged in social matters of his day. This allows for special focus to be placed on his real life in the Major Arcana. Because he used real people, events, and issues of pressing social concern in his novels, a unique dialectical blend of fact and fiction is achieved in the Major Arcana, deepening each Major Arcanum's meanings individually and as a whole.

 

 

  To accompany The Charles Dickens Tarot, a special 376-page companion book is being written and published. In it, the meaning of each card is explained. Not your average "little white book", The Charles Dickens Tarot companion key is a 6 x 9 trade paper format book which contains detailed background on Charles Dickens' life and works as well as full-colour reproductions of the cards and related images from the Victorian era.  

 The cards have been proofed and corrected thanks to an initial test run, and are ready to be printed by the manufacturer. They are large format, 3.5" x 5.75"; the stock is 300gsm; each deck comes in a unique shrink-wrapped 2-piece box.

A website is currently under construction and much of the deck can be viewed here.  

 Thank you for your interest, and please share with anyone who appreciates the Tarot, the novels of Charles Dickens, or 19th Century art.

story:
WE SHIP TO ALL COUNTRIES! 

SHIPPING WILL BE ADDED SEPERATELY FROM THE PERKS, AFTER THE CAMPAIGN!

Above are our best estimates, but due to changes in some backer's regions, they may alter a little. Backers will be sent a survey from our pledge manager asking for their shipping address. The pledge manager will calculate their shipping and add it to their cart on check out.

https://c1.iggcdn.com/indiegogo-media-prod-cld/image/upload/c_limit,w_695/v1605956011/yqkp9hl65qxfymbmqv2t.jpg

 

Risks and challenges

We have already finished most of the artwork, and gameplay is already completed. We have secured a manufacturer to produce the game, as well as fulfillment companies to ship out the rewards. In the event that there will be any delays or issues with manufacturing, shipping, or something else, we promise to communicate honestly with you and work to resolve any problems immediately.
